review.reviewText: The location is wonderful ease to get in and out of the city first class and the view from the room outstanding

We were their for a few days. Enjoyed the amenities and staff. Concierge very helpful. The restaurant food isn't the best and it's extremely over priced. Over all though the hotel experience was nice. FYI they charge for wifi usage, and any toiletries used..

review.title: Great hotel in a nice area of the city.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great Bay view on floor 22. Pool, hot tub and gym were excellent. Used uber to get around easily. Nice bar on first floor. Great service and free Wi-Fi when you sign up for free as a hotel group member. Beds were beautiful. The hotel was everything we wanted and needed.

review.title: Loved the accessibility to all the amenities
review.reviewText: Loved being in the middle of downtown. There is all sorts of shops near by. Loved my stay

review.title: Great but expensive
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice located, but all the services are too expensive. 40 bucks for a breakfast, 62 for parking is too much.

review.title: consierge staff so helpful
review.reviewText: Great stay, great staff, rooms are nice and beds are so comfy. A little on the edge of things. Consierge staff was friendly, knowledgable and made our touristy trip a winner.

review.title: friendly staff and beautiful bathrooms
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice with friendly staff who greeted us every time we entered and helped us at any time we needed it. Bathrooms were beautiful! Nice bar for drinks.

review.title: Very accommodating
review.reviewText:
My family and I stayed there, and I ended up getting sick. The concierge was fabulous, he called the hotel doctor and I was able to see the doctor at 10 pm.
   They helped us with dinner reservation at 9:30 on Saturday night and got us museum passes. 
  They people at the spa were also very accommodating , they put extra eucalyptus in the steam and shower fro me. If I had to be sick while traveling, it was a good place to do so!

review.title: Big, impersonal, pricy
review.reviewText: For $300 a night--which I consider to be a luxury hotel price--we got a spacious room that was decently clean. Nothing more. Everything from bottled water to Internet access comes for a fee, and there were no little service extras that would have made it feel like a luxe experience. No turndown. No amenity. There was some food gunk on my used bath towel, from when my nephew wiped his hands on it, and housekeeping just hung it back up instead of replacing it with a clean one. The bathtub drain didn't work either. And the bath products brand was a cheap no-name. By contrast, we are staying at a place that costs $50 less this week, and that hotel gave us a welcome gift of 2 small bottled waters + a granola bar upon arrival, plus $10 credit toward the restaurant/bar. So tiny, but it makes a difference.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge staff were great, and the staff notary helped me tremendously with some paperwork.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping staff need to pay more attention
review.locationRemarks: I believe it's adjacent to Moscone. Also, a couple minutes walk to Yerba Buena or Fifth & Market. Go the wrong direction and you're in the projects

review.title: Interior A bit dated.
review.reviewText: Location is at the quiet area, suggest water bottle in the room foc

review.title: Fantastic

review.title: Decent hotel but definitely not 4.5 stars
review.reviewText: Had a long weekend stay here.  Overall the hotel was fine but really nothing special and at the lower end of the INtercontinental chain.
review.positiveRemarks: COnvenient location albeit a bit of a rough neighbourhood
review.negativeRemarks: Many points of maintenance need to be addressed.  Peels in the bathroom and the room are not acceptable at this level.
review.locationRemarks: Steps to cable car start, union square etc.  A modest walk to Moscone center and MOMA.

review.title: Outdated bathrooms

review.title: Walking distance to everything

review.title: My favorite hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I frequently travel to SF and this is my favorite hotel.  I always enjoy staying here.
review.positiveRemarks: New, super nice, close to BART & muni.  Walk to AT&T Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive, but you get what you pay for.  More K-cups in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Try Dottie's True Blue Cafe.  An bike share rack is right in front of the hotel, bring your own helmet.

review.reviewText: Hotel staff is extremely nice.  Everyone was very courteous and helpful!  Nelson, the concierge, and Anna and May, at check-in,  were ones that offered special attention during my stay.  Great location--it is within walking distance of the greatest shopping center.  I love that!  I would definitely recommend the hotel, and I would stay here again.

review.title: Excellent location - excellent service and comfort
review.reviewText: Great location - absolutely wonderful customer service- totally luxurious feeling.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Everything - it was smack downtown San Francisco

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: In comparison to other hotels we stayed in, this was wonderful. The rooms were clean, the staff was helpful, check in and out was a breeze. Pool was nice, and inside. Lots of towels, goggles provided (awesome) water provided in the gym, and it was good. We managed to get locked out of our room, they escorted us up with our new keys to make sure there were no further problems. We can't complain about anything.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: near everything necessary

review.title: Luxury optional
review.reviewText: This hotel provides excellent customer service and has all of the amenities of a high class hotel. As expected, those amenities come at a fairly high price. That being said, ALL of San Francisco is highly priced.

review.title: Professional Stay
review.reviewText: Beds sleep like a cloud.  Very nice stay.  Next door to Moscone Center and mall.

review.title: Quiet refuge in a noisy place
review.reviewText: The hotel is very business-like. I would stay there if I were visiting SF on business instead of on holiday.  To the effect, the rooms were almost sound proof and perfect for a good night's sleep. The hotel staff was beyond curteous but not annoyingly so. My stay was peasant and relaxing, even if it was only for one night.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Nice location to all the shopping and  attraction
review.reviewText: We were on business that took place in Oakland, this hotel is very close to the freeway to get on the Baybridge to Oakland, easy to walk to shopping, restaurants and attractions. Great visit in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping centers
review.reviewText: We were greeted by May in the reception desk. She was just exceptional. Not only her but  all staff from the conceirge to the bell boy to the crew at the breakfast restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room we were in. We had the nice view of San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: The location is very ideal for us. It is just few steps to my cousins' place and to the bloomingdale shoppong mall where i usually shop.

review.title: It is not 4.5 star
review.reviewText: Right when we walked into the room, it was warm and the carpet has some "stuff" on the floor.  The bathroom and faucet issue, super hot or super cool water only.  The location of the room and by the ice room and it was loud.  Very disappointed
review.negativeRemarks: simple clean the room

review.reviewText: Hotel was fine but I was there for a short stay and did not interact with staff much, however, the bit I did, they were very nice.

review.title: Nice hotel good location

Very clean. Centralized. Good staff. Overpriced water bottles.

review.title: Nice location

review.title: Nice hotel very good located
review.reviewText: It was a nice staying, good food and drink, comfort

review.title: Great hotel close to museums
review.reviewText: Stylish and well run Hotel. Central location for walking in downtown SF. Very friendly staff . Used swimming with grand children. Nice outdoor terrace. We went to opening of SFMOMA twice and other museums in area. Cable car station . Chinatown.

review.title: 888 HOW-WERID Street
review.reviewText: We check-in'ed 3hour early which was fantastic. Room amazing, views great, valet easy, TV massive. We left and returned after 5hours to a insane street festival on the same street (Howard St) blocked off at most streets so getting back to our hotel was a nightmare. We think staff should have advised us prior to our arrival or at our departure. Otherwise, it was great. Corners still filled with homeless (as San Fran is) but was very clean looking. We wanted to extend but the prices mid-week were out of control.

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff and service was great! The Hotel was close To the Bart and bus line. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend intercontinental SanFrancisco hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, but...
review.reviewText: Everything was pretty typical about an intercontinental hotel except maintenance of the hotel must have taken a backseat.  Only hot water came out of the faucets and shower.  Maintenance didn't know why but acknowledged the issue since even the toilets were filling with scalding water.  After not being able to shower the hotel didn't offer any concessions.

review.title: Bathroom toilet wasn't flushed...
review.reviewText: The fact that the toilet wasn't flushed leads me to believe it wasn't fully cleaned to begin. The beds weren't super comfortable. Staff was very nice and we were willing to answer any questions about the city.
review.locationRemarks: good area if you want to shop! transportation to the piers is also great.

review.title: Upscale and close to just about everything to do!
review.reviewText: Outstanding check in experience.  The room was better than expected, and very large.  Comfortable bed and very nice bathroom/shower.  The concierge service was quite helpful, and we enjoyed a small local eatery close by that we otherwise would never have found.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar menu price was lower than what they actually charged us for drinks--that was a small irritant, and they wouldn't change the price!
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.reviewText:
Good very nice,

Great bar in the lobby. Great service and hospitality

review.title: Excellent in every way

We were a bit delayed getting to the hotel as  their was a presidential visit and access was not easy.  However, the staff was wonderful and accommodating.

Jim
Great location near the Moscone Convention Center. Good, clean, quality hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great hotel a short walk from Union Square.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were friendly, polite and a pleasure to deal with.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel by mistake, intending to go to the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental instead.  Turns out it was a great mistake because I was closer to my venue and the hotel was amazing!  Best hotel I've stayed in honestly.
Stay was fabulous- staff was more re than friendly!!  Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Hotel Staff Response !!
review.reviewText:
Had a really bad  experience with couple fighting for many hours....before hotel staff finally did something about it.....had to call 3 times to complaint.
Not a very  good experience....

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Hotel bar and lobby ok but underwhelming for a hotel of this standard. Room nice with view. Hotel parking overpriced. Only a couple of blocks from Union square so location ok. Noticeable increase in homeless people around the area and city in general.

review.title: Does very well with what is has.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay, but glad I brought earplugs.  The only negative:  This room, #3009 (perhaps adjacent rooms, also?) is in a spot where we could hear the whine of the elevator mechanisms/wheels cables, so every time the elevators were used (which is a LOT), we heard the high pitched whine.  It is not THAT loud and only bugged me at bedtime.  I had to put in ear plugs to get to sleep, but other than that, a very nice room and view!  The South of Market/Yerba Buena location is convenient to many activities/sights, especially if you like shopping and the cable cars.  Nob Hill and Chinatown were reached by foot in decent time. The farmer's market at the Ferry Building is fabulous, and in walking distance.  Unless you're a serious walker, Fisherman's Wharf/Ghirardelli/Alcatraz are better accessed by taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: View; it's close to most things we like to do/eat/explore.  On Sunday afternoon, their town car got us to the airport in about 15 minutes!
review.locationRemarks: South of Market/Yerba Buena; 2 blks from shopping/Union Square/Cable cars! Close enough walk 2 Ferry bldg and Chinatown. Very far from Wharf, however.

review.title: hands down Hyatt is my favorite
review.reviewText: Check in staff was new however she was patiently assisted by her co-worker and this made me feel good because he was being genuine and ensuring his new coworker had the same info he had: it ensures continuity
review.userLocation: san francisco native newly transplanted to az

review.title: Very Nice hotel. Modern and beautiful!
review.reviewText: Everyone was very nice and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Good location but too far from Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge or Financial District to walk.

review.title: nice, middle of city
review.reviewText: i stayed for night only, didnt have time to enjoy hotel facilities
review.positiveRemarks: near bart, near sanfran. cable car, near westfield mall

review.reviewText: The hotel is excellent and the staff are courteous. The restaurant provides high quality staff and food.  My only issue is the location is OK but not the greatest.
Great hotel.  Can be considered a bit out of the way if you are not part of a convention.
Great room. Used the gym at midnight, and it was clean and quiet.

review.title: Nice hotel but lacking in many ways
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located in the business district and the rooms are very comfortable and clean.  However for the price I was expecting more amenities and service.  No coffee or water available in the lobby you have to pay for everything extra.  The glass used on the building is not energy efficient, so when the curtains were opened the room heated up very quickly and was cold at night.  Unit and room worked well enough so was able to keep comfortable as long as the curtains remained closed.   The $54 plus tax a night for parking seems a bit excessive for guests, even in that part of town.  The staff was ok usually at getting the valet parked cars but at times had to wait 15-20 mins.  Word of advise, always call ahead.  Too many smokers hanging out by the front doors   They need a better area away from the entry for the smokers  Area provided in the garage was not easily accessible and was cold and dark so no one used it.  They should separate families from other groups so there are quiet floors.  During our stay there were numerous noisy children running around the halls and making noise at early hours before 8AM.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed and bedding were very nice and comfortable.  Always plenty of hot water in the shower.  Great views of the city and convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby is not very inviting, need to add some coffee and water access throughout the day.   Parking fees are excessive for guests.  Smoking area update
review.locationRemarks: Great location, tons of restaurants and activities nearby

review.reviewText:
Very expensive parking fee for hotel guests 
54 dollars a night

review.title: Stylish international hotel
review.reviewText: Expert service enhanced our one night stay.

review.title: very disappointing. horrible service and exp.
review.reviewText: First and probably last time to stay in Intercontinental hotels.  Good facilities(because it's a new hotel), but terrible services.  Charged $5(includes $3 deliver fee) when my wife asked for a small regular apple.  Charge $3 on any food delivery!! Have you ever heard about that?! from a big hotel like Intercontinental.  And it took them 20 minutes to deliver it.  And my wife called to order some food at 9 PM, and they told my wife that she has to wait for another 2 hours because they are busy. No kidding!  Whole night (even 4 or 5 am) and morning, we heard people talking, noise and BANG BANG huge door slam sound every few minutes.  First I thought it's just unlucky to have bad neighbors, but turned out to be the hotel staff.  I love traveling and I travel few times every year.  I will not recommend Intercontinental to anyone from now on since my friend also had very bad experience in another Intercontinental hotel and there are so many other choices.  By the way, pillows are way too soft.
review.negativeRemarks: S E R V I C E S!!!
review.locationRemarks: close to city centre

review.title: Modern high rise
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay.  In S F to enjoy the city Christmas atmosphere.  Check in and out was quick and simple.  Elevators fast.  Everything fine.  The coffee shop around the corner on 5Th is very good.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel to walk to many different site seeing, shopping and dining locations.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds and well-located close to everything.

review.title: Great hotel within walking distance to many places
review.reviewText: Concierge and all the staff are super super friendly. Nice hotel within walking distance to Bart, cable car, downtown, restaurants, major department stores, childrens creativity center, whole foods and many other places. HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Great hotel. The only parking option available is valet parking and it's expensive. Great city views with floor to ceiling windows.

review.title: Okay hotel for good location but poor parking
review.reviewText:
In general the room was good and hotel was located near to busy Market St, which is good. (for looking around and shopping)
The bad part is that they offer valet parking at terrible rate $53. A better way would be street parking if found available nearby, or at "5th & mission garage" which is one block away (daily rate is $34 or something)
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy room and large flat TV.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Westfield shopping center is a block away. Subway is also close so that the transit would be comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown/shopping
review.reviewText: Great service ranging from front desk/bellman/room service! Very comfortable bed and amazing view. I almost didn't want to leave my room :)
review.positiveRemarks: Service was great and room was very clean and comfortable
review.locationRemarks: Lot of shopping/dining within 2 blocks

review.title: Great hotel, good location

review.locationRemarks: Good location, 5 min walk to Powell station, 10 min to Union street, half an hour to Ferry Building.

review.title: Great TV to watch the Bears beat the Packers
review.reviewText: Room was perfect for our Thanksgiving night resting place.  And the TV was huge and perfect to watch the game.  Great location!
Great hotel. Club level was well worth it. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels in San Francisco ..I highly recommend a Stay if your ever in the city

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the location, the room, the view, the hot tub and pool. I'll be back.

review.title:
Nice hotel 
Close to shops
review.reviewText:
Great hotel beautiful view!! 
Staff was friendly 
The kids had a good time in the pool
Very family friendly

review.title: Good location with attractions within walking dist
review.reviewText:
My wife and I live close by and decided to stay at the Interconti SF for one night because of a party we attended South of Market.
Valet parking was excellent, although a bit pricey at $61/nite. Check-in was flawless. Receptionist polite and professional. Room was ready at noon, even though check-in is 3pm. 
Overall, the room is nothing special. It was clean and bright, but you have to pay for almost everything. Coffee maker is free, but drinking water is not. TV is super large. Nice big window with view to the Bay.

Staff overall was very pleasant. We had a sandwich at the bar, which was delicious. 

There is an indoor pool and jacuzzi. It's clean, but could use some personality, like plants, etc. It feels somewhat cold and sterile. The gym is large and nicely equipped.

Overall experience was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very service oriented and professional. Lobby is open and bright.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool area could use some "color". It feels cold and sterile. Room service breakfast menu is very basic.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Westfield Mall and Moscone Center. The "Grove" on 3rd and Mission is a great place to have breakfast.

review.title: Awesome hotel with amazing service.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for Halloween. I expected loud ruckus given the holiday but the walls are surprisingly insulated and we had no issues. Highly recommend staying here due to its great staff and amazing location.

review.title: Reunion of friends from univesity
review.reviewText: Three university friends now living across the world got together at the Intercontinental on Howard Street. We were comfortable and felt safe and the hotel staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. The concierge services were the best I have experienced - from ticket bookings to recommendations. Breakfast buffet at Luce is a real treat.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of the hotel was central and allowed us to walk to Union Square and even China town. The concierge services were the best I have experienced.
review.locationRemarks: Take the hop-on-hop off bus to tour the city. Lots of shopping at the Westfield Mall and on Mission and Market Streets.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION!!
review.reviewText: The staff at check in was great as are the views and location

Booked manicure in spa - staff were INCREDIBLY unhEclogue receptionist with an attitude and a very snotty masseuse.

Bell hop was very helpful

photos.caption: "Petals" joined us for dinner at Lucè's

review.title: Very nice hotel. I would stay again!
review.reviewText: Everything was absolutely perfect at this hotel! My young daughter was presented with a brand new Monkey Beanie Baby when we checked in late in a Friday night. She was absolutely thrilled and carried that little monkey everywhere. Everything else followed suit!
Eexcellent in all respects. The buffet breakfast is spectacular.

review.title: Nice hotel in SOMA
review.reviewText: Most hotels have a poor excuse for an exercise room/gym.  This place has a large room with a lot of bikes,, free weights/dumbbells and some stationary exercise machines.  More than I expected and they have a lap pool and a spa also.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: In SOMA

review.title: One of my favorite hotels in SF
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Intercontinental several times.  The hotel is very new & modern.  Its proximity to BART & muni are a big plus for me.  I can walk to AT&T Park & K&L wines.  There's even a Bay Area Bike Share rack right in front of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Free internet, too expensive for most.
review.locationRemarks: Try Dottie's True Blue Cafe, but get there early.  Always busy.

review.title: Great hotel and location!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location was perfect - in walking distance to the shopping district, and super close to the night clubs. I will definitely book this hotel again in the near future.
They charged me half of the total amount "in error" although everything was prepaid and I am still waiting for refund.

review.title: Ideal hotel for business trips
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay, seems like a better location for business clientele vs family with small children

review.title: Stay Elsewhere in SF
review.reviewText: This is a new but very disappointing hotel. Service, overall, is benign neglect.  No one cares, no one pays attention.  Feather and garbage in elevator lobby on my room floor when I left at 8-9am was still there when I returned around 5 pm.  I had to call housekeeping and ask they vacuum the floor.  The gym is not very clean, no one is cleaning up in the place, and cups, towels and weights are left lying around.  The pool is a joke.  It has no space to lounge in the pool - spa area.  The spa looked disgusting - certainly avoidance material. I developed a significant head cold/sinus problem.  Now I drove to SF so it wasn't plane air.  The problems left when I left the hotel.  SF has plenty of hotels - you shouldn't stay at this one.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything that I complained about.
review.locationRemarks: I also would not stay in the SOMA area again. Not enough in the way of bars, restaurants and Starbucks in immediate vicinity.

review.title: extra charge
review.reviewText: i booked a deluxe room  and paid $30 for 3rd adult already.   it indicated roll-away bed is a/v and allows 4 guests.   but when i checked in,  they said i need to pay $80 more for upgrade then rollaway could be installed.  also parking charge is as high as $54,  almost 15%-20% extra on the hotel rate.   Disappointing!
review.negativeRemarks: no more "hidden" charge

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. No complaints other then housekeeping. We pressed the "make up room" button upon leaving the hotel for the day. Returned at 5 pm and our room was still not made. Since we had to get ready for a banquet, we had to ask and wait for housekeeping to bring us toiletries and towels. A little bit of an inconvenience.  Otherwise, great hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Very convenient, updated rooms and clean
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping consistency. I stayed three nights and only received mouthwash twice. My used wine glass was taken away but not replaced.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Intercontinenal Hotel San franciso, Excellent!!
review.reviewText:
Hi, I was 3 days at Intercontinental San francisco. This Hotel have a great location and Excellent Services. 
The only disappointment its was the wifi Service. Cuz, You have to paid for it.
review.locationRemarks: Its the center of Downtown SFO

review.reviewText: Awesome hotel. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

review.title: Really nice hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel in SF is like those in NYC, really overpriced usually, and sometimes the star-rating got degraded when you actually get inside your room (sometimes not so good, like the W). But this one has really good location and facility, also everything is roomy and comfortable. Nothing special, just so you know. It's not like a hotel with exquisite furnitures or lamps or chairs, but the general quality is a solid five star, well at least for SF.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Easy check in.  Friendly staff. Good location. Recommend highly.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Not in the heart on downtown which would be too crowded but not far from it either. Easy to walk to shopping. Less traffic.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.  Easy to walk around neighborhood.

review.title: Loved it!!!
review.reviewText: Usually we stay at Hyatt Embarcadero but we decided to try the Intercontinental.   We loved it!   The Hyatt has lost us a loyal fans.  we will now stay here every time we are in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms we a bit hot when we arrived.   that being said, it was 90 degrees outside.

review.title: Nice hotel, new and modern. Close to shopping.
review.reviewText:
Family visit to San Francisco. Plenty to do and see. Many attractions within walking distance. Didn't have any issues and was very happy with the location and amenities. 
The concierge were very helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants and helped withmaking reservations.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Well located to conference area and downtown. Needed to take cabs or tram to site seeing areas. Good food nearby for range of costs.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant was incredibly expensive for breakfast.

review.title: The Intercontinental is outstanding for location a
review.reviewText: I found it to be a great experience! Convenient location, sparkling clean and friendly competent staff combine to make this a wonderful delight.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the location as well as the superb quality of the rooms and common areas made this a delightful experience.
review.locationRemarks: One can shop at all levels to short blocks away on Market street; there are luxury stores and also discount stores.

review.title: Centrally located.
review.reviewText: Close to public transport. Enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff. Very quiet.

review.title: Nice hotel, staff was very helpful and friendly,
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, not in the best part of town though. The staff was great.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
At first I was very excited about the hotel as the pictures online were really beautiful with all the glass and panoramic view. However, when we checked in to our hotel room, it was a little disappointing as our room hardly resembled any of the pictures I had seen online.
Still it was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast at this hotel was fabulous.
review.locationRemarks: It was a good location. Close to the shops as well as union square. Very nice.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Keep doing what you are doing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square - great place to get around San Fran from

review.title: Clean modern hotel.
review.reviewText:
Very nice rooms. Clean, recently renovated and spacious. Lovely city views from 22nd floor. Very quiet. Bed was super comfy and linens were clean. The bathroom was modern and spotless. We had two adjoining rooms. 

Maid service was excellent. Front desk staff was helpful and courteous. They accommodated a last minute request for an extra room on a overbooked summer weekend with aplomb. They also worked overtime to fix a billing snafu with Expedia. 

The gym was clean and large with a suitable range of treadmills, ellipticals and machines. The 6th floor pool was a bit small but there was a nice adjacent hot tub and a beautiful, large outdoor deck.

review.title: Typical Business Hotel. No Surpise (Good or Bad)
review.reviewText: I stayed there for 3 nights. Everything was pretty much as expected, from comfort, cleaniness, to services. The bed was comfortable with plenty of decent pillows. Bathroom was clean and relatively new. However, there was no bathtub for a relaxing bath after a long day. As a whole, the hotel staff was professional and cordial. All in all, there is no "Wow" or "Very Nice" moment; at the same time, there is no "I am not coming back" moment neither.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a bit out-of-the-way for leisure travelers but fine for business ones. Note: The large garage across the street is a big plus for all.

review.reviewText: Just an over night stop but very nice! We had a great view from our room and the staff was very kind and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!
Great stay, great location, but some cleanliness opportunities.

review.title: 1ST class all the way
review.reviewText:
not only was the hotel outstanding but the restaurant Luce was superb !  Every staff person was gracious and efficient.

I am a fourth generation San Franciscan who will be staying a few days a week in "the city" til Oct.  and this will be my new Home....be sure to sign up for the Ambassador program!
review.locationRemarks: SF is a very easy city to navigate....look in the "pink section" of the Sunday paper or on-line for fun things to do.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Great location, within walking distance of shopping, Chinatown

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: The intercontinental is a beautiful hotel with lovely and very helpful staff. It's very clean and has great facilities. I was greeted with a warm welcome from the hotel staff as soon as I stepped out of the taxi. The location is great, very close to everything!

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Great location to go shopping, see the trolley cars, catch the bus to Fishermans Wharf, and walk to near by restaurants. Amazing staff! Friendliest concierge I've encountered! Parking is pricey and the pool quite cold but overall great hotel and I'd stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel, great staff, near cable cars
review.reviewText: Staff is super attentive ( be prepared with tip money)  Our tub broke and maintenance was there in what seemed like 5 min. Flat.  I imagine they sprinted to our room.  Parking is 60$ per night but if you park behind the hotel on 5th and mission only $34. Pool is way too small for family stays (lap pool) and was always crowded.

review.title: Exceptional hotel, worth every penny.
review.reviewText: Great hotel worth the splurge. Near convention center and stores without being on the congested side of Market Street. Took the train from the airport for $8.95 the ride is about 40 minutes. Everyone from the concierge to the bellman gave great recommendations. When to walk versus taking a cab or directions to the train.  Ate at Denny's or fruit from Target around the corner for breakfast, splurged on lunch and dinners. Brenda's Soul Food is worth the wait. Check the weather before you come. It is cold in the summer.  Take the cable car at off hours the line is endless during the day. Sign up for Alcatraz before you come. The tour is wonderful if you are a history buff. Walk Golden Gate bridge before 9:00pm, the bridge closes at night and they have bad signage about this. Ghiradelli has a ice cream shop near Market street that does not have the same crowds as the one near the bridge. Took wine tour from hotel it is 20 degrees warmer outside the city. Research the wineries and find out what type of wine they give for tasting. I like sweet, but they seem to have a lot of dry white and red in Napa and Sonoma. Enjoy.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: Very close to great dining and an IMAX theater is right across the street.

review.title: A Room With A View
review.reviewText:
I booked a room at the intercontinental for my 60th Birthday celebration in San Francisco.  We arrived early and were able to check in with the kindness of everyone at the hotel. My guest noticed a high number of security people and questioned what was going on.  Turns out President Obama would be staying at the hotel that night. 
The hotel had left a letter in our room explaining what was going on and what they were doing to make our stay as comfortable as possible despite having to go through security check points and metal detectors.  There was a perimeter set up a full block away from the entrance to the hotel.  They ran golf carts back and forth to take guests in who couldn't or didn't want to walk.  Every hotel employee thanked us for our patience and we appreciated all they were doing to less on inconvenience.  
Our room was immaculately clean, beautifully furnished and had a fantastic view of the bay.  We were treated with respect, we felt to be valued customers and everything was perfect despite the limitations necessary during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks:
Earnest, the doorman who shuttled us, helped us find our way and gave us bottled water for our trip.  
He was kind, attentive and charismatic.
review.negativeRemarks: Notihng!
review.locationRemarks: Only a couple of blocks off of Market St and all the shopping.  We ate at Umbria and the Daily Grill both a short walking distance and both excellent.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Enjoyed it tremendously.  Walking distance to everywhere!  Unsightly trash abounds but most cities in America have that, and the homeless don't help, but don't hassle you much either.

First impression was very good, until somebody opened the door of our room. It was only 10 minutes after we first open the door and two individuals opened the door with a legit card key issues by the front desk ( mistakenly). We clarified the mistake, but than our keys got cancelled and we could not open our room!!! Hotel staff admitted their stupid mistakes, and provided us with a free breakfast. Besides the two incidents, good experience.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean. Convienient, close to the BART, shops and clubs.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Three night stay for leisure, the hotel is located next door to convention centre  and a large convention was on .... And they took over everything ... Bar, restaurant, foyer ... Which was annoying.  Room Service was slow and the food was cold when it arrived.  Overall the hotel was very good but not for the leisure traveller when large conventions are on.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Overall we were very happy with this hotel.   The room was great.  Bar nice.  Great restaurant in the hotel.  Elevators are fast.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive.  Some of the TVs did not work in the exercise area.
review.locationRemarks: MOMA nearby and shopping.

review.title: Beautiful facility
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in the SOMA district of SF. Immaculate, towering building. Reminds me of exclusive hotels that you normally find in NYC.
review.positiveRemarks: Fantastic corner room with floor to ceiling windows on both sides. Additional floor to ceiling window in the bathroom. Very comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: $54 for valet parking is a bit overpriced, even for SF.
review.locationRemarks: SOMA (South of Market Area) district in SF. The Irish pub across the street (Chieftan) is great for a beer and food.

review.title: A great hotel! The staff were great!
review.reviewText: Fantastic all the way front the front of the hotel to room service. Will stay again next time Dodgers play the Giants.
review.negativeRemarks: ? nothing right now. If it's not broken don't fix it.
review.locationRemarks: Close to AT&T ballpark.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
I recently stayed at the hotel for business, the hotel was nice the Luce restaurant in the hotel is very good and the free shampoo and conditioner were GREAT. My only negatives are:

1) The hotel pool is VERY cold, I ended up sitting in their spa instead - this was a little disappointing.
2) Air conditioning in my room was positioned at the end of one of my beds, which meant when it kicked in I got warm air blown in my face waking me up. It mean I had to sleep in the other bed (furthest from the window). My colleague who also stayed in this hotel did not have the same layout.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean, staff were very friendly and lovely free shampoo and conditioner.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel pool temperature. Layout of the room so the air con is not a the bottom of the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurant in the hotel, close to the centre.

review.title: Very caring staff
review.reviewText: We had an illness (food poisoning) during our stay and had to have the room cleaned.  The staff cleaned it immediately and we also got a call from the management later to check on the status and if there were anything else we needed.  The room was great, conveniently located near the Westfield Center and Moscone Convention Center.
review.positiveRemarks: No. 1 is the staff.  They couldn't have been nicer.  The room was nice and modern with good air conditioning and a comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: It's very close to the Bart Powell Street Station which I used to go to and from airport.  The Westfield Center is close by and all of the stores on M

review.reviewText: It was a pretty nice stay.  Outside of the black hairs stuck on the shower wall, it was really nice.  I would definitely recommend it.

review.title: Best hotel for giants fans
review.reviewText: Hands down one of the better hotel for its price. Super clean rooms with friendly staff and valet parking. Only down side is that they charge you for using the business center.

What you would expect from a more expensive hotel. Quiet and elegant surroundings; staff very polite and helpful. They let me check in early. Gave the room a slightly lower rating since the bathroom sink was messed up and only super hot water came out, weird. Keurig machine in the room was appreciated. But they do charge you for wifi--in SF??
review.locationRemarks: Great Vietnamese restaurant only a block away.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and quiet! The staff and bar employees were SO nice and so attentive. Walking distance to downtown was a plus. Beds were super comfy and the rooms were nice and clean.
Got it done.  Good gym and clean and efficient all around.

review.title: Good location for shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and entrance are well maintained staffed. The check in was a bit slow but everyone working there was very professional and nice. Hotel is in a decent location with plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in was a bit slow. Parking is too expensive. Plenty of alternate parking options nearby, however.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is in a decent location with plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Pier 39.
review.reviewText: Upon arriving from the very beginning, our trip was perfect.  The valet, guest check-in staff was very welcoming and super friendly.  Not to mention, all the other staff we dealt with was also great.  The indoor pool and spa was very well in order; very clean and stacked with the necessities. The Buffett breakfast was exceptional with a variety of choices.  We will definitely be returning at your convenience.
review.positiveRemarks: Set in Downtown San Francisco, where the views are exceptional.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could be a little bit more competitive with price.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39

review.title: Very nice hotel centrally located in the city.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but parking was quite expensive.  I would recommend parking in the structure at 5th and Mission, which is half the price of hotel parking, but only a short walk away.
review.positiveRemarks: Great view from our 20th floor room.
review.locationRemarks: We visited San Francisco State University, Golden Gate Park, Presidio Park and Land's End.  All were easy to get to.

review.title: parking charge 61.56usd one night
review.reviewText: everything wanted to charge an extra. Wifi,parking etc.

review.title: Not value for money
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and comfortable and in a good location but very overpriced. Wifi is only free if you sign up to become a member of intercontinental hotels and the bottled water in the room is chargeable at 8 dollars!! The staff were nice and room was ok but nothing special for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: the location next to moscone centre and union square
review.negativeRemarks: wifi should be free, bottled water should be free or more reasonably priced in the room

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Staff was wonderful! They printed out a list of "things to do with kids" in San Francisco. We were upgraded to a higher floor so that our kids could see the boats from our room.
Two time I stay in this hotel , 2014,2015 I think one of best 5stsr in this earia . But the terrible in this Hotell one reson parking car very very expensive .

review.title: One night get away
review.reviewText: Stayed at Inter Continental one night with my husband and it was awesome. The location was ideal. Hotel clean and quiet.

review.title: Downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Can't find a bad thing to say about this hotel, seriously. Central to tourist attractions, waking distance to restaurants and the staff and amenities were on point! Valet was awesome too; thanks!

review.title: great downtown location. like-new facilities.
review.reviewText: positive experience with the staff. just a nice hotel.

review.title: I feel Cheated!
review.reviewText: I booked  the deluxe room with a king size bed on Valentines day, but because I booked with Expedia they moved me to a closet with double beds! They literally said I booked with Expedia so they only had the double bed room available. I paid over $400 and was cheated out of my hotel room I originally chose!

review.title: Great SF Stay
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, at front desk and elsewhere.  They gave us a great room and we loved the gym and pool. Would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, the only thing is the cost of parking. It's about $33 to stay overnight at the local public lot; would be good to have partial validation.

review.title: Quiet yet in the center of town!
review.reviewText: Five day stay. Spacious room looking across the bay. Gorgeous view of sunrise each day and a full moon at night. Clean, comfortable bed, gorgeous shower. Loved the multiple shower heads!  Would stay here again.

review.title: They charge $65 for parking!!!
review.reviewText:
My major complaint was parking which was very expensive. Normally I don't ask for valet parking but as you check in they push you in that direction by telling you that every time you get in and out of garage you have to pay $25 if you park it yourself. Not only that but every time you ask for your car there is a tip expectation and the people that park your car make you feel this way so one day of parking comes to $80 with the tips and more if you ask for your car multiple times a day.

If you want water you can drink from the bottle in your room for $5 per bottle which is nonsense so you end up buying a 24 bottle case for $5 and carry it to your room.

We had a few things not working in the room from the shower to the TV set but they were repaired immediately.

Decent breakfast downstairs.

review.title: Great hotel, really helpful staff!
review.reviewText: Location was good, hotel was beautiful and we'll equipped.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge was more than helpful, could not be happier with this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to shops, union square, tours etc. staff were very quick to tell us which direction/areas not to walk in.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: It is a very well located hotel, comfortable, and nice... I will stay again here any other time for sure, highly recommend it.

review.title: Scam artists!
review.reviewText: We booked on expedia and paid in full through their site. Upon check out, the very rude staff member told my husband we only reserved through expedia and would have to pay in full to them directly. As soon as my husband told me that I pulled them email reservation out and brought it up to the front desk to show the staff member. She didn't even look at the email, only rudely said "well I guess I will take it off and figure it out later, but we will still bee charging you for parking." 3 days later the charge was not removed. I had to call guest relations twice before the charge was taken down. I believe this is a scam they are running to double charge guests for rooms.  Check your bills!!

review.title: Perfect for families.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at other InterContinental Hotels and have always been impressed with the location, staff, room, services etc. The whole San Francisco experience with your hotel was fabulous. I requested and received a room on a higher floor and decided to upgrade to a corner. Smart overture on the part of the staff member checking us in! The view was fabulous -- king size bed, floor space, light and view. The hotel is strategically located close to the Children's Creativity Museum, Whole Foods and the shopping district. Room service was really great and faster than promised! We needed to get to the airport for a late morning flight and were able to get car service that was also letter perfect -- no waiting, wonderful driver, smooth and safe ride.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything -- especially the staff and location.

review.title: Staff couldn't have been more helpful.
review.reviewText: All aspects exceeded expectations and this is truly a 5 start hotel and conveniently located for all San Francisco sight seeing or just relaxing in the spa and gym or the excellent club lounge.
Need to change the attitudate of a boy outside; not helpful when we need taxi. He is trying to selling car and limo service

The worst I've ever had!
I reserved what suppose to be a luxury two bed room for two adults with two children.
upon arrival, they stated that they have only king bed room, take it or leave it.
So I ended up having the worst sleep I could ever have in a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: maybe

review.title: Nice location and great service
review.reviewText: The hotel is modern and has great service. I stayed in the King superior room number 1602. Got a nice view of the city. The only downside I observed and did not like was the shower. Water easily splashed onto the floor because there was a permanent opening into the shower (nice attempt to be sleek and stylish). The staff was on top of everything so the service was great. The breakfast was really great and worth while because Expedia hooked it up with breakfast included in the booking. This hotel is not near a lot of homeless people like so many other popular hotels in the area. Staying in the SOMA or immediate Union district is ideal if you want to be in a clean location with hotels that offer great service.
review.positiveRemarks: The modernness of it and its location to transit and other places to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Do something about that shower. Install a glass door to ensure steam stays in the shower and eliminate a potential hazard with water on the floor.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to BART, streetcars, and trolleys. It is also near the interstate if you are driving. Parking garage 1 block over on 5th and mission.

review.reviewText: Excellent hotel - clean, luxurious, great staff, and fantastic location!

review.title: New favorite hotel in SF
review.reviewText: I visit San Francisco 3 time a year and have always stayed at the another hotel on Market Street (4 star-rated).  At the recommendation of our CEO I stayed here and found a gem South of Market.
review.positiveRemarks: What really stood out is the hotel staff.  Extremely thoughtful and accommodating.
review.locationRemarks: So close to good dining, shopping and the Powell Street cable car stop.  Short walk to the financial district, Ferry Building and Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Staff in all areas of the hotel were trained in excellent customer service. Easy access to freeways and shopping. We have used many times for a fun getaway

review.title: Fabulous location.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel and very helpful and professional staff.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything!!
review.reviewText: Nice staff excellent service definitely I will stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: We can walk without car for all the Union Square. That was amazing because is a really headache find a parking in SF.

review.title: Top shelf staff!
review.reviewText: From the doorman...to the concierge...to the front desk staff...they all had a true desire to satisfy all guest wants and needs....

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Excellent staffing at lobby friendly and efficient,  extremely clean room with a wonderful views of the city overall exceptional stay.

review.title: Beautiful room and cheerful staff
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in San Francisco.  The location was perfect for shopping and jumping on local transportation to anywhere in the city.  We had a spacious corner room with nice views over the city and a very comfortable king size bed.  The amenities at the hotel were excellent, including an indoor pool and jacuzzi, fitness room, spa, Michellin rated restaurant and a Grappa bar.  The food in the Luce restaurant was superb.  We have stayed here before and we will be back again.  We highly recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, the rooms, facilities, service, restaurant . . .
review.negativeRemarks: They need to install towel bars in the bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Near Mosconi center and Union Square and accessible to anywhere in the city by public transportation,

review.title: Enjoyable stay, friendly staff, great location
review.reviewText: My husband, nine-year-old son and I were at the Intercontinental for a recent "staycation" and completely enjoyed our weekend there. The room was very comfortable; every single staff person was helpful and friendly; and the pool, fitness room and spa made it a perfect stay.

review.title: Okay-too many added expenses
review.reviewText: Overall, we enjoyed our stay here but wouldn't return. Located too close to crime ridden streets- one wrong turn and we felt like we were about to get mugged. Also, restaurant was extremely expensive and additional cost to use business center computer was ridiculous when most hotels offer for free.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, and wonderful staff.
review.reviewText:
The InterContinental San Francisco on Howard Street is in a convenient location, very close to Union Square.  It is easy to get both private and public transportation to anywhere you would like to go in the city.  The hotel itself is quite nice, with up-to-date rooms that are priced reasonably.

The staff are wonderful.  From the time we arrived and dealt with the Front Desk staff to the time we left and received help from the Concierge with transportation to SFO they were great.  The latter actually went over-and-above to get a town car with child seats after the taxi company we had booked with failed to show up to take us to the airport.

We only had breakfast at Luce and never got a chance to use the amenities, such as the pool and spa, but we will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is convenient.  Atmosphere and rooms are nice.  Staff are very courteous and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the linens were a bit worn, but we never had a concern about cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square. Chinatown, Financial District, and the Tenderloin are easily walkable.  From Mission/Powell you can get most anywhere.

review.title: A hotel for business travellers.
review.reviewText: There is a daily fee for internet. I didn't want to add this internet fee to my room. I felt disconnected during my stay. I only need may be 30 minutes to check informations around town. This is a hotel for business travellers. Fridge in the room is full of small bottles of alcohol. Only a tiny space for your own stuff. For family travelling it would be convenient to have a fridge and microwave in your room.
review.negativeRemarks: If internet is complimentary.

review.title: Bed and room
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel for three nights.
I expected that I'm gonna stay in Five stars hotel, but I found out that I was wrong.
This hotel is just bed and room and so expensive.
I acknowledge that it was mistake when I went to this hotel.

had a great experience.  the only problem is the hotel is located next to the Moscone Center so there is a lot of traffic near and around it.  otherwise the hotel is great.  nice rooms and great access to the Bay Bridge.

Jacuzzi, pool and spa were excellent. Staff were very polite and accommodating. Great location for union square. Room was spacious and nice for SF. Bathroom wasn't as clean as would expect do high end hotel. Had to remind them that my employer had provided an auhotization and cc # to cover incidentals several times but they always made it right.

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: Good business hotel in central location, good facilities, including solarium, gym and swimming pool. Helpful staff.
Rooms spacious but temperature wise a bit warm, nice Eco-friendly hotel. Staff warm and friendly.

review.title: Exceptional staff, family friendly
review.reviewText: We had an amazing stay at the Intercontinental.  When I was looking at reviews before we went we found out the President had stayed there a couple of weeks ago.  When we checked in my son asked the front desk how many rooms were in the room the President stayed in.  They offered to provide us with a tour of the suite if we came back when it was free.  The kids (7 and 10) made sure that we checked back to see if that offer was still available.  When the room was clean they called our room and let us know that we could come and see it.  While we were waiting to go take a look Albania (the lady from the front desk) had a chilled canister of milk and cookies delivered to our room for the kids!  They thoroughly enjoyed their tour and were even given special memory books to document all of their special moments from their trip.  As a result we had a amazing dinner out that night.  The kids wrote in their memory books about the trip while waiting for their food to arrive and my husband and I enjoyed a glass of wine while the kids told us all about the fun they were having on their first trip to San Francisco.  Your staff were amazing, we will be back---to bad we won't be staying in the suite next time!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean rooms, great staff and amenities
review.negativeRemarks: The coffee in the rooms.

review.reviewText: Good hotel overall, kinda old, but very clean. Booked a club room on the 31st floor, great view

review.title: ICH-SF
review.reviewText:
To clarify: This review is for the Intercontinental Hotel downtown San Francisco 888 Howard street, not for the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins hotel.

View from club room at level 33 was nice, and you can see the bay and the city
Bed: comfortable king size bed,
Room: very clean, and neat.
Bathroom: very nice, cast iron tub,full walk in shower, frame less shower doors, natural stone counter-top, energy efficient fixtures.
In room fridge, club room gives you free internet access, staff was nice and polite.
I would definitely come again, but there is a major downside: parking is NOT free.
There are 2 options: valet parking 59$/day as of 11/7/2014 or parking just around the block (on Mission street), where the rate is 9$/hr or 34$/day whichever applies. That is as of 11/7/2014.
The parking is not free, as i stated above, and i think next time i will fly to S.F. and use public transportation as it will be much cheaper.
From the hotel to the Fisherman's Wharf, Pier39 takes about 20 min to walk, or 15 min, with the car because of the pedestrian traffic and 1 way streets, and there you have to pay another 8$/hr for parking.
IF YOU CAN, just fly to S.F and use the well developed public transportation, that being: cable car, tram, bus, troley-bus, metro, or taxi.They can take you anywhere for dollars a day rather than 40-60$/day for your car's parking.
review.positiveRemarks: View, staff, neatness of rooms, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel provides a 59$/day valet parking, or you go around the bloc to the 5-th and Mission str and park your car there for 34/day.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown,Moscone centers,Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, China Town,cable car, AMC theaters, lots of places to eat: Samovar, Europa Deli,Cafe du Soleil...

review.title: Very nice location, close to Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Overall very pleasant experience. Easy to valet the car, easy to check in, easy freeway access.
I found the WiFi to be pathetic... I was not able to connect to it from any device - Lap, Mobile or from my iPad... Called the room service @9PM but nobody attended or called me back either.

review.title: Terrible a/c
review.reviewText: The ac is in Eco mode which kept the room sweltering and it took 6 calls before it was finally resolved at 1 am

review.title: Great location, overpriced
review.reviewText: Great staff, great location, beautiful view. Very  Small room for $450 a night.  TV took forever to turn on.  Most likely would not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size for price.  More intriguing lobby

review.title: No attention to detail
review.reviewText: Had to call for iron, next iron broken, finally got one on third attempt.  Laid down on one of the two queen beds and it was hard as a rock.  Turned out someone had ordered "bed boards" previously and housekeeping hadn't ever removed.  Sink faucet very difficult to regulate and was always way too hot.  Nothing 4 or 5 star about this place except for appearance.  Big convention hotel that doesn't pay attention to the details.

review.title: Close to Union square, shopping, food, movies.
review.reviewText: The staff, especially the concierge were fantastic!  We were celebrating a 50th birthday with a girls weekend; and they gave us such great recommendations on things to do, places to go and restaurant recommendations.  Everything was perfect!
review.positiveRemarks: The room size.  When two friends are sharing a room, you need space.  We were in two rooms side by side and all four of us were so happy with it all!
review.negativeRemarks: We were disappointed,we called & asked for a specific location, we were told that because we booked through Expedia we would have to wait and see
review.locationRemarks: The location is good for everyone.  Close to business, close to shops and restaurants.

review.reviewText: Loved this hotel! The staff was very accommodating and super nice. Will definitely be coming back!

We were at the intercontinental for our honeymoon (we had booked it through secret deals, so we had no special VIP option). However, the hotel manager personally introduced himself to us, and from the valet to the reception desk everybody tried to do their best to make our stay unique and unforgettable. They even delivered a bottle of sparkling wine to our room as a present for honeymoon (in our 18 days trip in, only the Intercontinentale and the Aria hotel did something special for our honeymoon).

review.title: Nice big and quiet hotel
review.reviewText:
The views from the higher floors are fabulous.
Big car park next door on Mission Street,
Centrally located for shopping.
Restaurant The Cavalier is one bloc away

review.title: simple things mean alot
review.reviewText: On my 5 night stay, I had to call the front desk not once but 2 times to have cream and sugar delivered to my room for the coffee maker.  The television did not work properly, our friends on another floor said their TV did not work as well.  For the price, I expected a whole lot more.  The prices at the restaurant was outrageous.  example:  a simple breakfast buffet was $28.  for scrambled eggs and some bacon.  I was very disappointed and would not recommend or will I ever visit this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge and front desk was very helpful and polite.
review.negativeRemarks: Services.

review.title: Great view
review.reviewText: Fabulous room. Staff was very nice and warm. Location was pretty cool and close to shopping.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Gorgeous corporate hotel in tall tower with everything in it!  Bar, pool and fitness and valet parking ($60...)
Rooms have TV on demand, coffee machine etc
Views from high floors are fabulous.
I m an Expedia VIP member

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel in tall tower with great views from better rooms.
Very clean, quiet and luxurious.
Close to Market and Nordstrom department store.
Eat at The Cavalier restaurant in Minna street.
Check out Le Boulanger on Mission
Room was clean; bathroom was nice with a big shower.  Two double beds were comfortable, pillows were soft and very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the Powell BART station for easy access to the airport and also near the cable cars to get to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Include wifi with the cost of the room.
review.locationRemarks: AT&T was a little bit of a hike, but not too bad.  Restaurants were nearby.

review.title: Great SOMA hotel!
review.reviewText: We came to the city for a Giants game and pathetic Paul McCartney concert. This hotel was in the perfect location to walk or ride anywhere!

review.title: Well situated
review.reviewText:
Great hotel , situated just far enough from the city center but still close enough to walk . 

Very clean and the staff were very professional and helpful .

review.title: Nice hotel, expensive parking.
review.reviewText:
Our stay at the hotel was very pleasant. It is a nice, clean, fairly easy to get to location. That is not always the case in San Francisco. 

My only complaint is what is charged for valet parking. I think $59 dollars a day is bordering on criminal. I do understand that real estate in San Francisco is expensive, and other hotels charge something in that neighborhood. But that doesn't make $59 to park your car okay.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, close to freeway, fairly easy to get to.

review.title: Easy check-in
review.reviewText: Very modern decor. First time I ever stayed in a room that had a doorbell!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was super comfortable. The bath towels were huge and very soft.

review.title: Very nice hotel, well located
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel, the view was great, the staff was nice, the location was good ( near union). Nice bathroom and facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Try to find a better price for the night, because it can be quite expensive comparing to other hotels on the west coast which have even better service

review.reviewText: Five star hotel with excellent staff.  Spectacular views and close to Union Square.  The double beds were a bit tight for my family of four and wish queens had been available.
The staff is either super accommodating & great... or unpleasant & unhelpful
review.positiveRemarks: The 6th floor club room is great.

review.title: Clean and nice
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel. Only 2 blocks from Bart and union square. Would come again

review.title: Great hotel close to Moscone
review.reviewText: Nicely furnished rooms with good Wi-Fi speeds.  Was there for 3 nights and it was very convenient.  Not a lot of close food options, however, the Chieftain Irish Pub across the street had fantastic burgers.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge was not particularly helpful regarding car service to airport.  The doorman was much more helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Chieftain Irish Pub

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
It is a good hotel though perhaps slightly uninspiring. The views are not quite as a good as they might suggest they are.

Good pool, and attentive staff, especially concierge

review.title: So glad we stayed here...
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and in a great location.  The staff was extremely polite and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was ideal for sightseeing and close to the AT&T ballpark.  The staff was eager to help!
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 is a short cab ride away.  Most other places are in walking distance. The BART station is near, but not safe for a woman and teen traveling.

review.title: Luxury and personal service!!
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel...we stayed for three nights and loved each and every employee that we came across...the bell hops, the folks at the reservations desk, the concierges, honestly...everyone was friendly and professional!  The room was beautiful, the lobby was gorgeous, and everything was a touch of high class...we felt pampered!!!
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants nearby...Cafe Venue was great for a quick, reasonable, healthy breakfast.  Zero Zero was an awesome pizza and pasta restaurant!

review.title: I can't say enough nice things about the staff.
review.reviewText: Bill and Leigh Ann at the Concierge were particular helpful. Location was close to all transportation to get to all parts of the city. Also many things within walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel!  Close proximity to Union Square and Embarcadero
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean hotel and staff was very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel, affordable price.
review.reviewText: Our family of four just wrapped a 3 night stay and really enjoyed the Intercontinental. The location is 2 blocks south of Union Sq and within 1-2 blocks there is a Target, lots of dining options that make it easy if you want a quick bite or forgot some essentials. It was about a 15 min walk to Chinatown, 5-8 mins to get to the cable cars. We got a very good rate and were happy. Our kids swam every day. The pool and hot tub were great; our only complaint is that there is no comfortable place for people to sit at the pool-no room and just a couple hard benches. Overall, great place.

review.title: Nice hotel close to AT&T park
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 stayed here again this year to take in the city.  The location is close to BART and the cable cars with all the shopping you could ever want.  Great time in San Francisco!
review.locationRemarks: Walk to AT&T for a Giants game, Powell street for a cable car ride to the Wharf where Alcatraz and biking across the Golden Gate bridge are a must!

review.title: Close to the trolleys, BART station and shopping.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Amazing staff. Bill, the chief concierge, was kind, funny, and spot-on with recommendations. Super clean room and great ambiance.
Really nice room, courteous staff, great location.

review.title: Could not be any better
review.reviewText:
Kara was wonderful. She booked us am exceptional room and by the time we went up a bottle of champaign and strawberries were placed as it was our anniversary. 

The locations is also good, 7 minutes from union square.

review.title: Exceptionally poor service
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed in our stay - our room was not serviced until we had been there nearly two days and after repeated calls to the front desk.  Each time I called I was also placed on hold for lengthy periods and when finally connected to a representative, I was met with a frosty and unapologetic tone.  Highly avoid this chain, particularly this location.

review.title: Electric Charging Station
review.reviewText: I first chose InterContinental San Francisco because it looked good and had a charging station for my Tesla.  Now I come back because it has a charging station and is a wonderful hotel and in a central neighborhood.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staff, spacious rooms, fast elevator
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market street, Moscone, Nordstroms

review.title: Very good, modern hotel.
review.reviewText: Full disclosure, I got an amazing deal on this room. That being said, it is a great hotel even if paying a higher room rate. Everything is very new, clean and contemporary. For us, it was centrally located in SoMa next to the Moscone Center. The lobby is very open, light and airy. The front desk is efficient. The concierge gave us perfect recommendations every time for all our meals. The beds and linens are very nice and quite comfortable. The TV was big but the picture wasn't too crisp. Great amenities: shampoos, bath robes, slippers and such. And nice decor overall. While the hotel is really great, I didn't love my particular room. Checking in at the Front Desk, I made one request, "please do not put me in a room directly across from the elevators". I understood that, due to nature of my reservation, I would be placed on a low floor in a standard room. But, when I got out of the elevator, BAM- there was my room. Normally, I would have gone back to the front desk and politely requested a different room but, as I said, I really did get an awesome rate so, we stuck it out. The good news was that the room was shockingly very quiet despite its proximity to the elevator. All in all, our stay was quite pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, modern and efficient. Knowledgable and truly helpful concierges.
review.negativeRemarks: Please try to honor room location requests. There was a blotch of gum on our otherwise nice carpet. Gorgeous bathroom but mold around tub.
review.locationRemarks: Yerba Buena Gardens is a great place to have a picnic lunch. The Samovar Tea room is fantastic. Park in the lot behind the hotel for much cheaper

review.title: Great hotel in a nice area
review.reviewText: Although valet costs ~$60 there are multiple parking lots nearby that allow overnight parking for $15-$30 and they are only 1-5 blocks away. The hotel has internet access for premium members.  Security is around the clock. It was filled with families and had a very professional and sleek feel.  I really enjoyed staying here and would highly recommend others to stay here as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Sleek design, their amenities, aloe and green tea shampoo, conditioner, body gel, lotion was great.
review.locationRemarks: You can call a cab or use apps like Uber to get around.  You can also walk to where you need to go.

review.title: Nice hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco as part of our family vacation. The location of the hotel is great. It is walking distance to downtown, yet not right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of downtown. The view from the upper floors from the side of the building that faces the Bay Bridge is fantastic with all the city lights. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be back!

review.title: probably one of the newest hotels in SFO
review.reviewText: great property and staff! a first class experience way nicer then the 4 stars

review.title: Bloody Sheets
review.reviewText: Close to AT&T park, decent room but our bed had blood on the sheets and comforter. They let us change rooms but never offered any compensation for the inconvenience. Continental breakfast was the best part.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice staff. Great view. Good location. Slept well. i will stay at this Hotel again.

review.title: Classy Hotel
review.reviewText: Love the upscale feel of the hotel.  Convenient location...we walked to Embarcadero, Union Square and North Beach.  We always choose this hotel when staying in San Francisco!
Solid member of the Intercontinental portfolio. Great central location for moscone events or anything in the Financial District. Quiet despite how busy Howard and surrounding streets are.

review.title: Slick hotel centrally based
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff complimented by clean room (esp. toilet, shower and bed linen - you know? the important stuff!)

Odd shower layout, no water pressure. Small room, Rather stay at The westin.

Its 2014, when can we get HD channels on the TV?

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed Luce for breakfast and dinner. The rooms were nice and clean but the full size beds were a little uncomfortable.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
great and helpful staff
worth the extra $ for the "club"

review.title: Wonderful hotel but expensive
review.reviewText: I would stay here again in a heart beat. Its close to everything in SF and the staff were wonderful. $3.00 for a coffee and $90.00 for a room service meal was over the top but heck its only money.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost!!
review.locationRemarks: Anything you want to do in SF is right around the corner from this hotel.

review.title: Modern Hotel near Yerba Buena
review.reviewText: We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel but bell staff and front desk were always pleasant and helpful. The location was on the edge of good but we had no problems as two grandmas traveling together. Near by shopping and restaurants were a plus. Breakfast in the hotel was very good. San Francisco was experiencing a warm spell so we were very grateful for the good air conditioning system.

review.title: The best staycation!
review.reviewText: I stay at a hotel in San Francisco about 4 times a month for a mini get away. And this hotel, hands down, is AMAZING. Quite, luxurious rooms, with large bathrooms. The staff was outstandingly helpful. And the pool and hot tub are by far nicer than most others I've seen in SF. Overall an fantastic choice!

review.title: Great customer service! Very friendly.
review.reviewText: The hotel was well staffed and very friendly. The people working there seemed to really like their jobs which I take as a good sign. Our room was clean when we got there and cleaned nicely every day. The location is convenient for downtown San Francisco. It is close to Union Square for higher end shopping, but also close to Target for quick necessities. We enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and the taste & variety was great. The restaurant staff was some of the best anywhere, especially Sam.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms are not very private. The sliding door does not block sound or light so someone using the bathroom at night woke everyone up.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in easy walking distance of Union Square and all of the fun shopping that's available. There are many nearby restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel for San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: Excellent location, Friendly hotel staff, One note: Valet parking garage is too expensive - $60/ 24 hours...
Great hotel, location on the edge. It was a good find. They do hold large meetings which can affect the bar and restaurant at night, high noise level. Staff lovely all around.
review.positiveRemarks: great rooms, staff friendly and helpful, food in restaurant very good. a very quick walk to Moscone and Wesfield shopping center.
review.locationRemarks: best for business travelers, location not ideal for a family vacation.

review.title: Great location, excellent staff
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in the service was excellent, staff all very nice and accommodating. Upgraded our room and allowed early check in with no questions asked or extra fees. Dorian bellman/ concierge very friendly and helpful with good advice for dinning and activities, we felt he was a friend by the time we left, awesome staff member!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location close to Union Square, shopping, dinning! Hotel was attractive, clean, staff outstanding!
review.negativeRemarks: Shared a room with 4 people could have provided more coffee, condiments and shampoo, since we paid extra for the extra people.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to Union Square, shopping, dinning, BART station. Came for Bay to Breakers race, we could walk to start, and packet pickup

review.title: Great stay
