review.reviewText: The concierge provided great help with a few issues, including with an urgent car rental due to a well known national chain's (their name rhymes with 'fifty') failure to have the car they'd confirmed for me. Thanks!

review.title: Very nice hotel especially for the price.
review.reviewText: It was a lot more than I was expecting for what we paid. Very nice hotel. Might be my new favorite!

review.title: Our home in San Francisco! A perfect choice!!
review.reviewText:
This is where we'll always stay!
When you find a place where you feel welcome and well treated, you do not need to search any longer. This is how we felt at the Intercontinental. Kyle welcomed us at reception with a big smile and was helpful at every request. The concierge also gave us the best tips. Our room was large, comfortable, modern and had a fascinating view. Location is great, as you are a few meters away from Powell Street, where you can get a cable car and Union Square, where the hop-on/ hop-off tour buses depart from and where you can go shopping. Lovely stay and the place where I am coming back to whenever I return to San Fran.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell station & Union Square. Excellent for shopping. Eat at the Indian restaurant Amber. At lunch, they serve a good buffet.

review.reviewText: Wonderful stay, great location! Breakfast was exceptional yet the happy hour menu was limited. Lovely rooms, facilities and staff- absolutely recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel near plenty of shopping
review.reviewText: This was our first time staying in San Francisco. We walked everywhere. The views were amazing and everyone seemed to be friendly. There was plenty to do, including shopping, eating and site seeing.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel decor was beautiful. We loved our corner room as there were windows from floor to ceiling even in the bathroom. Comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little small but overall great!
review.locationRemarks: The location was great! Union Square was within walking distance, about 2 blocks and the Pier was about a 10 minute cab ride.

review.title: Near BART, Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Had a great stay. A modern hotel, within two blocks of the Powell BART station, next to Moscone Center. The room was spacious, the staff friendly. The concierge was very helpful, the food was great. They have a lively bar scene.
review.locationRemarks: 5th and Howard, close to Union Square, Moscone Center.

review.title: The best SF hotel.
review.reviewText: I lived in the Bay Area for many years, and I recently returned to attend a wedding. Whenever I choose a hotel, I read through the comments of previous guests. The Intercontinental received rave reviews, and after my recent stay, I must applaud every aspect of customer service and the comforts of a well-designed urban retreat. The best shopping in San Francisco is only steps away. Museums, a city park, movie theaters are nearby. I enjoyed the world class fitness center with indoor pool and jacuzzi. I took advantage of the Club Floor package and delighted in the special meals selected and prepared for us. The hotel is relatively new and is designed in a sleek, contemporary zen style filled with warm colors and soothing hallway lighting. The Chef made an appearance in the Club room and even took the time to stir the oatmeal. Fresh fruits, pastries and an assortment of breakfast entrees, teas, juices and coffee greeted us each morning. If I had more time, I would have taken advantage of the spa. The parking valet was always prompt and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel. The views from the upper floors are truly breathtaking.
Solid business-class hotel. Friendly staff, excellent location, well thought-out, clean, and modern rooms and amenities. 17th floor doesn't suffer from street noise.

review.title: Overall….way overpriced!
review.reviewText: Too expensive….64.00 dollars for ice cream and cokes….ridiculous!

review.title: Nice hotel with good location.
review.reviewText: Nice stay with good staff. Relatively old facility but with very good location though

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The InterContinental provides a first class hotel that is close to both Market Street and shopping as well as Moscone Center. The staff is excellent, the rooms well appointed and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and the room quality.

review.title: Intercontinental San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very good. Nice modern hotel with fresh four star rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Why has room only shower and no bath?
review.locationRemarks: Close by shopping

review.title: Welcoming, friendly, helpful staff!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel to stay in. The staff at the front desk, along with the concierge, were very friendly and welcoming. The service was quick, and the concierge spent considerable time helping us identify a good Italian restaurant to enjoy (she even called the place we chose and made reservations for us). Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and I particularly liked having a small room safe to store the few treasured belongings we had brought with us while we ate out. There was only one thing that we really didn't like. The hotel is quite energy-conscious, which is fine, ut there was very little water pressure in the bathroom sink; this made it hard to rinse your toothbrushes, washcloths, etc. Also, when you turned the faucet handle all the way over to the right to get cold water, it ran quite hot for a long time before it finally became cold! A little annoying but definitely not a deal-buster. We would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: The employees were great! Keep hiring the polite, friendly ones, please!
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure and the ability to get cold water quicker from the bathroom faucets. Make your valet service less expensive ($60.00 is TOO high!).
review.locationRemarks: We didn't want to pay $60.00 for the hotel staff to park our car, so we found a public parking garage close to the hotel that was about $38.00.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel and what you expect from Intercontinental.

review.title: Close to Giants ballpark.
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly, well appointed, knowledgeable, and efficicient. My stay at Intercontinental Hotel Howard Street was memorable and stress-free. A five-star experience South of Market Street.

review.title: Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We picked the room via Expedia "What's in a name" selection, and we're exceedingly pleased with their selection. Great location and really nice hotel. The staff were all extremely helpful, especially the doormen and concierge.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfortable, upscale, they treated our 8-year-old daughter very nicely.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like having to pay so much extra for parking, but then again, I'm not a city person, so I'm not accustomed to paying for parking at all.
review.locationRemarks: There was a lot to do within a one-mile radius. We visited Top of the Mark, Chinatown, and a couple of good restaurants.

review.title: Comfortable hotel with large rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel has a good location for business purposes, but in the night time the surrounding areas are not so pleasant. Very attentive and helpful staff. Good but expensive breakfast buffet and spacious rooms.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Great atmosphere. Very friendly and super nice hotel
It was great but expedia won't leave me alone about writing a review .

review.title: My wife and I have stayed here many times.
review.reviewText: We love every aspect. It is clean and inviting. The staff are helpful and aim to please. It is our favorite hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: The staff are all friendly and helpful.
review.reviewText: We always stay in this hotel when in San Francisco. It's clean, nice and has a friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The jacuzzi and they could add sauna that we dnt have to pay in order for us to use.it
review.locationRemarks: It is close to everything yet away from the busy and crowded downtown.

review.title: good location great comfort
review.reviewText: This is a high end hotel in a great location next to the convention center. Room was comfortable and quiet. Nothing exceptional but certainly comparable to other 4+ stars hotels. I had little interaction with the staff but check in and out was most efficient. My first thought was that it was strange and atypical that the room had no coffee machine...Only to find it tucked away in a cabinet right before checking out! I did not make use of the spa, pool etc so can't comment on that. It was a great stay, would recommend and go again.

review.title: What a spectacular hotel!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because of the location and I am so happy I did. This hotel has an amazing entrance which brings you in this grand lobby. Everything is immaculate and modern. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. I got a double full bed and they charged me $20 to upgrade me to a bigger size room and bed. The rooms are quite large and beautiful. I was very impressed by the bathroom which was very bright. We had big windows and a huge bed. This is the most I have been impressed by a hotel in a very long time. If I am ever again in San Francisco, this is the only place I will stay! I should also add for all you shoppers, that there is a great shopping center with all different stores two blocks away from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping center, Chinatown.

review.title: Great stay for the night
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, easy going, and relaxing environment. I felt comfortable at all times and enjoyed my stay.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of bars and restaurants walking distance, if not everything is a short cab!

review.title: Very nice hotel, allot of things to do in the area
review.reviewText: Great experience at a great location. Chinatown is about a 15 minute walk, perfect after dinner.

review.title: Great service/Great amenities/Great time
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. All the facilities (room, pool, gym) were well kept. The restaurant food and drinks were well worth the money. I family had a great stay in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The food was a little pricey, but both the quality, uniqueness, and experience made it well worth the expense.
review.locationRemarks: It is well centered. Its in walking distance to shopping, Union Square, China town, and transportation to Nob Hill and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location, enjoyed my stay.
review.reviewText:
This is a newer hotel which is nice as a new hotel seems to be a rarity in SF. Room was clean and of a decent size. I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a club room on the top floor simply by asking. Unbeknownst to me, my room came with a buffet breakfast for two, but when I went to redeem it, they said it was only good for one person (even though two separate ppl, two separate occasions both confirmed it was for two). Buffet is ok. Food looks great, but like most buffets it's luke warm (one of my biggest pet peeves) and the taste was just ok. The fruit was fresh, and the bacon was tasty, but the french toast was as hard as croutons and the oatmeal brulee was soupy and bland. They did give me a bill the first day as apparently I should've gotten some vouchers (maybe at checkin?) and the buffet for two came to $60. If I had to pay I'd be upset. I ended up at Dottie's cafe a couple blocks away the next morning and would much rather spend my money there than at the hotel.

The checkin process was fairly pleasant but the front desk clerk tried to run my (prepaid) cc for incidentals and originally tried to put it through for the whole room amount/stay even though we paid ahead of time. That confused me and I had to try to ask a few times to be sure he was doing it right as it didn't make sense they would hold the amount for the cost of the room. He eventually got it right.

All in all, I enjoyed my stay and would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Like most 5 stars, I enjoyed the 24 hr room service and the laundry services, both of which I utilized during my stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Really no complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of places to walk. Close to shopping, bars and restaurants are plenty. Grocery store/Target a couple blocks away. Great location.

review.title: Superb in every way!
review.reviewText: I called a couple of days before arrival to ensure we would have a room with two beds and that was the only unsuccessful experience I had. Twice, I was put through to the front desk and the phone was never answered after about 20 rings. My third call was answered and the agent was friendly, professional and welcoming, as were all of the staff we encountered during our stay. The valet, doormen, front desk agents and concierge were all excellent. The only improvement I can even suggest is to use the guest's name more, but their manner was so sincere I was impressed by the service anyway. I love the location, nice area with great restaurants nearby and a Target around the corner for forgotten items! Only a few blocks away from AT&T Park which is always our destination when we come to the city! The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are a really nice size, modern, comfortable, scrupulously clean with nice amenities. The beds are so comfortable and the thermostat was really responsive so it was easy to keep the room comfortable. I work at a luxury resort and my critical eye found nothing to complain about! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly for anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, super comfortable room, the location and pretty much everything else!
review.negativeRemarks: Guest name recognition would enhance the already very high service standards.
review.locationRemarks: AT&T Park (go Giants!), great restaurants, art galleries and museums, Moscone Center literally on the doorstep, a Target store and movie theater.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: We stayed in a standard bedroom . The room was a nice size but small beds.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a great hotel and has a good location.

review.title: generally good
review.reviewText:
nice stay but poor sleeps here! the bed was like a marshmellow and we both like hard mattresses so each night we had trouble sleeping. fortunately we could go to the gym each day and get our backs back in line,
location is away enough from union square to avoid the mass tourism - but cloce enough to walk there. we enjoyed staying here as we like to walk.
at night the area feel a bit sketchy.
review.negativeRemarks: bed is too too too soft! pillows are too big
review.locationRemarks: very central - easy to walk many places

review.title: A great experience!
review.reviewText: We had a great time staying at the InterContinental hotel in San Fransisco. The hotel itself was quite elegant, and the rooms were spacious and kept quite clean. The view from our room was great and the staff was very nice and polite.
review.positiveRemarks: It was kept clean and the staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, it was great as is.
review.locationRemarks: The whole city was really quite accessable from this location. The hotel was really located in the heart of it all.

review.title: Very handy
review.reviewText: Awesome location and the concierge's Bill and (I think) William were exceptionally helpful with giving us hints about were to go and making a booking for dinner and a trip to Alcatraz when we were short on time due to our stay being over the Christmas period.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed and great linen.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union square, Chinatown and shopping district

review.reviewText: A nice business hotel. Only drawbacks are lack of a bathtub in the room and the computerized fridge (lack of space, charge for moved bottles).

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Great location with access to Bart and parking at 5th and Mission Garage. Walking to Union square and simple to drive in and out of area to museum destinations.

Mattress was old and needed replacement
review.negativeRemarks: New Mattress
review.locationRemarks: Moscone Center, Yerba Buena Gardens, Union Square

review.title: Nice Hotel, overpriced spa, bad concierge
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was excellent. Nice clean rooms. Huge towels. Comfy bed. Unlike so many hotels, the fitness room was large, clean, had plenty of machines and free weights, and the equipment was new and in very good shape. A large, working, nicely maintained hot tub next to the fitness room. The pool was long and narrow - basically two lap-lanes wide and long, but okay for kids as long as there aren't any fitness swimmers at the time.

On the downside, the "I-Spa" was overpriced and uneven. The facilities were nice, but the people were a disappointment. A "couples" massage cost almost $400 for the 80-minute massage. When I made the reservation, they told me "$190" and I figured that was for the pair of us, not each of us, since I pay $60 for a regular massage and medically-prescribed therapeutic massages cost $90. My girlfriend said hers was great. Mine was almost amateur and very disappointing.

Most disappointinng of all was the Conceirge. We asked very specifically for a "no frills, plain and simple Greek or Italian restaurant." She sent us on a $50 cab ride to a ridiculously pretentious italian restaurant. Upon returning to the hotel, we saw a Bucca de Beppo less than half a block away, and went in there to eat dinner because the place she sent us to, despite being expensive (they charged extra if you wanted tomato sauce on your pizza!), left us feeling like we ate appetizers instead of dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: See above -- the facilities were great. Some of the people were not.

review.title: hotel is great, services horrible.
review.reviewText: parking is really expensive, around $60 per day. services are extremely expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: kindness and help from manager and front desk people.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Our bathroom Dior was broken but they upgraded us quickly to another room. I wish there were a few more decorations for the holidays but it was very tasteful. The only issue was checkout. I had to wait about 30 minutes at 9:30 in the morning.

review.title: GREAT staff, but a few concerns with facility
review.reviewText: We had a very good experience with the staff at the hotel. However the bar area where we sat to have a casual dinner was uncomfortable, cold (both temperature and ambiance), and every time the door opened you got even colder and also smelled the cigarette smoke from outside. Also, we expected 2 queen beds and got 2 double beds. This was Expedia's fault, not the hotel's fault.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice. The workout facility was also very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Build out a MUCH better casual eating space.
review.locationRemarks: Too many things to mention. Good South-of-Market location -- with good shopping near by. I would recommend cabbing it to get to the great restaurants.

review.title: The Best in SF
review.reviewText: We stay here often. Every aspect is great. We love eating at LUCE's. The staff is very accommodating.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: I always like to stay at the Hotel Intercontinental!
review.positiveRemarks: I like the staff and the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: My office is across the street.

review.title: Thanksgiving visit 2013
review.reviewText:
Impossible to detect hotel entry from a five-lane street, until it is too late. Where is the entry?
On top of that, because this hotel is at the edges of dangerous neighborhood, you have to drive past some bad looking buildings and people to get back around.
Too many (bored) staff people with attitudes.
Odd set up for fitness, pool, spa.
Loved the iluminated do not disturb / make up room signs.
VERY comfortable roomy rooms.
Lamp light switched too bright (we had to cover with towels to tone down the brightness.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the iluminated do not disturb / make up room signs. VERY comfortable roomy rooms. Modern clean lines, finishes and furnishings.
review.negativeRemarks: Lamp light switched too bright Odd set up for fitness, pool, spa and outdoor deck. Impossible to detect hotel entry from a five-lane street.
review.locationRemarks: Impossible to detect hotel entry from street. 4 blocks to get to everything - not bad. VERY easy to I-280 and 101; Westfield Mall, Moscone; BART.

review.title: High standards
review.reviewText: Top quality hotel from the time you arrive until the time you leave
review.negativeRemarks: wi-fi in the lobby, free access to internet in the business center
review.locationRemarks: immediate neighborhood is so-so but you are three blocks away from market street and 5 from Union Square.

review.title: Thanksgiving weekend in S.F.
review.reviewText: We've stayed at this hotel a few times now and our experiences are consistently very good. The location is great for what we wanted to do, and the staff is very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Extra excessive charges for internet, refrigerator, parking (!), etc...
review.locationRemarks: Moscone Center, Children's Creativity Center (Zeum), CCC Carousel, Contemporary Jewish Museum, Union Square, MOMA, Metreon, Westfield Center SF

review.title: Great hotel for night or two in San Fran.
review.reviewText: Had a layover before heading to Hawaii. Great hotel to see city in a day. Conveniently located. Concierge was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: about two blocks from market street. Very convenient

review.title: good location, helpful staff
review.reviewText: only caveat: not enough staff at check in and check out
review.negativeRemarks: faster service , more staff at check in and check out

review.title: You won't be disappointed
review.reviewText: Very well run and clean big city type hotel with super views. Very near to convention centre, a block or so away from all the action of Union Square. Be prepared to walk everywhere. Otherwise great value and a must stay location for convention convenience.

review.title: Nice hotel right down town!
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco for a week on business. It's a great location walking distance from Union Square and only a few miles from just about all of the big San Francisco sights. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and modern. We had two twelve year old boys with us and the staff went out of their way to give them a little extra love, chocolate covered pretzels and high fives. :)
review.negativeRemarks: I had no issues or concerns. It was a great stay.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Market St, Arts District, only a few miles from major attractions, lots of transportation options.

review.title: Satisfied customer and parent.
review.reviewText: My 9 yr old son and I stayed the weekend at this fabulous hotel. We stayed on the 28th floor which had an excellent view both day and night. There is an indoor pool and expansive exercise area, not to mention an outdoor sitting area on the 6 th floor. Not only was our room immaculant, the elevator areas and all windows were spotless. There is floor to ceiling windows in the rooms and at the end of each floor for breathtaking viewing. Our bathroom had a tiled shower and the glass door looked like a door in a spa. Our room had a business area with a desk and convenient electronic charging station. There is a beautiful revolving door at the entrancr , along with bellhops and doormen. We felt like we were in New York. The rooms are very quiet. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful. They have maps ready and will not only map your destination , but will assist you with bus numbers and street names to watch for. We loved it and will stay again.
Great hotel; awesome staff; perfect location.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to the Ferry Building, SF MoMA, and Yerba Buena Gardens.

review.title: Great SF hotel choice
review.reviewText: I live in the SF Bay Area, but needn't an overnight stay to attend a conference at a nearby hotel. The Intercontinental is conveniently located to the SF Financial District and to SOMA - exactly where I needed to be. We had a nice sized room which was well set up for business use, with large desk and counter surfaces (something that I find wanting in many hotels I stay in), and good lighting. We enjoyed food at the bar and the Sunday brunch - both were very nice and not super expensive. We also enjoyed the work out room, which was small but well appointed and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to out-of-town business travelers.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was spacious and quiet, and nicely set up for business use with large desk and counter surfaces and good lighting.
review.negativeRemarks: Why do hotels make TVs so difficult to operate? We were charged for a pay program we didn;t want and didn't see (hotel removed charge, thank you!)
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone Center, Financial DIstrict and SOMA restaurants and bars.

review.title: One night stay for business.
review.reviewText: One night stay for business. Room was upgraded for no charge. Large, comfortable, nicely appointed. Close to my meeting and $50/night less than my colleagues who were staying at not-as-nice hotels in the area. Did not have time to check out fitness room or other amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was large, comfortable and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: No suggestions for improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location for my business meeting.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: Decent but was not happy about the effort given to accommodate for the appropriate room for a single occupant !

review.title: Nice and comfortable
review.reviewText: Typical hotel room, comfortable bed and clean. Would have liked a little bit more character to the room. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: More interesting decor.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location for The Warfield.

review.title: Nothing bad, but nothing distinctively great
review.reviewText: It was a perfectly fine stay. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was nice - but then again, I expected all of that from an Intercontinental, and I have to say a bit more. It was just a bit bland. Nothing out of the ordinary or distinct about the experience.

review.title: Nice location, Very friendly staff.
review.reviewText:
It was our 10Th year anniversary and since we got married in S.F. we decided to spend the weekend in S.F.

The hotel staff was so friendly and when they found out about the occasion they upgraded our room. When we came back from our dinner reservation we found the guest services have sent us a bottle of champagne.

These were very nice touches that complemented the over all service we received.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the room.

review.title: good hotel to stay
review.positiveRemarks: very good location. close to the market and various attractions. non smoking room without any trace of smell. easily accessible.
review.negativeRemarks: only one signature restaurant inside little bit expensive.
review.locationRemarks: very close to the shopping area. within walking distance to the chinese town and many other attractions.

review.title: A real treat for mom and kids
review.reviewText: I was unexpectedly traveling by myself with 2 kids and appreciated the kindness and helpfulness of the concierge and guys at the door in helping things go smoothly as we ventured out for meals, tourist sites and finally to the airport. The pool was a treat for the kids, and the room a nice haven after busy time in the city. Lots of good places to eat close by, shopping, too, if I had had the time, and near a great place to catch the cable cars! One of several nice memories of our San Francisco trip.
review.negativeRemarks: More details in the room handbook: pool hours, local restaurants, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Seems to be a neighborhood in transition- wouldn't wander around alone at night, but lots of bustle in day. Improvements underway all around.

review.title: Go For the Food
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything we expected. But the lobby restaurant, Luce, made the visit special. We stopped in for a cocktail and stayed for a tour of their small plates the first night. We returned for the prix fixe menu the next night. Prefect, professional, yet friendly service pared with a kitchen with a Michelin star compliments a beautiful hotel.

review.title: High class hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed spending the night there. Very comfortable and clean room. Couldn't find the ICE dispensary which was annoying.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was spacious, clean, comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I hate the overpriced foods/beverages. But that comes with any 4 star hotel room. However, some Ice would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, near the mall, and many restaurants.

review.title: The hotel is very modern and kept very clean.
review.reviewText: We were unhappy with the location. Its too far from Fisherman's Wharf and at night we felt it was unsafe to walk around in that area.
review.negativeRemarks: more dining options
review.locationRemarks: lost of shopping near-by

review.title: Room is not cleaned 100%
review.reviewText: A sticker is found on the bathroom door, a scraped paper is found behind the floor lamp siting at the corner. Woke up at 3am by the noisy screaming drunken neighbor, called the front desk and they sent security right away. All these should not happen for this brand!

review.title: nice hotel with clean environment
review.reviewText: the bed was really comfortable and the service was really nice. I can see beautiful view from my room.

review.title: Too expensive for what it offer
review.reviewText:
Do you want internet? It's not included - pay for it!
Do you want TV (not at all, not even free channels). Pay for it!
Do you want breakfast? Pay for it!

Staff very nice but for US$ 250/night I expected at least the internet. There are far better options close to this hotel
review.positiveRemarks: nothing new just one more standard one
review.negativeRemarks: Basic services just as Internet should be included in the room's rate
review.locationRemarks: very good - shopping & dinner

review.title: A little off Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel a little off Union Square. Had a good view from our room of the Union Square and downtown areas. Clean hotel with a friendly staff. I would stay here again. If flying out, use their car service to the airport. It's the same price as a taxi but much nicer.
review.locationRemarks: If any time is to be spent in San Francisco, I strongly advise to buy a 7-day pass for the cable car/bus/streetcar system. It saves a lot of walking.

review.title: Hidden fees hidden fees hidden fees
review.reviewText: They promise way too much but when you actually get there is not what it seems . We were promised great views of the bay but instead our view was blocked by the hotel itself and when we asked about changing rooms they wanted extra money . They charge you 52$ a night for our car ridiculous . Never stayiny there again

review.title: off beat
review.reviewText: hotel is about 3 blocks to market street not in the best spot other wise everything was great!
review.locationRemarks: not great

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText: Overall a good place to stay! I would definently go back if I would go back to California!

review.title: Great hotel but...
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. Facilities clean. Staff are great - awesome people skills - especially Dorian!
But what's up with charging for Wifi? This is San Francisco! The whole city is practically wireless, so it seem so out of place that the hotel would charge for this?
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is beautiful, the beds are lush and comfy. The fitness facilities are great. Location is prime, close to lots of things.
review.negativeRemarks: need free Wifi, parking fees, housekeepers too eager to clean room, despite DND sign, knocked 2x before check out time to see if we're leaving.
review.locationRemarks: As in any other metropolitan cities, vagrants around the hotel. But that is not the hotel's fault. close to lots of things to do....

review.title: Great View
review.reviewText: Had a great time, was on the 30th floor enjoyed every minute of it!

review.title: very nice hotel, very good location in SOMA
review.reviewText: Great location, helpful staff! Away from union square crowd but close enough to walk there and other parts of the city. Clean rooms, nice pool.
review.negativeRemarks: lower parking fee
review.locationRemarks: yerba buena gardens, union square and shopping

review.title: Best Night Ever!
review.reviewText: Not many people know how to truly have a vacation. This is the place you want to be it's in the center of everywhere in SF and the cleanest and nicest place by far. If you drive its not cheap to park but that's the same cost everywhere. Knowing that I took my bike with me and the Intercontinental stored my bike for me and hand it to me every time I needed out for another booze run. Elevator is amazingly fast! The view is outstanding. Everything about it is amazing!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the view, the service, it's got it all.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: China Town, The Warf, the Mission, Bars, Restaurants. Everything is nearby, and you don't have to be forced to go to a expensive grocery store.

review.title: Nice hotel but neighborhood is not the best
review.reviewText: My family and I have stayed at the Intercontinental in Boston and loved it. When stopping in San Fransisco for a few days, we decided to stay there. The hotel itself was great. Staff was very friendly and accommodating and the rate was reasonable. The neighborhood was not the best. We were able to walk to some shopping (mall, Target, Old Navy). However, the neighborhood was full of homeless people with serious mental illness. This was a bit scary for my children and there was no police presence at all. We really enjoyed eating at Mel's Drive In Diner about 2 blocks behind the hotel. Hotel was not close to major San Francisco attractions.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping malls, Target, Old Navy Mel's Diner

review.title: Great San Francisco stay
review.reviewText:
Wonderfully helpful staff and a really attractive hotel. Also, very nicely located....pretty central to Union Square without
being right in the middle of the craziness.
review.positiveRemarks: Great beds, fast elevators, and very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that we could see. All good :0)

review.title: One night in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, conveniently located near the BART, and staff was friendly.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to AT&T park from the hotel and walked through a homeless shelter on the way which was maybe a quarter mile away.

review.title: InterContinental Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and very accomodating staff. I will come back again.
review.negativeRemarks: I thought the food was a bit pricey.
review.locationRemarks: AT&t Baseball Park

review.title: Nice hotel but not the best staff
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed the hotel facilities and the overall ambiance. But It was overshadowed by the quality of the staff that works there. Not all of the staff was bad but the room service staff was beyond horrible. I was upgraded to an suite because I'm an IHG platinum member. The room was spacious and overall I'd say 3 1/2 staff quality at best. The shower head was just a bit on the smaller side and the bath could maybe hold 2.5 gallons of water.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very quiet and the fact that they reward their IHG customers very well.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower and bath are long pass due for an update. The staff friendliness should also be worked on.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of city center and close to the moscone convention centers.

review.title: Great hotel the staff was friendly
review.reviewText: Omg had a great nights sleep the bed and pillows were excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: I wouldnt say anything needed improvement
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect ...needed a new outfit for dinner went across the street & 15minutes later I had ia new outfit.

review.title: Gorgeous, but the incidental costs disappoint
review.reviewText: Booked a one-night stay-cation in the city. The room was beautiful, though small. Every little detail was attended to and gave the air of luxury, making the hotel well worth the price... except I still felt cheated due to the cost of WiFi. $15 per day per device? Maybe it's generational but my husband and I feel that WiFi should be a standard convenience. We've stayed at motels in po-dunk towns in Montana that have offered free WiFi. Charging at this point just feel sleazy.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi

review.title: Noisy!
review.reviewText: Very modern and clean hotel but unfortunately more suited to the business traveller. Very noisy at night and sleep can be a problem. Doors banging and constant movement of people throughout the night. Walls are paper thin. Good position for sightseeing but other hotels maybe better suited. Definitely overrated!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Nicely situated

review.title: Overrated/Rude
review.reviewText: We had high hopes for the hotel given the recommendation we received, but it was a big disappointment. The hotel itself was average at best, as compared to other hotels we've stayed in. The staff was rude and seemed put out in any exchange we had with them. You are better served to look elsewhere in SF when booking a hotel. There are plenty of better options, especially for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade the rooms and attitude adjustments for the staff.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to better hotels.

review.title: good location, pleasant stay
review.reviewText: good location, near cable car, bus or walking distance to local restaurants and stores. comfortable beds, clean rooms and clean hotel
review.positiveRemarks: clean room, good service, nice lobby,
review.negativeRemarks: accesible cafeteria menu, free wifi
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to shopping mall, stores, restaurants, great coffee near by (blue bottle coffee), cable car station

review.title: Modern but warm
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental is a very modern and somewhat cold facility on the outside, ie. lobby, restaurant, entrance, but it more than makes up for that in the lovely rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: It is difficult to understand how a Hotel that charges these high price must still charge for Internet access ($15/day) and bottled water ($9)

review.title: Needs refrigerator
review.reviewText: Liked our stay. Would have liked a small refrigerator in the room for leftovers and a microwave to heat them up. Cost to park was also expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: See above

review.title: Great hotel with great location!!
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was beyond helpful, everyone you talked to was nice and willing to help. Our room was clean even though we didn't love the sliding door in the bathroom which is the only "bad" thing I can say about the hotel. Location is awesome, as tourists we walked a few blocks (3) and we were in the metro station already, there are plenty of stores and restaurants near by, the cable car, Chinatown... everything is at a walking distance. You wont regret staying at this hotel trust us! (Young couple of 23/26 years old)
review.negativeRemarks: sliding door in the bathroom (I cannot thing of anything else we didn't like!) and probably varying the breakfast buffet from time to time
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, near the metro station, near the cable car, a mall, movie theater, tourist attractions and tour-bus stops... very convenient!

review.title: Closer than you think
review.reviewText: On the map it seems like the hotel is a little out of the way, but in reality it is located within easy walking distance of Union Square and all the shopping in that area, the San Francisco mall, Moscone Center and other venues (even the Ferry Building terminal on the Embarcadero - highly recommended for foodies of all ages - is a nice, 20 minute walk away). The hotel restaurant (Luce) was OK, but nothing spectacular. I was hoping for a real pool, versus the narrow pool designed only for laps. No real place to "chill".
review.negativeRemarks: How about a bigger pool?

review.title: Great location for a short city break.
review.reviewText: Great location, wonderful housekeeping staff. Perfect for a short city break.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness and size of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Location of the room, doors poorly insulated, lots of noise from hallway.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for a short city break.

review.title: Nice Hotel, No closet in the basic room.
review.reviewText:
Nice Hotel,
No closet in the basic room.

Staff was extremely helpful.

Dorian the bellman gave us plenty tips as well.

Had an awesome time on my honeymoon.
review.negativeRemarks: Closet in the basic rooms would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: AMC IMAX theater. PLENTY SHOPS Restaurants are all over the place. Nothing is far from this Hotel.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: It was a great time. Staff was very helpful with directions and helping with how to get around. Convenient to walk to attractions and restaurants. Definitely will go back.
review.locationRemarks: Several museums were within 6 blocks. Union Square and Market Street were within 4 blocks. Went to the Blue Bottle Café and Mels Diner to eat.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with great views
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. It was close to Union Square which is a very vibrant and fun part of the city. The hotel staff was very accommodating, even giving us a free upgrade to a higher floor (and a bottle of champagne) for your anniversary. The rooms were cleaned promptly and any requests we had were quickly addressed. The hotel restaurant is expensive so we never ate there. Workout facilities were excellent, and I even swam in the lap pool early to get a work out. There is a Whole Foods a couple of blocks away, which is a cheaper food alternative. I would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Great views and service. Close to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if there was a coffee shop in the lobby (although there is a Starbucks about two blocks away)
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Union Square and China Town as well as Muni stops.

review.title: 3 days and 3 nights in San Fran
review.reviewText:
Me and my wife went for a short 3 day vacation over the 4th of July. Before checking in I was happy with the staff because I spent a lot of time speaking with the concierge reserving restaurants and booking some tourist things. Then we arrived and the complaints started piling up.
1. We paid double by booking tours at the concierge than we would if we booked on our own. They should have informed us we can go directly to a pier to book a boat tour.
2. We wanted to go to a particular famous seafood restaurant and the concierge told us they were completely booked. We tried the place anyway by just walking in and they had plenty of room.
3. The mini fridge: we were informed when we checked in that the fridge has a sensor for all items and if we accidently touch anything we should just consume it because we'll get charged regardless. Obnoxious.
4. Had a huge dinner one night with a lot of leftovers. Didn't want to throw all that delicious seafood away so we took everything back to the room. The next day we needed to heat it up and were charged $30 to get a microwave sent to our room!!! They said it was against the law for them to bring outside food into their kitchen and heat up for us. Whether that's true or not, and I believe it is not, there was no reason to charge us $30 to use a microwave for 3 minutes!
review.positiveRemarks: The room was perfectly comfortable. The bed was a little soft but not bad. Curtains completely blocked out the sun in the AM.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff customer service. Almost like you're doing them a favor being a guest there.
review.locationRemarks: Directly next to the convention center. 5-10 minute walk to Union Sq and all shopping on Market St. Long walk to the piers.

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping center !!
review.reviewText: Just had a wonderful stay at your hotel with my famly.Everything was perfect, Room was kept spotless and what a fantastic view, Hopefully we will be visiting SF "again and would not hesitate to book back into your hotel and will certainly recommend it to anyone. Thank you.

review.title: Room with a view, next to Moscone Center
review.reviewText: My three-night stay was enhanced by the central downtown location. A great spot for attending events at the Moscone Center, plus plentiful shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance. Many rooms have stunning views of the city. The decor is contemporary, the room very comfortable, quiet and spotless. Public facilities were minimal but adequate - restaurant, noisy lobby bar, hole-in-the-wall variety shop. But who needs more with all of San Francisco at your feet.
review.positiveRemarks: This was the most genuinely friendly staff I have encountered in my many travels. I would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Things to do in San Francisco? Shop, eat, play tourist, attend a convention, ride the ferries,visit Alcatraz, see an opera or ballet, etc, etc, etc.

review.title: Too much noise!
review.reviewText:
Overall our stay was ok. Rooms were clean and service was good. But there was two problems. The room walls seem to be very thin. We could hear the people in the room next to our talk and unfortunately they were there to party and were very loud. I didn't have a problem, until 4am in the morning when they came back from where ever and where yelling and cursing. After 30 minutes I was about to call and complain but it stopped. I would have called sooner, but I was dead tired.

The second problem was that we ordered a in-room movie. Every 5 minutes the screen/display would be choppy for 5 seconds, it was very annoying.

If you stay here, try to get room that has limit walls that are shared by other rooms (corner rooms). I will probably not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't know how, but try to prevent less noise coming from other rooms. I could hear clearly what other guess was saying.

review.title: Convenient, comfortable downtown accommodations
review.reviewText: Close to area attractions, helpful staff, very nice restaurants. Room could have been larger, but overall a very nice hotel. Blocks from excellent shopping, wide array of restaurants, convention center, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small.

review.title: Very nice accommodations close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This is definitely an upscale hotel which we poor folks were able to book through Expedia's "Mystery Hotel" option. The service was fantastic and the room, though not overly large, was very comfortable and clean. We were there to see the sights so spent very little time in the room but our time there was very relaxing. We ate quite expensive, but very good "bar food" one night. We stopped by the bell desk and requested that our luggage be brought down at 3:30 a.m. for our 6:00 a.m. flight home and he arrived promptly at 3:30 a.m. and helped arrange for our transportation to the airport. We stayed at an Intercontinental facility in New Orleans a couple of years ago and got the same fantastic comfort and service. This is a great organization!
review.positiveRemarks: Courteous and helpful staff, cleanliness, sophistication, comfort and affordable.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Union Square, Cable Car, BART and other public transportation as well as taxi cabs always outside the door.

review.title: Hotel within walking distance of the mall!
review.reviewText: Came here for my birthday with family and friends. Beds were comfortable and slept in on my last day there watching tv for 5 hours. Bathrooms clean. Didn't use the gym though. Had a view the Giants stadium from my room.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy check in, bar in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms have sliding doors that don't lock.
review.locationRemarks: Irish pub directly across the street, movie theater and the mall only a 5 minute walk away.

review.title: Excellent business hotel
review.reviewText:
In short, the staff was super professional, and attentive. The room was well appointed and comfortable.
The location was rather central and convenient. I had a flawless stay. It wasn't the Ritz- Carlton, but I didn't expect that level of Hotel. Very satisfied and will stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of overnight parking. $52 per evening is pricey
review.locationRemarks: Ideal if you have an event at the Moscone Center. Otherewise the location is rather central.

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText:
Of the hotels we stayed in during our US trip, the Intercontinental in San Francisco was just outstanding. The staff were genuine , enthusiastic and helpful.
We received a complimentary upgrade and had a beautiful room on an upper floor. Room was spacious, modern and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: For our anniversary we received a bottle of champagne on arrival.
review.negativeRemarks: Like most people, found lack of free WiFi perplexing
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to shops and not too far from Bay

review.title: Nice and enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with good location and reasonable rate . They corrected an error in their bill for my room when I contacted them and removed that error from my account .

review.title: Outstanding place when visiting SF
review.reviewText:
San Francisco Intercontinental was outstanding. The service and friendliness of all the staff exceeded normal standards. The room was magnificent. Wonderful views from 30 th floor.
We really appreciated the gesture of welcome for our 20 th wedding anniversary.
I can not imagine we could have had a more enjoyable stay. Well done Intercontinental and thank you . We will definitely return next time we visit San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff, beautiful modern hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Would be perfect with free WiFi,
review.locationRemarks: In business district but close to shops and easy walk to Union square and transport

review.title: Sweet as!
review.reviewText: Everything bang on - I'll be back and telling friends and family

review.title: Great luxury hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, I enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and comfortable. The services provided by the staff were attentive, respectful, and friendly. I also had a great view of the city lights at night.
review.locationRemarks: Points of interest are within walking distance.

review.title: Great Hotle for everyone
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Short Walking distance to ATT Park.

review.title: Certainly NOT 4 1/2 Stars!!
review.reviewText: Although this is a decent hotel, it's not worth the money! I expected a 4 1/2 star hotel; instead, I got an expensive 3 star hotel. They wireless internet service should be free. The parking fee of $52 per night is insane! The mini-bar has pressure sensors; in other words, if you move something, you will automatically be charged. There is a tiny space for your own beverage. If you request a refrigerator, it comes with a $39 charge per night. The view from my room sucked. Construction cranes were the main things that I saw.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the price of parking, get rid of pressure sensors in mini-bar, & include wireless internet service.
review.locationRemarks: Location was close to Union Square.

review.title: EXTREMELY NOT Recommended
review.reviewText:
- Bad Staff Not Friendly AT ALL ( They didn't seem like they are well trained especially when comparing to Dubai's customer service ), Horrible customer service, worst Dine in Menu Nationwide.
- Lack of choice's at the Bar & lobby Restaurant.
- Poor Valet Parking. Comparing with the price of ( 60$ USD ) A DAY.
- Concierge service with a Lack of Knowledge about the city attraction & Activities ( All they did is giving me a city Map!!!!!) . ( I used my VERTU Concierge Service).
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.
review.locationRemarks: Good Location, near the West field mall & Union Square.

review.title: it was great.
review.reviewText: I asked them to put rose petals on the bed, and they even threw in a free bottle of champagne.

review.title: Convenient and clean, well appointed hotel
review.reviewText: Would stay here again. It's 2 blocks from the Powell St BART station so it's easy to get to most SF attractions from here. Hotel is new, clean, and luxurious. Expensive appointments (spa was expensive, bar was expensive, etc), but otherwise I would totally stay here again. Staff were friendly. Right on the border of the rougher part of town, though. Heading south from here might lead you to some bad neighborhoods.
review.negativeRemarks: Would like to see more reasonably priced bar drinks.
review.locationRemarks: It's SF! Cable cars are two blocks. Retail is two blocks. Take a bus or classic streetcar to the waterfront in 20 minutes.

review.title: top notch hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Intercontinental hotel in San Francisco last May 06,2013.The reception staff is very friendly and informative. She recognized my priority club platinum status. I had a clean,spacious room with very comfortable bed.The room is well equipped and had a beautiful view of the city.I would highly recommend this hotel to others. As always, Intercontinental hotel is top notch.

review.title: SOMA stay
review.reviewText:
The Intercontinental is a sleek,modern high end hotel in the SOMA area that, I believe, caters mostly to business travellers and high end conventioneers. My wife and I got an Expedia deal, however and although we usually prefer boutique hotels, we thought we would give it a try. No complaints about the overall comfort and amenities of the hotel but a couple of quibbles.
1. The honor bar is wired so that if you even move a bottle you get charged for it? Really? What kind of business travellers do they think are staying there?
2. Wireless internet is a standard amenity that you really shouldnt have to pay for separately.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for wireless internet
review.locationRemarks: SOMA, near the Moscone Center and also the main shopping malls

review.title: Very well located.
review.reviewText: Variety of menu at restaurants must improve. it is quite repetitive for more than 3 days.
review.negativeRemarks: Room Cleaning, poor language skills
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great Hotel staff and service very good concierge staff very helpful , rooms very comfortable great views pool and gym very nice. The only minor negative is it is very close to a bit of a slightly tougher area, If you walk 2 blocks I think south the arera is a bit seedy not really an issue as we walked through it during the day but at night it might have a less than desirable element. As I said we walked through during the day and in the evening we cabbed to restaurants so all good I would still highly recomend this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Excellent amenities. Everything is chargable, no conplimentary wifi or coffee which now a days comes standard with any hotel stay. Service was excellent, they new it was my annuversary and they did provide a complimentary bottle of champagne when we got there. The hotel overall is great, very clean, staff friendly, and everything is either within walking distance or a cable ride away.

review.title: A few blocks away from Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful property. It is only 5 years old and if you like sleek and modern you should consider this hotel. It is a few blocks to the Westfield Mall (Bloomingdales and Nordstrom) which is a shoppers paradise! Also, tons of great places to grab a quick bite. As for the Intercontinental, they feature Michelin rated Luce. Also, the city views from the hotel are great.

review.title: The perfect AT&T Park Hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in thru the checkout we were threaten like Royals. The rooms are excellent, the bartender (Ron) is a class by its own. The AT&T Park is in walking distance (20min) and it is a safe walk. We will revisit the Hotel for the next game we will watch!

review.title: Wonderful Weekend in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Each hotel employee that we came in contact with was most helpful. The parking attendant offered to let me park temporarily in the front when checking in and was accommodating in suggesting alternative parking arrangements. The desk clerk upgraded our room because my wife was not able to check in while I was parking the car (her name was not on the reservation). The bartender was generously flexible in our choice of drink special. The bell hop explained that they had a free overnight shoe polish policy and provided a form to accomplish that service.

The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. There were plenty of electrical sockets and drawer storage space.

In short, it was a great stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charge - over $60.

review.title: great customer service
review.reviewText: Nice and clean; service was excellent. Concierge is superb. Rooms were comfortable and a nice size with enough outlets for all electrical devices. Views spectacular.
review.negativeRemarks: small bar which was heavily populated so limited room for late night snack.
review.locationRemarks: good but a small hike to a local drugstore ; close enough to food and shopping.

review.title: Great hotel for business and pleasure.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant, conveniently located! Would return for future business / pleasure trips.

review.title: Understaffed. Rude staff. Bad room service.
review.reviewText: I've stayed here before and loved it. Not this time. Probably won't be staying here nex time.
review.negativeRemarks: where do I start...

review.title: Mother /Daughter Holiday San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel. Staff very helpfull and friendly. Very good location to see San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Very good location to see San Francisco.

review.title: So-So Hotel...
review.reviewText: Overall nice hotel but terrible service. Sometimes I would have to call multiple times to get a response. The valet lost our keys too. Would not recommend this hotel at all.
review.negativeRemarks: The service
review.locationRemarks: Location is great - close to airport, and highway.

review.title: the hotel sucks
review.reviewText:
the hot tub was out of order, and in two days we were staying, they did not even try to fix it.
they charge $52.00 a day for parking, and $15.00 day for internet connection. so there is a $67.00 hidden fee. be aware.

review.title: Great Views!
review.reviewText: The view of SF from anywhere in this hotel is fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds, in-room coffee, shower, huge comfy towels.
review.negativeRemarks: cost for parking
review.locationRemarks: perfect location

review.title: Definitely stay at the Intercontinental again!
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable. I was a bit skeptical at first about the location, as it appeared a bit further than I would like to stay (union square), but it was only a five minute walk and the hotel is conveniently located behind Westfield shopping centre. I would definitely stay again!

review.title: Central Location, beautiful contemporary hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel! Contemporary and luxurious. Very dog-friendly! 50 fee for pets, $50 for parking, but we got such a good deal, it was worth it. Very quiet oasis in the heart of the city. Extremely clean, quiet (no noise from street), and it has a nice international vibe. Easy walk to Opera House, Asian Art Museum, Shopping, Union Square, etc. Go to the top floor for some amazing views. Well-done; nice LEED hotel. Will definitely return!
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff!Nice to be taken care of when you arrive in the bustling city.
review.negativeRemarks: $50 valet, but in the city, hard to avoid
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Asian Art Museum, Opera House, Shopping, Union Square

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: amazing view and location, very well kept, staff were the only let down!

review.title: Great for the the Business traveller
review.reviewText:
Outstanding service from the Front Desk to the Valet Service.

Great location for the business traveller. Lively afterwork crowd in the lounge.

Parking is expensive as usual for SFO.

review.title: InterContinental Does it again.
review.reviewText: I have travelled all around the world and one lesson learned is you get what you pay for. This hotel will always surpass expectations. the staff is exceedingly helpful and go out of their way, even when they are very busy, to help you. Thank you to all the front desk, concierge, valet, porters, and housekeeping. The hotel is celebrating its 5th year and so everything is still quite new and the design is modern. The amenities spaces were always kept very clean and the spa was excellent. We took the suite on the top floor, and if its in the budget, i recommend it as it is very comfortable and well laid out. The hotel is perfectly located in the core right next to the Moscone convention centre, so if you are a business traveller, the location makes perfect sense. I had my wife and 2 teenage children and only needed to walk 3 blocks to be in the heart of the Union Square and Market Street shopping experience. We have stayed and the westin, hilton and the nikko and the Inter Continental has been the best so far.

review.title: great weekend getaway
review.reviewText: Awesome service!!! Upscale and professional. Friendly staff. Would stay here again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel on an iffy street
review.reviewText: Great hotel in all aspects. The street it's on is a little sketchy. Take a taxi to and from hotel at night
review.negativeRemarks: The area
review.locationRemarks: Howard is 2 blocks south of market. Not a great place at night.

review.title: Total Package....
review.reviewText:
Booked this hotel on the Expedia 40 percent off link.....don't know which hotel you get, just know it will be 4.5 stars and will be in a certain area of town......
So this was chosen for me.....it was excellent......certain things were expensive....ex: Valet was $57 a night.......there were no soda machines on our floor so we paid for mini bar sodas which were $4 a piece for 8.5 oz of soda......lol. But if you expect to pay these fees, then you should have no issues with this Hotel...customer service was excellent and the room was clean, nice and I had no complaints whatsoever....... Highly recommend to anyone....unless on a tight budget.

review.title: Great hotel with all the amenities
review.reviewText: The hotel is within walking distance to BART, shopping, and restaurants. The parking fee is about $60 including taxes per night. It is steep but typical for San Francisco hotels. Clean and visually pleasing. No complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Want to go back
review.reviewText:
Really needed a break and this hotel was just fab. We booked it because of the indoor pool to wear the kids out in the eve, it was a little cold but had a very friendly atmosphere.
We just felt that the staff loved their jobs and really went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Bed was so comfortable and the room felt spacious with kids!
We were able to walk to great restaurants and cafes alike. Within a few minutes walk there is a park at the Yerba Buena center and opposite a huge merry go round. I would go back in a heart beat.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText:
Stayed there on a Saturday night with my wife so we could party in the city. The hotel was VERY accommodating we were treated the way you expect at this price range and the room was very clean and nice. When you call downstairs they say hello Mr. <insert your last name here> and that's nice they have a good system like that.

The only bad is the bed was a little small for us (I'm 6'3") and it was very dry in the room (or maybe I drank too much? lol)

we still loved the place and our time there.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bed, slow response from the TV remote
review.locationRemarks: great food at the irish pub next door!!!!

review.title: not courtesy front desk staff
review.reviewText:
Did not like the crisis the front desk made because they got a pre approval of my credit card of 100 dollars. In the second day, I had spent more than that so they simply blocked our keys and were not pleasant to my wife in order to get another pre approval that was on my behalf.

best

review.title: Newer than most in the city...
review.reviewText: As one of the newer hotels in San Francisco, the Intercontinental offers a reliably comfortable stay in the city that's otherwise expected in wealthier suburbs or gentrified city outskirts. The lack of architectural charm or a scenic, active neighborhood might be detractors for some. But for Moscone-based conferences or business along Market Street and SOMA, it's convenient, clean, and very well maintained; not to mention the large rooms and spectacular city or bay views from the mid- to high floors, even from some bathrooms. The cost varies from reasonably good to jaw-droppingly outrageous depending on events in the city and expected occupancy rates. Over ten or more different stays since 2009, I've paid between $150 to $450 for the same room type. The corner executive rooms are exceedingly nice with floor to ceiling windows - not to be experienced alone!
review.positiveRemarks: The fitness center... especially if you're early enough to get some of the nicer fruit.
review.negativeRemarks: Wildly fluctuating room rates.
review.locationRemarks: A few long blocks from civilization (e.g. restaurants, shopping, business center), but otherwise convenient and quiet.

review.title: Holiday Happiness
review.reviewText: Cannot go wrong with this hotel. Great food (Michelin star restaurant in lobby that serves championship bread :-) The 6th floor pool and spa is wonderful with an outdoor area to relax. The rooms are very nice. Staff is great. Only drawbacks are paying for wifi and the cost of the valet parking; otherwise, perfect.

review.title: Nice and modern,but not best location
review.reviewText: On the edge of the desirable area for tourists. Best suited to business folks attending conventions at the Moscone Centre.
review.negativeRemarks: Neighbourhood.
review.locationRemarks: Very good for conventioneers. Not the best for tourists.

review.title: Nice hotel, bad service
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, except that they charge for everything! Wi-Fi fee, movie fee, parking fee, etc. It gets annoying. Also when I stayed there, the hotel had a fight breakout in the ballroom from a high school event. From my room I saw about 5 cop cars come to the hotel. My daughter was sick and I had to go get medicine, I tried calling the reception desk for 30 minutes to make sure it was safe to come down until I finally got a response. We were told to stay in the room since the hotel was on lockdown. When I explained my disappointment of that night to the staff upon checkout they just said 'sorry' and shrugged it off. For the price, I expected better service and a little more sympathy.

review.title: great location and price\
review.reviewText: great location. very new york like in structure. nice pool and jacuzzi for cold nites. concierge was best that i have used. took his time and was so nice to deal with.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is wonderful the location is superb very close to union square and the service is superb

review.title: False Advertising
review.reviewText:
Reserved room (king size bed, smoking) on Christmas Eve.
1. Drove to San Francisco and was stunned to find no self-parking or parking area for guests -- Valet Only @ $59 per night!! OUTRAGEOUS!! Not only was that price outrageous, but having to tip the driver each time you wanted something from the car or to move it was ridiculous!
2. Had to have luggage loaded onto a cart by bellman -- another tip!
3. Had luggage cart unloaded by another bellman -- another tip!
4. Reserved SMOKING room on-line. Upon check-in, was told entire hotel is non-smoking! If you smoke in the room expect a $250 charge! OUTRAGEOUS!
5. Went outside to smoke and hotel is surrounded by homeless/drug dealers! OUTRAGEOUS!
6. Checking out of hotel necessitated tipping bellman and car attendant again! We weren't in Las Vegas!
Terrible Experience!!

review.title: Why stay elsewhere?
review.reviewText: Quiet and comfortable; great location; good bargain. Definitely a "value" hotel in the city.

review.title: Very nice hotel and convenient location
review.reviewText: Hotel is very nice and a convenient location, walking distance to union market square. We mistakenly walked further down, and that area is a bit dodgy. If you stick to the area around the hotel and upto market square, you're fine.

review.title: Weekend trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: Beautiful new hotel close to Union Square and great shopping. Came here for holiday weekend.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful hotel and amenities. Concierges are fantastic!
review.negativeRemarks: If your room faces Howard Street, there is much street noise such as fire trucks, beeping horns. You may want to ask for a room on the other side.
review.locationRemarks: Good location not far from Union Square.

review.title: In the city and yet easy for Silicon Valley
review.reviewText: A five star hotel at a very accessible location. Easy walk to everywhere and easy access to the freeways.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: Great Hotel for Family
review.reviewText: My family stayed here before and we were impressed by the hotel. The kids loved the indoor pool and we loved the proximity to shops and AT&T park. On our last visit, the room given to us was on the dirtier than usual. The room didn't looked vacuumed and the furniture, carpet and curtain were stained. I would stay here again but I would like to see cleaner rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: On our last stay the cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping

review.title: expensive
review.reviewText: Parking was a little pricey but overall it was a nice hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.userLocation: San Pedro, Los Angeles, CA, USA

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Our room was a bit small (we requested a queen and thought we would get the typical 2 queen beds, but indeed it only had a queen bed) so that it was not good for 2 people to sit in the room to lounge or watch tv. Otherwise, comfortable and quiet on the 28th floor. Overall facilities were good and well-maintained, concierge staff was helpful and lobby bar was convenient. 5 block walk to Union Square was not an issue at all, and it was even nice to be away from some of that hustle and bustle.

review.title: Good Hotel First class
review.reviewText: Your staff are friendly and helpful willing to go that extra mile for you ..

review.title: Beware of Doorman/Valet Parking
review.reviewText: Our TV never worked properly and calls to fix were not returned. Worst of all the Doorman (Earnest) took my daughter's car for Valet parking once we arrived at the Hotel from the Airport, never once advising us of the cost. We were shocked beyond belief when we were charged $52 to retrieve our car. My daughter lives in SF and has a 72 hr road parking pass so we could have parked for free had we known that valet parking was so costly. Furthermore when we complained to the front desk they refused to take responsibility, saying basically if was our fault for not asking what the fee was. They also said Valet was a separate entity from the hotel and we had to take it up with them. We gave our car to the Doorman not the Valet service. We had not even checked in yet nor walked back to where the Valet rates were posted, so the Hotel should have taken responsibility, I will NEVER stay there again. My husband and I felt that it was a total scam.
review.positiveRemarks: The Concierge staff were very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Doorman & Front Desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: meh
review.reviewText: Not so good. Staff looks down on you, amenities closed at 10. Boring.

review.title: Great hotel, very clean and beautiful
review.reviewText: We were in SF for a Giants game, and found this hotel to be well located for our needs. Every employee that we encountered was very professional and nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds, very friendly staff

review.title: Nice hotel, but you can find better for the money.
review.reviewText:
First glance looked impressive, but then found that the room could have been cleaner. Carpet needed a vacuum, windows had imprints left from past occupants. No Kleenex in the dispenser, faucet only supplied boiling hot water, hair dryer was faulty.

Gym facilities were excellent and used every day.

Free internet can be found anywhere in San Francisco except the hotels, including the Intercontinental. Go figure.

Convenient for conventions, otherwise a little out of the way. Be careful where you walk at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Upkeep of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Good for conventions. Stay east of 5th street, especially at night.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Usually stay at Hilton Properties but wanted to try something different to compare. Better room than the Hilton but staff not as friendly. Liked the location and walked to & from AT&T Park for the ballgames.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff a little stuffy
review.locationRemarks: Great spot located between Market Strret and AT&T Park

review.title: Clean Hotel, Great Staff.
review.reviewText: I came to San Francisco for a weekend visit with my daughter. She and her husband recently moved to the area, and we wanted to stay in a nice hotel that was conveniently located. The hotel and rooms are very clean, and the staff is professional and coureous. They were able to answer questions and connected us with discounts on city tours that were very enjoyable. The food at the hotel is expensive, but it is almost everywhere in the city. The location isn't quite as convenient as I would have liked, but if shopping is what you're looking to do, it is perfect.

review.title: Decent hotel for business travel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice. Although for the price, internet and breakfast should have been included for free.
review.negativeRemarks: price of internet and minibar
review.locationRemarks: business district

review.title: Modern facilities and a convenient location
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the location was convenient to shopping. My only complaint is that food from a room service plate was on the carpet outside of our room along with a plate when we checked in. The food was still on the carpet after the plate was collected.

review.title: Made my date night amazing.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a date night in the city. It was great!! Hotel was so nice an open, the service was fantastic. Everyone was really nice and helpful. I will be stayin here every time i visit sf.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool and hot tub. Fantastic views
review.negativeRemarks: I had to check out eventually
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Great city views, close to everything.

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: Incredible. Everything is new. Commodities are great and the location is nice. You're next the most useful Muni (bus and trams) lines by walking distance (less than 5 minutes).The bar 888 is really nice and has some great grappa mixes for the ladies and some grappa tastings for the men.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything's new, staff is incredible, the Bar 888 has awesome grappa tastings. Try the Classic Flight!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee is a steal. Park in the street. 70$ a night, really?
review.locationRemarks: Next to Muni and Bart services. Dead center of all you need to see in SF but not to close to Union Square where the freak show runs until 10-11 PM.

review.title: we Loved our stay
review.reviewText:
great hotel location near to the union SQ and many shops and restarants .

only drawback that Internet and parking are not free
review.negativeRemarks: high charge for Internet and parking & there is no free WIFI in lobby

review.title: Great Hotel at Great Rates!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and very clean. I was very happy with the service!

review.title: Great location for families!
review.reviewText: Very clean, new, and modern. Nice staff. Great location for families! Nice views from the 23rd floor. A bit pricey for a classic room. Great hot tub and indoor pool - our 4-yr old enjoyed them!

review.title: Very nice hotel. Great service.
review.reviewText: The InterContinental was a great hotel to stay in. The hotel was newer (I think only a few years old) and in very good repair. I thought I would be blown away by the rooms and/or common areas (lobby) but I wasn't. The rooms were nice, but similar to a Grand Hyatt, W, and other larger high-end chains. Perhaps I shouldn't have expected anything different? Either way, the rooms were nice and clean. I think what made the experience DIFFERENT was the level of service from the staff. From the moment I check in to the moment I check out everyone was super nice and very attentive and made everything happen for me the way I wanted it to happen and immediately when I requested the service. So, I think with this hotel chain what you get is a level of service and attention to detail/comfort that you wouldn't at one of the other similar hotel chains.

review.title: Great hotel for shopping, tourism, etc
review.reviewText: The hotel is great! Walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc.

review.title: Great for Business!
review.reviewText: This is the perfect hotel for business travelers. It is conveniently located near the Moscone Convention Center and offers excellent service. LUCE restaurant is located in the hotel and the food is amazing! Burlington Coat Factory is right across the street along with a Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant. Cabs are frequent and the hotel is only about eight blocks from the San Francisco Bay Bridge - walking distance. If you're walking towards the ocean you're fine but if you start to walk anything past 6th you will encounter a more run down part of San Francisco.
