review.negativeRemarks: Everything was perfect. No bad remarks from me.
review.locationRemarks: Location is decent. Right next to Moscone Convention Center. Like I said in my review, just don't walk past 6th.

review.title: a perfect hotel
review.reviewText: That's a perfect new hotel. The building is less then 5 years old. Top floors have perfect view.
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant

review.title: Over Priced
review.reviewText:
Although we were compensated by an upgrade of a room due to our room not being ready, what a disappointment. I cannot believe a hotel wants to charge for WIFI. The parking is expensive. Luckily we had a person tell us about a lot next door that cost half the price.
The rooms here are not anything special. The bedspread was well made. Having stayed at the Four Seasons, St Moritz, and, Ritz Carlton this doesn't even come close. Yes, I also stay at less expensive places like Marriott, Westin,and Holiday Inn Express. I give these all better reviews.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Excellent location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent location in San Francisco; immaculately clean, very comfortable
review.positiveRemarks: Its location, its cleanliness, its luxury
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the desk staff were not welcoming
review.locationRemarks: Superb

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Room had everything you would need. We had 3 kids and there was plenty of room. Only downside would be you were about 2 blocks from restaurants and shops but not a big problem as very easy to walk.
review.locationRemarks: Had to walk a few blocks to get to Dennys or diner and another block after that to hit the shops

review.title: Wifi
review.reviewText: Wifi is way to expensive. If you're paying that much for a room, why isn't wifi included? If motel 6 can have free wifi, why not you? Wasnt about to pay $15 a day for wifi. Otherwise, great hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for wifi. Which I didn't. To many homeless people in SF.

review.title: Great location for shopping/short walk to AT&T
review.reviewText: Great motel and a 15 minute walk to AT&T park. Will return another time.

review.title: great hotel for couple
review.reviewText: I really liked the hotel. Thought it was super nice, very comfortable and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: the bed and pillows were very comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: there is like NO personal space in the fridge. Make sure NOT to take out mini bar items to make more room because it automatically charges you!
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Better for business than family vacation.
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and courteous. Valet service was fast and friendly. Most services and amenities are focused on business travelers rather than families with children. We were routinely left fewer towels than guests registered to the room, and on two separate days no washcloths were left. We attempted to order room service once, however we were quoted a 35 minute wait just to have our order taken so we went out instead.
review.negativeRemarks: Very overpriced for what you get.
review.locationRemarks: Was quoted as Fisherman's Wharf area, but it's really more SOMA area.

review.title: great for family
review.reviewText: very close location to the A T & T ballfield, able to walk to the venue

review.title: Cosmopolitan hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Concierge was very helpful and friendly. Really nice bathroom and shower.
review.locationRemarks: This is a great location for a business traveler but a little too far away for a family doing the touristy San Fran sites.

review.title: Very nice hotel!!
review.reviewText: They treated us like royalty. Very professional staff.
review.negativeRemarks: $59 valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union Square. Easy to walk to places of interest.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The only negative was they left a cot in my room in front of the window blocking the view. Not a serious problem, but a little sloppy.

review.title: Great new hotel in San fran
review.reviewText: Fantasitic new hotel in San Fran , room was very roomy,clean and comfortable. The room was not cheap but the US PGA was on so I don't know if you could get it cheaper . Location was excellent just a couple of blocks from centre of San Fran., we stayed in one night for dinner and had the Italian take away from across the road which was amazing!! Loved this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi for a top dollar hotel
review.locationRemarks: Great location , close to the centre of San Fran

review.title: San fransisco
review.reviewText: Good rooms.. Internet access wasn't very good and over priced for silicon valley!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge was very helpful.. Loved him lots.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for the net that wasn't good especially in San fransisco..,,
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: $65 a day valet parking, only parking option.
review.reviewText: Upon our arrival to the hotel we were shocked with the $65 per day valet parking only option. With no self parking for the guests we were left scrambling to find a spot on the street (risky enough) or pay from $35 to $40 a day wiht no in and out priviledge from vendors around the area. It's imposible to enjoy your vacation when you have to constantly worry about moving your car from place to place even while staying at the hotel. Also, watch out for the computerized fridge with drinks in it. If removed from the fridge each drink will be automatically billed to your account. The warning about it is so small and easy to miss. So don't touch the drinks if you don't want to pay for them.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is bad.
review.locationRemarks: The area is kind of shady.

review.title: Good, modern hotel downtown SF
review.reviewText: Walking distance to the trolleys. Very comfortable room. Shuttle from/to the airport for 16 or 17 dollars. Good food at the restaurant. Breakfast was not included, the nice buffet was 28/person. Internet was expensive at the business center.

review.title: Not a 4.5 star hotel -- mediocre at best.
review.reviewText: This is NOT a 4.5 star hotel. Sure, it's new and clean, but the entire hotel, including the lobby, the main dining room, guest rooms, etc. is designed snd built more like a three star hotel. There is zero luxury at this hotel. Just the bare essentials. The breakfast buffet downstairs is terrible. Having stayed at many Intercontinental Hotel lications throughout the world, I can honestly say that this SF location is NOT up yo the usual Intercontinental standards.
review.negativeRemarks: Food
review.locationRemarks: Not in the best neighborhood of the city.

review.title: Worth every penny!
review.reviewText: Immpecable customer service throughout the hotel. I will stay at this and other Intercontinental Hotels in the future. Upscale decor, professional service in all departments, clean, comfortable, quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Bedroom and bathroom finishes were upscale and contemporary without feeling too modern. Warm and inviting.
review.locationRemarks: The city view rooms offered amazing view.

review.title: Business hotel Moscone or AAT Park
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel. Location could be better for shopping. Excellent location for Moscone.
review.negativeRemarks: Location for shopping
review.locationRemarks: Good for Moscone not so good for shopping

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: They should tell or give us information about the amenity of the hotels. We din't know there was an workout area or an indoor pool.

review.title: Great hotel experience!
review.reviewText: This was the second time for my wife and I to stay at the InterContinental San Francisco and the experience was even better that the first time. The amenities were superb and the staff were very professional and attentive. The Club Lounge access was very convenient whenever we needed a snack or beverage and made it easy for us to start our exploration of the city right from the hotel and return to relax after a full day. We love to take our vacations in San Francisco and will definitely make the InterContinental San Fransisco our home away from home in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Very professional staff and Club Lounge access
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Close to great shopping centers.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Our hotel stay was great. The hotel and room were very clean. We were most impressed by the friendliness of the staff!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to shopping mall and restaurants.

review.title: Superb Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location near Union square and AT &T Park, walking distance to Yerba Buena Park and the Metreon as well. Beautiful interrior and exterior. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is very convenient and clean and upscale
review.negativeRemarks: One block away its a seedy part of the town

review.title: The Intercontintal San Fran.
review.reviewText: Room had a great view. Bed was very comfortable, pillow top mattress etc. Bathroom was modern excellent shower, despite the low flow water shower head. The location was perfect, near Market St. and a short walk to everything, union square is a few long blocks, but fine. I have stayed at the Fairmont and Palace hotels before and it is sometimes refreshing to have a new modern room/and hotel structure. However with that being said, the "InterContinental" does lack some character and "joie de vivre." Sometimes these hotels get too "corporatized" and lack soul. The only restaurant is LUCE which is highly rated, but $28.00 (before tax) for a small breakfast buffet, come on, worth $18.00 tops. The parking is excessive, which can be avoided by driving around a few surrounding blocks to a more reasonable garage, such as the Mission Garage/5th St. at about $30.00 a day (with security) unless of course your car is exotic. Also the internet charges are a bit un-hip in this age of free wi-fi and especially San Fran being so internet savvy. I avoided this by taking my laptop somewhere else, and actually spending my money more locally. Obviously they focus on the "expense account" customer, but really those days are numbered as companies don't like being gouged either. But all in all, it is a quality building and a quality room, and for my costs that averaged just under $200 a night, hotel and park, it is hard to beat that in the expensive city core of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of building, clean and quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of reasonable priced food, customers want options not expensive all the time, excessive internet and parking charges (which can be avoided).
review.locationRemarks: Good centralized location, the Mission St. does get its share of homeless/substance addicted people, just ignore and walk on.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Great service. Room was super clean. Well kept up with during our stay. Was very happy and would stay there again

review.title: you'll have to take out a mortgage for parking
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel. great views. very clean. we enjoyed our time there. the hotel is conveniently located to some of the nicest shops in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: parking is so expensive

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Great hotel and top location. Really enjoyed ... It's an upscale hotel!

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great hotel, everything was very new and very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Only 2 blocks away from Union Square.

review.title: A great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Great location just South of Market, close to shops and only a 15min walk from the Embarcadero. Hotel was clean and new, with good complimentary facilities such as online checking-in and boarding card printing, a functional business suite and a very helpful concierge. The room was a decent size, spotlessly clean and well equipped. Would recommend particularly for the business traveller or couples.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time. The hotel staff were very friendly as well as the cleaning staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet was expensive.
review.locationRemarks: It was near where we wanted to be located.

review.title: Wifi
review.reviewText: Only complaint was that they make you pay for wifi - which is really incredible when even Starbucks and the airport can offer free wifi.

review.title: San Fran 2012
review.reviewText: The room was well kept, clean and comfy. I stayed for just under a week and the only two things I can complain about were the minibar was never refilled so I had to search for orange juice each morning and in the evening soda, not the biggest inconvenience but I guess I kept thinking "Maybe they forgot, they'll do it tomorrow" lol Great location, food and staff with the exception of one cocky little guy at the front desk everything was perfect!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and comfort-ability of the room!
review.negativeRemarks: Just one random employee that acted like a child & mini bar service not refilled
review.locationRemarks: Location made it easy for access to everything

review.title: 22nd floor corner room
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to a king bed with 180 degree city views. We only spent one night, but the hotel was very nice, clean, and quiet.

review.title: Not the Mark Hopkins IC
review.reviewText: This is a nice business hotel. It lacks the luxurious feeling you get from the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental up in Nob Hill, but is by all means a modern, well kept, well run hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Too business oriented
review.locationRemarks: Not in a great block per se, but within walking distance of Museums and shopping district.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great hotel - Great location
Parking rate is too high

review.title: Great luxury hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: Staff was very professional, greeted us upon arrival, provided recommendations for dinning and provided a welcome call.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking price.

review.title: Priority Club membership ignored
review.reviewText: The most disappointing part of our stay was check in and the lack of recognition of a Priority Club membership. The person who checked us in did not offer us an upgrade and did not even offer a king bed. We were put in the lowest level of rooms--queen bed, small room.

review.title: Nicest hotel I've ever stayed in!
review.reviewText:
Fantastic customer service and we received an upgrade to the 23rd floor with a great city view without even asking. The front desk staff were courteous and the concierges were amazing. We asked dozens of questions and they were patient, informative and actually seemed to enjoy their jobs!

I was there on vacation with a friend but imagine this hotel would be nice for families, too. Decent indoor lap pool and jacuzzi. Wish they were open later but I think closing at 10pm is pretty standard.

Didn't try the restaurant but wish we had - just ran out of time. The bar wasn't too bad; most of the bartenders were quite good (two in particular), but the food menu for it was pretty limited, especially after 10pm.

Our bathroom only had a shower and would have liked a tub but no big deal. The beds were soooo comfortable!
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge staff, pool/jacuzzi, clean rooms with comfy beds, great city view.
review.negativeRemarks: Limited food options at bar, especially after 10pm.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic central location that allowed us to walk to most other neighbourhoods in SF, but also only a few blocks from major transit systems.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location! Close to shopping , Union square, major shopping! Everything was pleasant, from the service of the staff to the room. Upon checking in I was upgraded to a room, free of charge, with a great view. I will definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Favorite things, great bathrooms, comfy bed, quick room service, I ordered breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: I could hear door closings, and people getting ice from the ice machine.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location, in walking distance to MOMA, Union Square, Westfield Mall, and Chinatown, also very easy to get a cab.

review.title: Not Union Square
review.reviewText: We bid on a Union Square hotel and ended up with this one. It is a decent walk to get into the heart of Union Square. The hotel was nice but the location was not what we were looking for. Very sketchy neighborhood. Recommend a cab in the evening to avoid the activity of the street going on around the hotel. Once in the hotel we felt safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Isolated

review.title: Must. Eat. The Food!
review.reviewText: Food. Was. PHENOMINAL. No microwave. Little room in the mini fridge. But ggreat experience none the less. Absurd parking cost.
review.negativeRemarks: The Expense. Especially with parking.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. 'Quiet' part of San Fran. Walking distance from Bart and other public transportation.

review.title: Fantastic

review.locationRemarks: Great location for families and couples, tons to do within walking distance

review.title: 4 Star Home away from Home in SF
review.reviewText: I came from the W and a recent stay at the Westin (I have status on SPG), but the Intercontinental is my new 2nd home in SF. The club floor is amazing and well worth the additional expense.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort and Class with Great Service
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone SOMA, hey across the street from Buca da Beppo!

review.title: Best value!
review.reviewText: Wonderful Hotel, wonderful staff. Could have done with a more consistent concierge. One time the desk would be fabulous and another time, a bit lack luster. However, the front desk and waitstaff were splendid! The beds were fabulous!
review.positiveRemarks: You have to try the Hemmingway Daiquiri and the beds.... so very exquisite.

review.title: Intercontinental Hotel
review.reviewText: Spacious rooms for SF. Excellent Market St. location. Very courteous & efficient staff. I would stay there again.

Small room

review.title: Quality and Convenience
review.reviewText:
A great hotel and only 4 to 5 minutes walk from the hub of shopping on offer in San Francisco. The concierge were excellent and provided useful information on both transport needs and restaurants.
Check-in and departure were simple and the staff made us feel very welcome - the room was excellent on the business floor and the facilities like the gym and pool were outstanding.

Only niggle was the price of wine in the bar - 2 glasses of Pinot Noir during happy hour cost me US$42: this was excessive and mean't we did not drink in the bar again and took our custom to a local place recommended by the hotel staff.

Watch the drink prices but other wise a great choice of hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Price of Drinks in the bar (Pinot Noir)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: It was a nice weekend getaway, I would gladly do i

review.title: Modern hotel with spacious rooms
review.reviewText: Nice new hotel very close to the Moscone Center. Rooms are big and bright and bedding is comfortable.

review.title: Worth the price!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Great view! Went for our anniversary and they upgraded our room and gave us a bottle of champagne. Very nice!

review.title: Pricey but great

review.title: Review

review.negativeRemarks: Some plumbing noises and unreliable and expensive wireless internet

review.negativeRemarks: Expensive city parking ($52 per night)

review.title: Can't be better
review.reviewText: New and modern high rise hotel, I haven't found any flaws

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location and amazing price at Christmas. I enjoyed the holiday stay very much.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee maker in room
review.locationRemarks: Close to westfield shopping center

review.title: SOMA pushes south
review.reviewText: Beautifully decorated room with good attention to necessary amenities, excellent linens and bathroom layout. The staff was friendly and went the extra yard to speak to guests which is unusual in a big city hotel. The eco-awareness was evident in the facility, a plus in my book. I was disappointed that in a facility that charges what they do that internet access was $15 a day. What is that about? Almost all basic motels have free internet these days and with the number of business travelers it seems there is the mind set to charge when it is not necessary because a certain percentage of their guests just charge it to expense accounts I suppose. The location is great and he concierge staff was helpful in answering questions about the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Charges for internet access and prices in the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Great, especially if attending functions at Moscone Center

review.title: AWESOME HOTEL PERFECT !!!

You get off the bart train and it leaves you just 2 blocks from the hotel. You are so close to union square and all the high lights of san francisco. : )
review.negativeRemarks: Small room but everything in San Francisco is small.

review.title: towels

review.title: from a hotel designers point of view

not a 4-1/2 star hotel in my mind as it was rated i don't know what else you want me to say.
it was not what were told.
review.negativeRemarks: it wasn't very clean thought, there was a straw wrapper in the elevator lobby for four days so that means the public areas don't get clean very often
review.locationRemarks: noisey, not in the best of neighborhooods, looked out to burlington coat factory not what i consider a 41/2 star hotel

review.title: Awesome SF downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: Having stayed at a few downtown SF hotels now this one beats the rest, and it may not have the spectacular views of the Westin's but it oozes sophistication and polish, is reasonably priced and unlike like many SF hotels has great engaged employee's.

review.title: SF place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect. Great large windows. Nice views. Walking distance from everything. I have stayed in hotels all over the city and this one is the best!

review.title: Fine but nothing special
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel as a last minute mystery hotel and were initially quite excited. The staff we encountered were friendly and there is a nice bar and foyer area as you enter. The location is convenient enough to the Union Square area and nearby shops although not quite in the thick of it (but really we had no issue with location at all). The room however was nothing special and a bit of a let down. Yes, it was clean and had all the hallmarks of stock standard chain hotel about it, but was rather smaller than we expected (also given we had a child with us), and the bed seemed smaller than usually offered in a hotel of this type. The room itself was a little oddly shaped in the corner area of the hotel. It was perfectly fine for one night's stay but there are no doubt other hotels in that price range in San Francisco, which offer rooms that are bit more special and memorable.

Parking is by valet only and is incredibly expensive. instead, use one of the privately run stations across the road. We paid $10/day instead of about $50.

review.title: Truly 5 star!
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at this hotel. Our room was very spacious with a fantastic view from the 22nd floor. It is conveniently located. Close enough to walk to the main shopping and food places but far enough to have peace and quiet after a long day.
It would have been nice though if the internet is free. In some high end hotels we've stayed, internet is complimentary.
Regardless, I rate this hotel as 5 star in terms of service and cleanliness. I'll stay here again next time I go to San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful hotel next to convention center
review.reviewText: It is a beautiful hotel close to Bloomdingdales, Nordstrom and the convention center. Seems to be right on the edge of the acceptable neighborhoods. Easy walk to Bart during the day. Used the Expedia unpublished rates and was very happy with the rate and hotel, it was an incredible deal

review.title: Good location but not a quality intercontinental
review.reviewText: For the price and name you expect more. It has a medicore rooms and rest room like a holiday inn near an airport. Water saving equipment that would make your morning shaving and brushing your teeth is lengthy and painful. cheap but okay furniture. I wouldn't stay there again unless I couldn't find rooms any where else

review.title: Nice place in San Fran
review.reviewText: A good hotel. I run hotels for a living, so I'm a little biased, but this one was just fine. Nothing blew me away, nothing disappointed me.

review.title: Nice modern hotel
review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed our stay at the intercontinental. It was extremely comfortable and clean. The only things to note are that the rooms with two beds have double beds, not queens (common in San Francisco, but still tight for four guests) and like most "fancy" hotels the in-room pricing is insane. A bottle of Fuji water is $8 (I mean come on!). So we brought water from a liquor store down the street and in the morning got our coffee at Starbucks to avoid the $10 room service charge (+$3 delivery & 18% gratuity + tax). So our couple of cups of coffee would have been $16.

But this seems to be the norm with "fancy" hotels. And we got a great "hidden" rate through Expedia compared to what we found elsewhere.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText:
Nice and close to Union Square, plenty of eating options but the best value is go down to the bottom level of Bloomingdales, the food is cheap and really really nice, my favorite, Coriander. Great Pad Thai and Green curry.
Dorion gave us loads of info for our next stop in LA, he was so helpful and very very friendly, take the town car to the airport rather than a taxi it's only $45 and much nicer option.

review.title: Dirty room
review.reviewText: Heard great things about this hotel. Great location, comfortable bed...but it seems they short cutted cleaning our room. Found shopping boxes in the room from previous person. Found clumps of brown hair stuck on the shower wall, and the toilet looked like it had not been scrubbed that week. Pretty gross!

review.title: it is a nice hotel, I would definitely come back again
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel. I got a full view room. It is in the 17th floor. So you get to see the city very well,even the sea.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: Very happy with my stay! This is a beatiful, well run quality hotel. Upon check-in, the front desk personnel were very courteous and professional. I asked for a room with on a high floor with a nice view and they upgraded me to a larger room on the 14th floor. The room was very spacious and with new furnishings. I was not put off by the contemporary decor like some reviewers. Yes, the hotel does seem like it was designed more for the business traveler than the tourist, but I appreciated the spacious room and lack of clutter. I am an amateur photographer and it was nice to have a large work area to connect to the internet and upload my photos to my computer. Very adequate lighting. The view was fine. I slept very well all three nights I was there. The noise from the street was very minimal. While the location of this hotel is a few blocks from Union Square, the walk is not bad at all. I know some Expedia reviews seem to indicate the walk might be a problem. And, it might be for those unable to walk a few blocks. The lower weekend rate and quality of this hotel more than make up for doing a little walking. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the S. F. Museum of of Modern Art, which I highly recommend. I was a little disappointed in the lack of restaurants in the immediate area, but that is not a problem if you are willing to walk a couple of blocks toward the Union Square area. I did not try the hotel food as it seemed a bit pricey. Highly recommend!

review.title: World class hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was top notch in that hotel. Cannot complaint about anything.

review.title: Wonderfully new in an old city!
review.reviewText: My family and I love the fact that the hotel is new, it didn't feel haunted. We had a wonderful view. The hotel was close to AT&T park which is the whole purpose of our trip is to watch the Giants. Clost to Union square, mall (Market ST), clost to BART, and Moscone Convention Center. Its quite a walk to Nob hill and Chinatown so take the cable car. We werevery fortunate to get a really good deal on this hotel!

review.title: Worth a visit
review.reviewText: Had a lovely time. The hotel wa beautiful, the staff very helpful and well informed. The hotel is near the convention center and walking distance to good shopping.

review.title: InterContinental
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but certainly not great.

review.title: First Stay will return
review.reviewText: This comment pertains more to expedia. I thought the parking fee was a little excessive. These a known costs and it would be helpful if they were posted on the travel site which in my opinion would give consumers a clearer picture. If this hotel's parking rate is within twenty dollars of every one elses I would still go back.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, friendly staff, great location close to Union square

review.title: Great views, friendly staff
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for our one year wedding anniversary. The staff was very friendly and the room was quite comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText:
Mine was an "unpublished rate hotel" reservation and a great deal--a very well-managed and-maintained hotel (and a comfortable and well-appointed room) in a very convenient location and at an incredible rate. I will definitely book this way on Expedia again and would cheerfully stay at the InterContinental SF again.

I only wish there had been a bathtub as well as a shower.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great service - ask for a room off Howard St
review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed or stay - the room was excellent and the hotel staff was very welcoming. Not a big selection of restaurants on the blocks nearby, but a few blocks away we found some great places, and crossing Market Street (3 blocks) we were on the outskirts of Union Square.
The hotel's location next to Moscone Center was easy to access, but also the main access for the fire station a few blocks up, that uses Howard Street (a one way) to start every run. Our room overlooked Howard St, and although it was on the 11th floor, the sirens were loud and often. A suggestion is to ask for a room on the other side...

Overall, very pleased.

review.title: Good hotel for families
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very accomodating.

review.title: Plush and Welcoming
review.reviewText: Even with a moderate rate for the room, we were happy with it. The room was large, view great, and very comfortable. It had connectivity and great amenities. Room service was the best in many years. Only downside for us was the parking rate per day. Otherwise it was very, very upscale.

review.title: A nice new Hotel.
review.reviewText: Really Convenient to Downtown.

review.title: Not as good as before
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco in the past and found it to be a great hotel. On my most recent visit of 5 nights; however, I can say that things are not as good as before. The condition of the 27th floor, deluxe room was not less deluxe. There were issues with a broken lock and burned out light bulbs. The hotel also featured very well worn (ie. see through) bath towels and a similar bath mat. There were funky white spots on a chair in the room, a hole in a lamp shade, a shabby bedskirt. We also had to wait over an hour for housekeeping to deliver hand towels that were not provided after housekeeping service. All in all, the hotel room was quite disappointing in view of my prior experience and the purported 4+ star rating.

review.title: Stunning view
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the modern and cosy architecture, stunning views of the city and friendly / helpful staff. We did not try the restaurant, SF has so many dining options anyway. I definitely recommend it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, wonderful staffs, good size room

review.title: perfect nights stay in san fran!
review.reviewText: great hotel, clean, updated, personable staff - great weekend get away.

review.title: Great for San Francisco
review.reviewText: We enjoyed out stay at the Intercontinental. The location was not too close to most San Francisco tourist locations, but it was a good location for going to AT&T Park. The location itself was a little scary, but then again most streets in big cities can be. the hotel itself was great, as were the people who worked there. Everyone was friendly and considerate, the room was well kept and comfortable, anything we needed we got. Definatly staying there next time I go to a game.

review.title: 6:30AM fire alarm, and no Queen/King beds
review.reviewText:
Upon arriving at 11:00 the only room they could offer me was two double beds, No Queen or King rooms available. Then woke up at 6:30 with a fire alarm (false alarm) and I morning walk down 17 flights of stares.

Guess thats what I get by trying the blind offer.

review.title: Great convenient place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: If you want a good central place to stay in San Francisco, you will like the Intercontinental. It's a new, modern, comfortable hotel with reasonable rates. And it's within easy walking distance of SF MOMA, the convention center, SOMA, Market Street, and Union Square. The Ferry Building and waterfront are just about one mile away (and a pleasant walk). The hotel has very good service. The only downside: The bathrooms are ultra-green, meaning you barely get any water pressure out of the sink faucet. So it takes quite a while even to rinse your toothbrush or to fill a water glass.

review.title: 4.5 Stars is not correct
review.reviewText:
One of the guest pillows had food or candy stuck to one of the sides. I left the pillow out so that they could change the pillow case --but it was not changed the whole three days I stayed.
Granted, I could have called them to let them know, but I was staying with them for work and would leave early and come back late ... and I was exhausted.
My king bed was also extremely lumpy with deep body impressions. I woke up each morning with a back ache.
When I tried to call front desk, no one was available to answer the phone. I called twice and it would just ring and ring.
I truly can not believe this hotel is rated 4.5 stars.
Some rating company needs to re-evaluate this hotel's condition and service.

review.title: Intercontinental SF - A great place to stay.
review.reviewText:
I had read the reviews on tripadvisor.ca and was a little worried based on some of the comments and responses. I was so delighted that they were wrong. I used the Bart to get from the airport to Powell St and then walked 3 blocks to the hotel Very convenient. Some reviews commented on the bad area and people, I saw nothing bad there that would take away from my experience. On checking in to the hotel the staff were courteous, knowledgable and professional. On getting to my room I hear a dog whimpering next door so called the front desk to ensure that it was ok. They were up there and calling me back within minutes. Anytime I asked for anything, the service was exceptional. Room service was fantastic, the food was delivered quickly, hot, well presented and exceptionally tasty.

Room was very comfortable, clean and well maintained every day. I attended a conference at the hotel and the food, coffees, lunches were all first class.

A great hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: My friends and I were looking for a nice hotel and spa and came across the Intercontinental. We loved it. We had a great massage and an excellent view of the city. We are already planning to return.

review.title: Better for Business than Vacation
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental is a lovely, new, modern & clean hotel. It is close to the convention center and Union Square. However, I found the place a bit sterile for my tastes. This is definitely a business person's hotel. My husband and I came to SF for a long weekend getaway but every morning were reminded of work as we rode the elevator down to the lobby with men and women in suits and ties. In this type of place prices for room service, the in room mini-bar, etc. are going to be higher because most of the guests will be expensing their purchases back to the office. The hotel is within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and the Powell Street Cable Car. If I had been traveling alone I may not have felt comfortable walking back to the hotel at night. The Intercontinental is just on the edge of where things start to get a bit seedier. In general I would recommend this hotel, but for my personal tastes I think I would have been happier staying closer to Fisherman's Wharf with the rest of the tourists.

review.title: Great Vacation
review.reviewText:
Great location if you go toward the financial district. Bus, trolley and cable car a block away, as well as lots of shopping and food. However if you go in the opposite direction a block or two...not the best of neighborhoods.
The hotel was modern and clean, the fitness faculties were well kept and the hotel staff was really friendly and accommodating.
I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice Business Hotel but not luxurious vacation hotel
review.reviewText: It is deserving of its 4.5 star rating in terms of business and business location. The room is modern and very clean. But I felt like I was on a business trip and not on vacation. It is close to the convention center and not as close to the fun of Union Square (although it is just a five minute walk away.) I would recommend to people going to SF on business.

review.title: Perfect hotel Location
review.reviewText: Hotel has the perfect location, guest feels comfortable, very clean, rooms really nice and confortable. food is really good at the restaurant and well presented

review.title: Great Property
review.reviewText: Nice property. I didn't realize they were associated with Holiday Inn. Great and easy check in, received very late check out with no issues. Good, polite service and nice room. Very satisfied.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but the surrounding area is dangerous and I wouldn't recommend staying there if you are a woman traveling alone. Expedia billed this as the Union Square area and it isn't.

review.title: Stayed for Macworld 2011
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel!
Hotel is amazing. Staff very friendly and helpful. Stayed on the club level floor and using the club lounge (free cocktails and food) was great. One thing to pass along. Even though I was on the 31st floor, could still hear sirens all day and all night. But the views and fantastic service, more than made up for the sirens. Would recommend this hotel to everyone, and can't wait to stay there again! Thanks for a great stay in San Francisco!

review.title: The room wasn´t clean. Everything else was fine
review.reviewText: Everything else was fine

review.title: San Francisco - Good Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great and special addition to our trip.

review.title: Upset over the Spa Closing.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for the location and it's spa. Location was nice and the room was very clean . However we were not told ahead of time that they had the spa closed due to a remodel. After a few days we did move to another hotel. It is a very nice place and the employees were very accommodating. But we felt like someone should have told us before we booked that the spa would not be available. Never would we have thought a new hotel would be remodeling.

review.title: IC San Fran
review.reviewText: Staff and hotel were great. I would definitely would recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: It was across the street from our New Years Party
review.reviewText: We stayed here because it was across the street from our New Years Eve Party. Didn't exactly choose this hotel for the amenities, although they were nice. The bathroom was really small for the price and i was less than impressed by the bathtub/shower combination. The most annoying part was checking in each time we came back to our room. Maybe they need room-key operated elevators or some other precaution, beacause the level of harrassment was high. I've stayed at 4 diamond hotels and no one ever asked me my floor and room # each time i walked into the lobby. Plus what's the point? No one is getting in a room without a card? My opinion is that the staff really should be friendlier and more service oriented, everything was a bit cold and impersonal.Other than that everything was really luxious and plush.

review.title: Always a great hotel experience.
review.reviewText: We love this hotel. It's always a very pleasant experience checking in and the lobby bar is perfect. Nice and quiet, and can catch the game without dealing with noisy crowds. Get there early though, if you want a seat! The rooms are always spotless and the beds are so comfy, it's hard to get out of them in the morning. It's very close to Union Square, and you can cab anywhere else easily.

review.title: Intercontinental
review.reviewText:
Pros:
Solid business-class property.
Good location for accessing the Powell Street BART station (<10 minute walk), and for the MUNI to get to the rest of the city.
Good location if Union Square is important (shopping, sights, etc)
Lot's of food and drink options close by (Starbucks etc) if you don't want to eat in the hotel

Cons:
Seedy area if you go out a block or two in the wrong direction.
Fire station somewhere close as even on the 19th floor the sound was quite noticable.
Whatever you do, don't go to the Top of the Mark for a drink, wayyyy over-rated and not much to write home about (mostly badly dressed tourist, kids)

review.title: LUXURY IN DOWNTOWN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental Hotel provides a high quality facility with consistently high quality and friendly service. The room was extremely comfortable and quiet. The hotel bar is a lot of fun and the hotel restaurant is well worth a dinner. We enjoyed our stay. Hotel parking is very expensive.

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText:
Everything was so wonderful! The staff were well experienced and helpful.
The only downside was that the parking was $60 per night!!
And I wish the door didn't slam hard everytime are next door room was going in and out.
The location was perfect, the view was so nice, we all had a blast! More than anything the staff were great!

review.title: Customer Service needs work!
review.reviewText:
The Intercontinental was clean and contemporary and the rooms were well appointed but, the service was really lacking. It seemed like one of those places where it was "cool to be unfriendly" and I just don't buy it. We did have one bellman however who was great, had personality and was really helpful. Otherwise, the experience was unremarkable.

In a city of so many choices, I wouldn't go back to this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel, good location but i won't go back to Downtown
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was great it is almost amazing except i prefer not to stay in the downtown next time.

review.title: San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with the most excellent service. The rooms are bigger then other hotels and the views are wonderful.

review.title: Great hotel, fair neighborhood
review.reviewText:
The Intercontinental is a fabulous hotel in a not so fabulous neighborhood. The hotel is relatively new and it shows. The furnishings are plush, but comfortable. The room was relatively large and very quiet. We asked for a high floor and ended up on the 21st floor with a panoramic view of the city. Service was excellent; I couldn't figure out how to use the new style coffee maker and a staff member came right up to show me. The concierge was helpful also in mapping out a trip to the wine country. Although it is a large, they treat you well.

The one issue I had was the neighborhood. The hotel is near the Convention Center south of Market Street. That's great if you are attending a convention. However, it is very crowded and difficult to reach. We consistently had problems getting there.

Otherwise, it's a great place.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Surprised with a free upgrade at check in. Very nice staff and room

review.title: Have already recommended it to others.
review.reviewText:
I was very impressed with the level of comfort. I was visiting for a conference (actually held at the InterContinental). The room was spacious, clean and well apportioned. The bathroom was large, everything worked well (I have been in some well know hotels where that is not a given). The check-in went flawlessly. The neighborhood was nice. I found things nearby. Much to do.
Overall, I would recommend it highly.

review.title: ok, but one issue
review.reviewText: Overall the InterContinental was a very nice modern hotel with very good service. The one issue was with the kitchen of the Luce restaurant (which was outstanding for dinner). During the day they clean the grills or turn off the overhead fans or something and it fills the lobby with smoke so walking through the lobby at that time is unpleasant and you end up smelling like you have been in a kitchen for a while cooking. Otherwise a great hotel.

review.title: This hotel is awesome!
review.reviewText: I definitely recommend this hotel to others! Great customer service, extremely clean and in a very good location!

review.title: understated, yet on par with better hotels in SF
review.reviewText: always on the lookout for new experiences, we tried this hotel in a different neighborhood this trip. Would we go back? probably. Location is the main thing, but the hotel itself does shoot for the fences and...connects!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Seedy Neighborhood
review.reviewText: Nice Rooms, Lobby very generic looking. Location explained the reasonable rates. Rooms spacious and clean. Would have rather stayed in Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel, But Expensive Parking Fees
review.reviewText: My stay at the hotel was wonderful. Service was great and staffs are friendly. However, the parking fee is almost the same as one day of stay. Very very expensive. if you don't have a car, great place to stay at a great location. if you travel with a vehicle, try Hilton at finanical district.

review.title: Intercontinental SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was great - everything was as advertised.

review.title: Would give it another chance
review.reviewText: We were very excited to travel to San Francisco and stay at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary. Check in was great and the service there was exceptional. Once we got up to our room, we were not very impressed with the cleanliness ....the shower had not been cleaned as it was full of the previous guests hair eww. It also appeared that they had forgotten to dust the room as the tables,nightstands etc, were pretty dusty. Also a little upset that when we made in room coffee in the morning, the maid had not replenished any of our condiments for coffee (cream/sugar) called the front desk and it took 50minutes before someone brought us anything...my husband had to go to the lobby bar and bring it back up. Another note, if heading to the bar, service was not very good, we stood at the counter and were completely ignored for 10 minutes?? While we liked the hotel, we were definitely dissapointed with the service, there is room for improvement.

review.title: Why can't 4-star hotels include great ammenities offered free at lesser hotels?
review.reviewText: The hotel is great but I don't understand the fee for internet access and the parking is way over-priced.

review.title: Cincinnati Traveler
review.reviewText: Enjoy our stay. Close to everything we wanted to do, Wish we could have stayed another day.

review.title: Great Place in a great location!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel convienantly located withing walking distance of shopping and the Orpheum Theatre.

review.title: Would not stay anywhere else
review.reviewText:
Service is unparalleled and the location is perfect. Although they say it's in SOMA, it's just a 2 minute walk from Union Square's BART transportation and the Westfield Mall.

The lobby, bar, and hotel restaurant are upscale chic. The 6th floor has a club concierge lounge that I highly recommend upgrading to. The lounge provides complimentary drinks, mighty leaf tea, cappuccinos, and appetizers. Not your typical mozzarella sticks, but items such as beef wellington and spanakopita. Look for Luis in the lounge. He's the friendliest person ever and really makes you feel at home.

Also for such a nice hotel, the price is more than affordable.

review.title: Wonderful Service, Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful- gave us a nice, king bed room on a high floor so that we had a nice view, and the doorman gave us a map and information about how to get to the Ferry Building and Fisherman's wharf via public transportation. Hotel was within walking distance to the huge Westfield shopping center. Definitely will go back to this location!

review.title: Just perfect
review.reviewText:
There was nothing these people couldn't do. Great room, friendly staff, always accomodating and ready to help out. We had no idea of what to do in the city so even the chef that we met in the elevator asked us about our trip and gave us tips. The food (we had breakfast and lunch) and drinks in the restaurant were very good.
We had a fabulous time in SF and a lot was thanks to our stay in the hotel. The only downside was that the concierge helped us reserve a table at a restaurant and it turned out he booked out for the following day. Imagen our surprise when we couldn't get a table that night. But we ended up in the bar instead that had a nice atmosphere, so we didn't complain.

The location is good, close to union square, about 5 min walk, but still far away enough to have a quiet surrounding. The rest of the sights we had to take a taxi or go by bus, which was fine. It's still fairly close.

review.title: Great Hotel for Convention Stay!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely awesome! I had a CNS convention at the Moscone Center. This hotel is connected to the convention center. That's why I originally chose it. After arriving, I was shocked to find that the hotel looked great and my stay was EXCEPTIONAL! The hotel has a massage spa, swimming pool, and a fitness center that even gives you free apples! Every piece of fitness equipment has an LCD TV for your viewing pleasure while you work out. The rooms are absolutely spacious and offer a great view of the city of San Francisco. If you're worried about cleanliness, you've found the right hotel! This hotel is clean as can be! It has a full size restaurant and bar called Luce. The menu options are great, but can get a little pricey. I believe for four of us just to have cocktails came to around $50, but well worth it. I plan on going to San Francisco a third time in a year or so and I will definitely being staying at this hotel!

review.title: Good service!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and very good service, but the location is not optimal.

review.title: great city hotel
review.reviewText: excelent hotel, great staff, great views, very convenient

review.title: San Francisco Approved
review.reviewText: Prepared to receive all kind of customers. Very good...mini bar is expensive, compared to the deli next block. Overall, very good hotel.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was great, everything was better than what we expect it.

review.title: Nice SF hotel, smallish room
review.reviewText: This was a more than adequate hotel for my brief stay, although the room, while well-appointed, was quite small. If I were traveling with my wife, I think we would need more space. The location was very convenient to shopping and Union Square, but it might get dicey walking in the other direction at night.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: I've stayed here before, but on a museum package. Didn't know that that package got us an upgrade, so I expected all rooms to be as nice as my first visit with the museum package. This room was smaller but still very nice. Also really like the unlimited in and out for the valet (although that is the only option to park your car).

review.title: Fun Labor Day weekend trip
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great service, got a great deal on Expedia for the holiday weekend. Close to Union Square and public transportation. Comfortable room, very well kept.

review.title: Great Hotel by the Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Starting with the check-in experience, this was a great hotel! I've never been able to check-in a room as quickly as I did here. The room was beautiful and clean. The location has easy access to BART and a short walk to the Embarcadero. There is a nearby self-park lot too that made parking a breeze! Great hotel in a wonderful city!

review.title: Contemporary Comfot
review.reviewText:
Nice modern hotel. Staff is very accomodating and friendly. Good location in terms of shopping and some local restaurants, but the Ferry Building is a bit farther away than from some other hotels.

Always enjoy staying at this hotel. We had the "bay view," but may try the "city view" next time.

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was so helpful and nice. My bedroom was wonderful.. I have issues with sleeping and slept perfectly. The beds are not your typical hotel beds. Soft sheets and a feather mattress topper. I also was very impressed that the hotel is green and recycles your trash. The bathrooms are spacious. The walk in shower was huge and the bathtub was a nice size. I would stay here again. I really think I could of lived there.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Highly recommended. Have stayed at the Hilton Union Square, they Hyatt Union Square, and the Westin, and the Intercontinental is by far my favorite. Clean, modern, with wonderful views and a very helpful staff. This is a very well run hotel.

review.title: Exceptional luxury at an affordable price!
review.reviewText:
Since the InterContinental chain of hotels caters to a weekday business crowd, their weekend rates are actually quite competitive and affordable. It definitely is not intended to be a family or kid-focused place, but we still found it to be a relaxing getaway with our five-year-old daughter. (Warning: the minibar and water on the counter are expensive, and there is a notice letting you know that they will charge you if something in the fridge is even MOVED...if you bring kids, make sure you lay down some rules when you first get there).

Parking at the hotel was easy, but extraordinarily expensive....about 60 dollars a day! You'd be better off parking at the wharf and taking the bus to the hotel! That being said, the valets were always friendly and efficient.

The hotel is conveniently located to major bus routes, underground transit, and cable car, not to mention the beautiful and busy Westfield Mall (all within about a 5-8 minute walk).

The only thing you should know is that the hotel is located on a one-way street (Howard), about a block from a fire station. Which means that several times a night, you will hear multiple fire engines screaming down the street (at least for South-facing rooms). But hey, it's a big city, and you'd expect that sort of thing, right?

Overall, we had a fantastic stay, and if you can get a good rate, TOTALLY worth it. Just make sure you do the math if you plan to park. At 60 bucks a day, it may no longer be a deal...

review.title: Great location, comfortable room
review.reviewText: This hotel was conveniently located near Union Square, the Museum of Modern Art and lots of shopping. The rooms and beds were clean and comfortable and the staff friendly. Like lots of places in San Francisco it was also near some less pleasant neighborhoods but we didn't have any trouble getting around.

review.title: Lackluster experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was not appropriately staffed for a weekend of no vacancy. It wasn't that the service itself was bad, it was that there simply wasn't enough of it. Waits at the front desk and bellhop were around 15 mins at off-peak times. And worst of all the building's hot water was out for a day. Ugh.

review.title: A good all-round hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, helpful staff and a good location. They allowed us to check in 2 hours early and 2 hours late for no additional cost which I was impressed with. Rooms were immaculate and included quiet air-conditioning and even on the 8th floor, not a lot of noise from the road. Nice inside pool and gym with a terrace on the 6th floor to accommodate smokers! Food and drink inside the hotel are pricey but that's nothing unusual. This hotel is probably primarily used by people on business rather than tourists like ourselves which always keeps standards (and prices) high.

review.title: no windows - no fresh air
review.reviewText: no windows - no fresh air only glas covered holes in the wall - was not explained before to us - the mandatory valet parking fee was explained

review.title: SWEEEET!!!
review.reviewText:
We were there for the Jerry Garcia Rex Foundation tribute & baseball game at AT&T park. Just a happy few blocks walk from the hotel where we could see the park from our window. Also walking distance to the MOMA and good restaurants. Very friendly staff. Lovely room and great in room coffee. (The maid gave us all the extra coffee packs we wanted.)
This was one of those deals where we only learned the name & address of the hotel AFTER we booked the room. We felt it was a good gamble and would reccomend that route to anyone.

review.title: Nice hotel near sketchy neighbourhood
review.reviewText: Overall, I was satisfied with the hotel. The staff are nice and helpful. The housekeeping service was not consistent with some days having better service than others, but overall it sufficed. The room was very comfortable, but the location of the hotel does not afford the most glamorous views. The location was very quiet and the trip was quite restful. The hotel restaurant was good for breakfast with a nice buffet, but the dinner was just ok in spite of the chef winning on Iron Chef America. San Francisco has lots of wonderful restaurants so I would not return to the hotel restaurant for dinner. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities such as the spa, pool and exercise room, but did view them and they looked very nice and adequate. One nice treat was upon check-in we had a welcome platter as it was our anniversary. The bed was very comfortable as it has a feather bed pillow top. I would return again as the hotel met my expectations and the rates were reasonable.

review.title: No complementary internet
review.reviewText: I found it strange that they did not have complimentary internet. I really dislike having to pay extra for something that even a basic motel provides for free. It ended up a lose-lose situation, as I was inconvenienced but the hotel also lost out because I went out for breakfast to use the free internet at a cafe, so didn't pay for breakfast at the hotel.

review.title: Will not be back to this one!
review.reviewText: Will not be back.

review.title: Excellent SanFran hotel
review.reviewText: Good location near the BART and Muni stops. Room and bathroom were both spacious and had huge windows looking down into the city below. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Convenient SOMA location
review.reviewText: Rooms are modern but comfortable. Depending on room location, views can be fantastic. Convenient to BART/Muni and Market Street for transportation, and next to the convention center.

review.title: Excellent hotel in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful! Their service is outstanding. I'm told the President stays here when he comes to SF and it's easy to see why. The views are amazing, the restaurant was lovely, and if you can, splurge for the Club Intercontinental Room. The front desk people were professional, but not very warm. Nice pool. Request a room that doesn't have an interconnecting room door unless you want to hear your neighbors (mine had a rooster alarm that went off at 3:15am!). I stayed at the other InterCont (Mark Hopkins) and this one is MUCH nicer, although the employees and especially the doorman at the Mark Hopkins were much better. The neighborhood is a little weird as soon as it gets dark, but nothing terrible, take a cab at night. I'll definately stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco's finest - Will stay there on my next holiday.
review.reviewText:
I would recomment this city and hotel to all. San Francisco has so many sites to see, Golden Gate Bridge - Pier 39 - Cable Car experience, up the hill & down the hill. Shoppers would love this city. Malls and top name brand stores throughout the downtown. San Francisco actually has a downtown, not those huge box mall stores.
The only low parts of the city is the number of homeless. You can't walk down any one street without being asked for money from no less than 3 - 5 people. Also, the number of police around the downtown core was kind of unsettling. Even though you felt kind of safe with the number of police, you still felt uneasy with the number of homeless. You just have to turn a blind eye to that situation and you will have a fabulous time in San Francisco.

review.title: One of the Best
review.reviewText: Would stay here again. Went to a Giants baseball game and walked to stadium. Helpful staff, clean rooms, close to public transportation. Well worth a visit

review.title: Motorcycle travelers from West Virginia
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel and a great location. We walked everywhere. A plus for us - there was $6 a night motorcycle parking directly behind the hotel. It was a big hotel but we rarely saw anyone in the hallways or in the pool or fitness area. We knew they were hosting a convention and couldn't help wondering where everyone was. We would stay here again. Only down side, the room got a little stuffy a few nights no matter how low we turned the thermostat.

review.title: I was planning my return the day I arrived! A near perfect holiday!
review.reviewText:
For starters - I'm what might be called a hotel junkie; so my expectations are usually pretty high. The ICSF almost emtirely lived up to its 4.5 star rating. The staff is warm and accomodating. As I was a first time visitor travelling on my own I was fairly dependant on their advice and such. At no time did I feel like I was a bother. JD and Ray particularily terrific!
The hotel was in immaculate condition-everything was 'day one clean' and orderly.
I ordered room service two times - although the first time it took nearly an hour (on the 4th of July right after the fireworks, I guess the didn't expext the rush) - the second time the food arrived promptly. Both times it was hot and delicious with a lovely presentation on a white tablecloth with a flower arrangement.
The location is my only critique of the hotel as it borders on a fairly sketchy part of town. But if you travel north up Howard you can avoid the 'iffy' zone! The hotel does manage to be just close enough to Union Square to be easily accesible but far enough to be out of the fray.
Overall the ICSF has earned the position of my home away from home in SF. A great hotel in a terrific city!

review.title: Intercon in SOMO is Nice
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very nice. It is new. Workout facilities are great, pool is nicely sized for a SF hotel. The location is a couple of blocks from the action, but not a bad walk at all.

Everyone in the facility is great.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Bad Neighborhood...
review.reviewText: Nice Posh Hotel, nothing is free... Nothing is cheap... Bums roaming the sidewalks at night talking to themselves. Not a nice place for a vacation, but if you have money and go from your room to Valet Parking to anywhere else, it is Perfect!

review.title: v. impressed
review.reviewText: Quality hotel at an affordable price. Room was very clean and good looking, super comfortable bed was a plus . Shame it was only for one night, didn't have time to check out all the facilities within. I would definitely stay again when I'm back in town.

review.title: convenient and clean
review.reviewText: Hotel is located close to BART and cabel cars. No need for a car to get here from the airport or to get to anywhere in the San Fransisco area. Breakfast and free WiFi available at coffee shop up the street.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: See above.

review.title: Intercontinental Review
review.reviewText: Great hotel experience! Will definitely stay here again. Fairly convenient location in terms of proximity to public transportation such as BART and MUNI. Not the best food choices around, but the Westfield Shopping Center Food Court and Whole Foods are not too far away. Very friendly staff and super-clean room. Free wi-fi would have been great.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental San Francisco is beautiful with wonderful service. One drawback was no free wifi. This was extremely disconcerning especially when during one of our outings around the city I saw a Super 8 Motel advertising free wifi. Lovely rooms; however, a scary neighborhood. Our walk back from the theatre proved to be a bit frightening as there are few street lights on Howard Street as well as the sides streets leading to the hotel. Overall we had a wonderful stay. I would stay at an Intercontinental again. Wonderful attention to detail and their patrons.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel - would stay again in a heart beat.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for my wife's 40th birthday and everything was perfect. The view from the floor to ceiling windows was incredible. Every member of the staff was courteous and helpful. The concierge was the most helpful as they explained where everything was and told us where to go and what we should see. We were able to walk to China Town, North Beach, and the Wharf so the location was desirable. If you want a cab its only a 10 dollar fare. I would not walk east of the hotel at dark. A few blocks down is not the nicest area in the world. Check in staff asked if we were celebrating anything and it happened to be our anniversary so that night they gave us complimentary champagne. Everyone from check-in staff, doormen, concierge, bell staff, wait staff, and maids were all top notch, courteous, and pleasant. A great stay. The pillow top, down comforter was truly relaxing. Great night sleep.

review.title: upmarket clean hotel with great service
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a newer one, kept spotless and had very helpful staff. The room was clean spacious and very neat with comfortable beds. location was more in the cultural section of Frisco rather than the more traditional tourist area but only a short walk of a couple of blocks to the shopping Malls and strip shops of frisco.

In house dining is very upmarket and excellant quality.

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: A really nice hotel and well-equipped room - we were upgraded because it was our 30th anniversary. My only disappointment was that although the hotel was well located for the BART station and cable cars and shopping on Market Street, there wasn'r really much in terms of dining near the hotel (apart from its own Micheliin starred restaurant) though we did find a good vietnamise style restaurant in the Westfield Centre.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, one of the best I've been to. I highly recommend staying here if you are visiting San Francisco. The service was excellent, the location was convenient, and the views were amazing!

review.title: Great staff, great hotel - highly recommended
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed in the Intercontinental for a total of 5 nights whilst on holiday in San Francisco, and it was a really enjoyable stay.

We began our trip by staying for 3 nights before visiting Santa Barbara for a couple of days and then returning to The Intercontinental for 2 more nights. Our first room was on the 16th floor which had amazing views and was really very quiet. On the second part of our stay we were on the 7th floor, which was a bit nosier due to other guests. Both times we asked for quiet rooms and got them.

The Intercontinental is in a really great location, around 5 minutes walk from the Westfield shopping centre and about 10 minutes walk from Union Square and the various cable car stops. One of the best things about The Intercontinental were the excellent staff, especially Ray the concierge (I feel he deserves specific mention)! He helped us book tickets to Alcatraz and to see "Wicked" at the Orpheum, helped us check in for the flight home, gave us information on how to use the Muni and maps to places we wanted to see. A complete star.

The hotel gym was really very good - light and airy with plenty of equipment to go around, and the swimming pool was also a really good size and rarely busy.

The only downside to The Intercontinental was the expensive Wi-Fi, but the rooms were such a bargain that this isn't too bad. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would turn to The Intercontinental whenever I visited San Francisco again, which I hope will be soon!

review.title: Rude staff but generally clean
review.reviewText: After experiencing rude customer service and bizarre rules at check-in, our stay was at best mediocre and marred by an extremely long wait for room service (for two desserts only!) and we overheard conversations at the bar in which other guests complained about the hotel staff and its practices. Would not stay here again. The best I can say about this hotel is that it has an attractive bar and restaurant, and the rooms were not dirty.

review.title: would go back any time,my first choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: everything superb!!!!!

review.title: 2 day getaway
review.reviewText: i was there on a quick family trip and found the staff very accomodating, very friendly to my children. the hotel is geared more to couple/business than family, but we were made to feel quite comfortable and would love to go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Near Convention center and centrally located

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: I had a very good experience at the Intercontinental SF. The room was very clean, new and comfortable. The breakfast was very good and the services perfect.

review.title: A quality hotel choice for the business or tourist traveler...
review.reviewText: If you are on a business trip or just touring the city for a couple of days, then this hotel is a nice place to stay at. Morning buffet was delicious. Didn't get a chance to use day spa or pool, but would definitely recommend to anyone looking for comfortable lodging with centralized access to every convenience; i.e. shopping, tourism, dining, public transportation,etc. (The only negative: no free Wi-Fi...c'mon get with it, Intercontinental!) Forget about driving around in S.F. ....use the BART to get there when flying in at SFO, and buy a Muni pass to get around the city...the only sensible (and economical) way to get around here! Be sure to take a ride on a cable car during your visit...just a short walking distance to Powell street station from the hotel. All in all, a most pleasurable stay with little to no hassles...will definitely come back.

review.title: Standard fare - overpriced - nice staff
review.reviewText: What you would expect...characterless and overpriced. $28 for looking at the buffet. Must be nicer places to stay for the money in SF. Go find them.

review.title: Excellent Room
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel. The room was very, very nice, the bed was soooo comfortable. The windows are floor to ceiling so you get a great view. Can't say enough about the room and hotel, excellent. Parking is very expensive. We chose to park ourselves at the parking structure behind the hotel but that was still $36 a day. There are other lots for less ($10), they are day lots, not meant to move the car once it's in for the day ...... there's one at the corner of Powel and 5th (diag from the hotel).

review.title: Great Hotel near union square
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental San Francisco was amazing. The staff was polite. The concierge was extremely helpful. The room service was a bit overpriced, so we usually ate in nearby restaurants. Suggestions: go to restaurant Honey Honey for Breakfast (its great).

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were pleasant and very helpful. We comprised 2 adults and a 10 year old, and the staff were very thoughtful in suggesting a range of room options (including some at extra cost), which might meet our needs for a 5 night stay. Ultimately we decided to join the Ambassador Club, which gave us a room upgrade, a much improved view, unlimited internet access and several other benefits.
A couple of minor problems occurred during our stay, and the staff response was prompt and appropriate.
The hotel is very well located - just a short walk to downtown SF. It is relatively new and well appointed. We saw several rooms prior to choosing ours and they all seemed spacious and in very good condition.

review.title: GOOD LOCATION
review.reviewText: BEST HOTEL AND LOCATION AND SURROUNDING

review.title: Beautiful hotel, highly recommended
review.reviewText: High quality hotel, very welcoming staff, rooms very clean & large room with all needed ammenities,

review.title: Best hotel & Great People
review.reviewText: Awesome stay at the Intercontinental...The people there made it the best stay...Ernest and the bell staff are excellent...We will do this trip again soon

review.title: Adequate, but not outstanding
review.reviewText:
The rooms were spacious, room service food was delicious and the location of the hotel is relatively convenient for getting to/from SFO and various points of interest in the city. There were some aspects of our stay that I think will be useful to other travelers considering this hotel:

1. The hotel places a $200 HOLD on funds from your credit card or debit for EACH DAY of stay. those funds are not available to you during this period of time. At the end of your stay, your actual expenses are then totaled any remaining balance from the frozen funds are released back to your card.
2. The front desk service is mediocre. Not very friendly (although not rude) and I was surprised that no one ever even asked us why we were in SF. It would have been nice to be asked. When it comes to service, the little things count.
3. The bar and restaurant are woefully inadequate to handle all of the conventioneers and other guests.
4. Our room faced east and when the sun rose each morning, the room became hot. Not just warm. HOT. We had the thermostat adjusted to the lowest possible setting and the fan turned on "high," yet we still roasted the morning of our wedding as we showered and dressed. We were told the hotel was booked to capacity, so no other rooms were available.

While this may all sound very negative, we were not UNhappy with the hotel. But we won't choose it again. Overall, I would say it's great for conventioneers, and mediocre for people traveling for leisure.

review.title: Ecellent!
review.reviewText:
We had a great time at the hotel. Walking distance from market street and union square.

We had a problem in our room concerning the A/C, but it was fixed immediately.

review.title: Intercontinental SFO - THE place to be
review.reviewText: This was my second visit to this property; the first was business and this time was pleasure. Both were wonderful experiences and I highly recommend this property. The staff is incredible and the facilities are first rate.

review.title: WHAT A VIEW
review.reviewText: My wife and i booked a 1 night stay and we were on the 32nd floor with a view over most of San Fransisco,with floor to ceiling windows to 2 sides of the room.This executive room had everything you would need,even for a longer stay.I wish we could have stayed longer but time was against us in our attempt to see as much as possible on the west coast of the USA.

review.title: Definitely returning...
review.reviewText: I travel a lot to Frisco for business. This is my favorite hotel.

review.title: Impressed but not cost effective
review.reviewText: Right in the middle of downtown, awesome location and very convenient to every single place in downtown... 2 blocks away from Union square and all pubs and happening places in downtown... Great room and awesome view :) -ve points: Crazy parking charges inside the hotel, use street parking instead... There are no complimentary services - internet, breakfast, etc are all charged, carry your own water bottle if possible :)

review.title: Intercontinental San Fran- Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at Intercontinental for 2 nights and we were really satisfied with the service as well as the room in the hotel. It's a pretty new hotel ( believe it is only 2 yrs old)so the rooms are really new, neat and sleek looking! It's close to Union Square and Chinatown in San Fran as long as you don't mind walking for 10-20 mins. It's also one block away from Loew's theater. In terms of location wise I really like Intercontinental because it's not right in the "tourist" area which is usually Union Sqaure or Fisherman Wharf. I would recommend staying at Intercontinental if you are visiting San Fran! The service is also very good here!

review.title: Great new hotel.
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel! Only 1.5 yr. old. Very convenient(adjacent) to Moscone Center. Excellent concieres service.

review.title: Nice hotel, good value.
review.reviewText: A few blocks away from union square, but worth the walk.

review.title: Hotel worth staying at
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental San Francisco was a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing. The kingsized bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was amazing and the flatscreen TV was a nice find. My only disappointment was the lobby area. It was small and very plain. Also,I was looking forward to swimming in the pool but it was closed for repair.

review.title: Great hotel, but a lot of extra costs
review.reviewText: The hotel and its staff were terrific. They were helpful, cordial and made our stay comfortable. We were surprised with the number of extra costs, including paying for local calls, even phone cards.

review.title: Memorable trip
