review.reviewText: Very professional management, They attend any concern that yo may have immediately and they are very polite.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Cant wait to go back to Intercontinental. The Hotel was convenient to downtown BART and the Muni. The staff was very kind and helpful.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely nice. Great location and great service. The concierge was fantastic and helped us book a rental car. In general, the service at this hotel was excellent.

review.title: Impressive service
review.reviewText: We had a one night stay over en route to Sydney Australia and needed a clean and friendly place to stay. We wanted to see the trolley car and it turns out this place it almost at the end of the line. On arrival, we were upgraded to a junior suite and a roll away bed was in the room and ready to go on arrival. The staff were very helpful and it made a change from some of our other destinations in that regard. The restaurant looked top class although we caught the trolley car to fishermans wharf anyway. The only complaint was internet use was $10 per 15 minutes and the only was to get another hotel booking on our next leg was to ask the concierge (who, that said, was very patient and helpful).

review.title: Good location, Great views
review.reviewText: Hotel is well located. It is a very nice hotel with spectacular views, especially from the corner rooms, which we had. They cost a little more, but are worth it. Service was good, but not exceptional. For instance, no one was hailing cabs outside for guests. There are many good restaurants within walking distance and it is just a short walk from the Hotel to Market Street. All in all, we were pleased.

review.title: Wonderful rooms
review.reviewText: We have stayed in several S.F. hotels over the years. This one is our favorite. The older ones have a nice elegant style, but has the "old smell" that goes with the age of the hotel. This one was modern. When you walk into your room, you will notice the clean, fresh scent. Conveniently located off Market Street, you can jump on the cable cars or on the trolley to go down to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: very imprese, to be honest I did not think Intercontinental had this level of hotels
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel

review.title: Great hotel stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Been to SF lots. Couldn't ask for a better place for a quick 4 day 3 night trip---great location, clean (love the shower especially the size and lots of hot water), ample size room, efficient service, quiet, panoramic view all the way to the bay from the 26th floor, and the great deal from Expedia. Highly recommended!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: After checking in, we went to our room a found a note stating that the pool was closed for "An indefinite period of time". We were told we could use a pool a few blocks away. Sunday morning at 8am we were awakened by helicopters lifting equipment to the roof. Had we known of these things prior to checking in we would have stayed somewhere else. Concierge staff is very helpful, but front desk staff is weak and you'll get conflicting answers from them.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We were disappointed that the pool was not available and learned that it has been an ongoing problem. Perhaps they should take the photo off the website until they resolve the pool problem. The location was our least favorite of any 4 star hotel we had previously stayed at. We visit San Francisco twice a year and those few extra and extremely long blocks were exhausting. The hotel was clean but had no personality or character. With the exception of the concierge staff we were unimpressed by the service.

review.title: Without a question, worth every penny.
review.reviewText: From check-in to check-out, every aspect of our stay was perfect. There was no detail that the hotel did not want perfect for us and made sure everything was to our satisfaction. We had room service each morning for breakfast and the food was superb each day and reasonably priced.

review.title: Overwhelmed Staff overshadows the prestigue
review.reviewText: My first experience was fantastic @ The Intercontinetal - San Francisco. I love the modern, sleek styling, without it being too cold and stark. Also enjoyed is the feeling of a smaller hotel, with a cozy lobby, which does not give off the feeling of a typical business-oriented hotel. On my first trip, I was granted a very early check-in and an upgraded to an executive room which had breathtaking views. Super friendly valet and bell service, which made my first introduction to this hotel even more outstanding....I could not wait to go back. Their restaurant, Luce was exceptional and a true experience! A month later I did go back - this time for leisure. The hotel was absolutely busting at the seams. I waited in line @ 1pm for 20 min to check in, only to have them tell me my room was not ready (check in is @ 2pm, so I totally understood) - I waited around and gave a tour to my family. Back in line @ 2:15, waited for 15 min., again - no room ready! They said they would call me on my cell phone once it was ready. 3pm - still no call, waited in line AGAIN for a long while, until a friendly concierge grabbed me from line and got my room, delivered milk and cookies to my room. Attempt of correcting the situation. I am going back again this weekend - and hope service will return to what was displayed on my first journey there.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Our three nights stay was very statisfactory, good location, good service.

review.title: Perfect hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location, great service and the Concierge is helpful and friendly.

review.title: Classy, convenient and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay was faultless. The efficient and friendly staff, together with a modern and comfortable room with floor to ceiling fantastic views made our stay extremely pleasant. The buffet breakfast was delicious and the grappa cocktails hit the mark. We enjoyed walking to various SF areas and none seemed too far from this hotel. We look forward to a longer stay at the Intercontinental on our next visit to this great city.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel met or exceeded all of our expectations. The hotel staff, room condition, and amentities were all top-notch.

review.title: Million Dollar Views
review.reviewText: Upgrade to the Jr Suite was worth the wall to wall and floor to ceiling walls of glass in both the bedroom and bath with drop dead views ... made it hard to leave the room to enjoy this great city.

review.title: A very pleasant surprise for someone who knows SF!
review.reviewText: This is a relatively new hotel south of Market Street. It is extremely posh and professional, but the expedia pricing coupled with the offer of a gas card made this very affordable for us! As someone who planned law firm retreats for many years, this hotel would definitely fill the bill. The location is just behind the Bloomingdales shopping area, and close to mass transit.

review.title: Loved the hotel!
review.reviewText: It's a very beautiful hotel that is only a few blocks away from Union Square, the BART, and the MUNI. My room was very clean and modern as well as the rest of the hotel. Unfortunately the pool was under maintenance, which seems to be the case for other reviewers as well. The service of the hotel wasn't what i expected. I opened the door to my room and it was already occupied by other travelers so I had to come back down to the front desk and get another room. Also I needed a taxi to go somewhere at night and asked the concierge to call one for me and all he told me to do was stand outside and wait for one. Other than those two occurrences I really liked this hotel and plan to stay there again.

review.title: GREAT VIEW
review.reviewText: Me and my girlfriend celebrated our one year anniversary in one of their King Executive Rooms. From the 21st floor, the view of downtown, the bay, Giant's stadium, and the surrounding areas was great. We could even see a bit of the Bay Bridge! Good walking distance from Union Square (about 5 minutes) and about a 20 minute walk from the financial district.

review.title: Very nice hotel. Clean and comfortable with great views possible
review.reviewText: We stayed during july 4th break and got a nice room on the 20+ floor. Got to see a sweeping view of the bay and saw the fireworks at ATT park. Room is very clean and comfortable. We even tried out the pool and it was great.

review.title: Comfy but not very convenient
review.reviewText: Both my husband and I loved this hotel. Their bed was super comfy, very neat and clean hotel. It locates in San Francisco Downtown, supposed to be at Union Square, but it actually not at center of the town. Needs to walk a bit as nothing really around. The most disappointed thing was, the pool was closed. We actually booked for the hotel only few days before the stay. We did not recall the website saying their pool was under maintenance. One of the key factors for us to choose this hotel was the pool. Many hotels in San Francisco downtown don't have one. Closed pool really made us disappointed somehow.

review.title: Business Traveller says Best 5 Nights Sleep in a Year
review.reviewText: Amazing view from the 31st floor, perfect room amenities, a bed that, I kid you not, delivered the best five nights of deep restful sleep I have had in a year. The restaurant 'Luce' downstairs has one of the best kitchen staffs headed by a great Exec Chef made every meal a delight & healthy too.

review.title: Nice staff
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean. They had a very good amount of staff on board. Hard to find now days. The only thing I found odd was that they did not have turn down service in the evening. I would have expected this from a 4+ star hotel. But then again im picky. But over all this hotel is worth it, location is great and service is top notch

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome view, good staff, had a fun time at the Grappa bar. Room was modern and comfortable. Very famous people were staying here the same time I was. The pool was unfortunately not operational, but they were handing out passes to a nearby sports club.

review.title: enjoyed very much!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights and enjoyed it alot. We have stayed at other hotels but this one was far better. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and very modern. We had a room with two huge windoms overlooking the bay and the downtown core it was great. Recommend to stay at the end of a hallway we didn't here a peek the whole two days. We ate breakfast at the hotel both mornings in the dining room and it was very good. Two thumbs up.

review.title: I would stay again
review.reviewText: I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, it has a friendly atmosphere with excellent customer service. I was completely satisfied with my stay.

review.title: Great Hotel Accodomodations & Service! Highly Recommend.
review.reviewText: Exterior of hotel looked very sleek and modern. Interior of hotel was very clean and still smelled brand-new. Beds and pillows were very soft and comfortable. Hotel restaurant was a bit on the expensive side, but food was top-notch and high-quality. Since my wife and I were honeymooners, they provided us with complimentary champagne and allowed us to order from the Pre Fixe menu even though it was no longer offered at the time of our reservation. Concierge service was very helpful and resourceful. They recommended the best restaurants in the area and booked reservations for us, were very knowledgeable of the sight-seeing tours and excursions, and even arranged to have a taxi deliver my digital camera battery/charger to the airport after I had accidentally left it in the room. Even though the pool was rather small, the jacuzzi was nice and hot. Some of the views of downtown San Francisco from the upper floor of the hotel were breath-taking. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others staying in the downtown San Francisco area and wouldn't hesitate in booking a room with them again in the future.

review.title: Ready to Go Back Again ASAP!
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was fantastic, the beds super comfortable and plenty of pillows. The bathroom is to die for! Fitness Center was the best we have ever used (great equipment, tvs and headphones) and there were even fresh apples provided everyday. The location was super for shopping (just 2 blocks away) and the doorman was wonderful to get us cabs right away when we needed one. Check in and check out was a breeze. The room was the most quiet I've had in years. You absolutely could not hear the other guests. We are going back in December and we will definitely be staying here again. The central location was great to get wherever we needed easily and even found the street car and subway very quickly from the hotel. There was a wedding and prom going on one evening and we couldn't even tell when we walked through the lobby, which surprised us! After walking around San Francisco for 5 days we still thought this was the best hotel location by far. And it didn't hurt that it's brand new!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: As a frequest traveler, I enjoyed my stay at the Intercontinental. The hotel is in a great location with an easy walk to Union Square or the financial district. It is a bit of a hike to the Ferry Building but we did it several times. I actually prefer not being in the noisy Union Square tourist area. The hotel is primarily a business hotel but does have a very nice spa. Parking at the hotel is expensive so we parked on the surface lots nearby for around $20 a day (about a $30 savings). The hotel is kept in excellent condition and all staff are super courteous and helpful. I requested a King room but when we checked in, one was not available. We were offered the option to upgraded to a nicer room with a king for a slight additional charge of $20 a day. We opted for the more expensive room with a great view. My two complaints about this hotel are our room was a little warm and the bed was not as comfortable as it should be. I complained about the room temp but it was never corrected to my satisfaction. A hotel this nice should have better more plush beds......just about every chain I can think of in this category does. Overall we would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel for business trips
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable, with all the needed items for a good rest. However, if you plan to park your car, there are cheaper options around.

review.title: Good choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A new hotel in good location. Reasonable price during my stay. Comfortable room with view of the city.

review.title: pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The entire staff went out of their way to help and provide good service. The restaurant, where we had the buffet breakfast and one dinner, was excellent too. I think some people might find the location was not ideal but its really a short walk to Market where everything starts and for the great experience we had it was well worth it.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: We loved the InterContinental! For a small amount we upgraded our room and we were on the 28th floor with a beautiful view of the city. Our room was huge and very comfortable. Only disappointment was no bathtub. The staff were very friendly and helpful if needed.

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: The room was beautiful...the floor to ceiling windows are a great feature. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in, honestly. All of the staff members were exceedingly friendly and were always ready to help with anything. The restaurant (Luce) has excellent food, though a bit on the pricey side. The grappa bar makes excellent cocktails - the mojito was one of the best. The spa is beautiful and the service is excellent - I would recommend the hot stone massage. The hotel is well-situated...we were within a few blocks of Union Square, but we were also able to walk to the Ferry Building at Fisherman's Wharf in only 20 minutes. Overall, a wonderful hotel!

review.title: Very Modern and Efficient
review.reviewText: This hotel is very new (2008 opening) and as such as the latest features and comforts you'd expect from a large hotel chain. It was nice to see the inclusion of a HD television as well a HD TV channels and films. Service was wonderful and we were given great advice from the concierge on how to make the most of our stay.

review.title: Great stay.
review.reviewText: Great location. Great view. Beautiful room. Beautiful hallways! The stay was short, but I was very happy.

review.title: Exceeded expectation
review.reviewText: In retrospect, I may have had unfairly low expectations of this hotel. The only in-person experience I had at an Intercontinental prior to this stay was in San Juan, PR when my flight to VI was cancelled. Under those circumstances, I didn't think the Intercontinental there was anything memorable. Not so at the SF location! Frette robes, stylish and modern decor, absolutely beautiful bathroom, comfy bed, nice flatscreen, etc., etc. The lobby was also very swank and had a hip, lively atmosphere. I didn't eat at the hotel, but had a cappucino at the bar where the service was friendly. I pre-paid for 2 nights via a great deal on Expedia. At such a low price, I completely expected them to put me in a closet-sized room on the 2nd floor. Instead, I had a room on the 29th floor with a great view (with plenty of space). Over the years, I've become a hotel snob because I travel so much on business. With that high bar in mind, I would stay at this Intercontinental again in a heartbeat and told my SF friends to recommend it to others who are visiting.

review.title: Excellent sorprise
review.reviewText: Renovation area of San Francisco, close to with nice people attending you.

review.title: New hotel, excellent amenities, far away from the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything on this hotel is excellent, unless you do not want to walk a few extra blocks to get to the heart of san francisco. The valet service, is the only missing link. The service is a little bit to slow.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing! Brand new with fantastic views and a central location the allowed easy access to the Warf, the ball park and great dining! We absalutely will be staying at the Intercontinental Hotel in San Fran again!

review.title: Great hotel, great value, great place to stay
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the Intercontinental. It's a really nice hotel, new and shiny, and comfortable. It's in a great location if you are going to the Convention Center or want to be in SOMA (South of Market, a gentrifying and fun part of town). It's also close to transit, so you don't need a car. The hotel has a concierge desk which is very helpful. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel were the long lines to check in and out (and that we couldn't check out via the TV system because that feature was not working). But overall we found the hotel to be a good value and recommend it.

review.title: San Fran - south of market
review.reviewText: Our flight on United was a drag - one hour before leaving it was delayed by 4 hours. So, our 2 nights in SF turned into 1. When checking in to our hotel at 2:30am. They noticed that our plans had been cut short and offer to bump us up to the top floor, with a view. This was just what we needed after missing an eventing out on the town. And the room service that we ordered at 3am was great!! Real cooked food, beautiful views.

review.title: Very good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very good, however, the price of parking is very high.

review.title: love the hotel close to all
review.reviewText: our second stay here. always satisfied. Restaurant expensive but no complaints other wise

review.title: Poor Service at a Supposedly Quality Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel recently and was quite disappointed with the customer service I encountered at this hotel. I rate it a 3 on a scale from 1 to 10. When I checked in, the woman who assisted me didnt appear to want to help me beyond what was necessary. When I asked her to clarify something, she was less than helpful. The concierge was almost rude and short when I inquired about a particular service of the hotel and the valet seemed to be almost non existent when I sought assistance. Most of the other staff I observed seem to be impatient. When I inquired about the availability of newspapers, I was greeted by yet another impatient front desk worker. And when I did get a newspaper, it took nearly 45 minutes to arrive. Furthermore, for a near new hotel, you would think everything would work in my room. The toilet wouldnt flush correctly and it took 3 to 4 times to actually flush. And the bathroom only had a shower which was a major disappointment; you wouldnt expect to see this in a luxury hotel for the price I had to pay. The pluses are the flat screen HDTV and a pretty good view of the bay. But it doesnt reflect the poor experience I had overall at this hotel. Chances are I wont come back.

review.title: No problems
review.reviewText: Everything you expect from a name brand upscale hotel.

review.title: Would go back with no hesitation!!!
review.reviewText: The most impressive service provided was the people who worked behind the concierge desk. They were knowledgeable, friendly and completely resourceful. If they didn't know an answer to a question, they worked to find it for you. All the people in the hotel made it their business to make you feel comfortable, starting from the doorperson to the ladies who tended to the rooms. Every person in between just made it that more enjoyable and pleasant. I won't be able to go to another hotel without thinking of the high standard Intercontinental has set and now the bar is raised for all hotels I visit. You can't go wrong with this one. Don't even look elsewhere. Just book this one. You won't be disappointed.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: Nice amenities, fair fitness equipment. Close to Moscone Center and BART.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Been in better hotels

review.title: easy business stay
review.reviewText: Fabulous efficient business hotel, near San Fran attractions like SFMOMA. Bushop and bellboy service lacking the day I was there, otherwise it would be all fives.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, felt new, well kept, lots of pillows and great mattress.

review.title: Next Vacation Spot
review.reviewText: Was very nice,clean and quiet. Next time I will stay when on vacation so I can enjoy all the ammenities they offer.

review.title: European Hotel In Every Way..Good and Bad
review.reviewText: A hotel built and run in the European tradition has incredible service...equal to that seen at much more expensive hotels, as the RitzCarlton. The food in the hotel restaurant is incredible. It is very convenient to the San Francisco Convention Center(Moscone Center). Cost is moderate versus hotels with same or even less service. Service is vastly better than the Westin St. Francis. However,the rooms are very European in being small and laid out thinly, so there is not a lot of extra room, even in the better rooms. Rooms are well thought out in terms of where things are and convenience. Beds are excellent. There are wonderful showers in some of the rooms.

review.title: Not impresses
review.reviewText: The prices at this hotel too high for that kind of hotel. it was a regular hotel nothing special there but restaurant and especially parking prices were crazy. it was $53 dollars for 24 hours. I wouldnt recommend to stay at this hotel though if you want to spend money on nothing like just for parking

review.title: Very plush, very impressive.
review.reviewText: The rooms were extremely plush, clean, and well-stocked. The restaurant downstairs, "Luce" is excellent and fairly reasonably priced. Hotel staff were friendly and unbelievably helpful. Parking is pretty expensive at the hotel (valet only): $15/hour or $46 for 24 hours, but right behind the hotel is a public parking structure that is less: $30 for 24 hours (enter on Minna between 4th & 5th OR enter on Mission between 4th & 5th, right across from Bloomingdale's).

review.title: Stayed one night on the 30th December
review.reviewText: I have travelled to San Francisco every year for the last decade and normally stay on the Wharf but this year I had a change. New hotel, clean, elegant with contemporary decor. Heated in-door pool and good gym. Hotel is very central to Union Square, shops, ect. However, at night it's not the best area. Close to SOMA and on a back street, it can seem a little out of the way. I travelled for leisure purposes so for me it wasn't my best choice, but if I had been on business I would have a different opinion. They also charged me for freephone calls and $20 to check in for my internal flight on-line. May seem petty but everywhere else I've stayed I get this complimentry as a guest service.

review.title: Easy to Access via BART from the Airport
review.reviewText: We arrived San Francisco in an evening of 31st Dec 08. It was very easy to access to the hotel via BART from the Airport to Powell Station. We walked from there for just few blocks. The view from our room on 27th floor was just okay. All were buildings, shopping centers and a parking lots. However, the check-in officer was kind enough to let us go to see the other room on the opposite side by ourself. The view wasn't much different but facing the less attractive side of the city and had only bathtub without shower room, so we chose the first room offered. The room was less interesting than expected. It was furnished as modern as other 4-5 star hotels, but nothing was really special. And though we were on 27th floor, we could still hear a noise from the car running on the street at night (not mentioning about the siren screaming all nights of 31st which was exceptional). By the way, the concierge officer recommended the right restaurant to us and most officers were friendly and professional.

review.title: Great location & spa like rooms
review.reviewText: We just returned from a business/pleasure trip to San Francisco and took advantage of some great rates at this new location close by Moscone Center. We were 2 blocks from shopping, great restaurants,art galleries and 1 block from Moscone. It couldn't have been easier to get around. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the service is excellent. We look forward to our next event in San Francisco!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel and the service was great. From check-in to check-out, the staff were helpful, courteous, and professional. Location was prime. If you like shopping, Union Square is only a short walk from the hotel.

review.title: Nice new hotel
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel.

review.title: I love new!
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful. The rooms are nice, modern and very roomy. They have great amenities including robes, single cup coffee makers etc. Very close to shopping and good restaurants. I hope to go back soon.

review.title: One of the Best Places to Stay
review.reviewText: This Hotel is Brand New, Affordable, and Centrally located. There is even a self park down the block if you chose not to Valet. You will not be disappointed.

review.title: Rude bartender. Beware!
review.reviewText: Love the place and the 1BD suite is excellent. Bartender was very rude though.

review.title: Best Romantic spot
review.reviewText: What can we say! We've stayed at fabulous hotels before. This is no exception. They more about romantic dining spots than anyone in we've ever met, to the front desk staff offered everything including martini choices, this hotel has it all. The rooms were very clean and the vibe was from family friendly to uber hip.

review.title: MY FAVOURITE HOTEL IN THE BAY CITY,GREAT PERSONAL ATTENTION!
review.reviewText: This being my second stay at this hotel it just keeps on getting better.Always pay the extra for the Club and have amazing service from the staff.

review.title: Great room, great price
review.reviewText: This hotel is fairly new and still has the shiny luster of a bright copper penny. The staff were all friendly and the rooms were smaller but very clean and comfortable.

review.title: New Intercontinental San Francisco
review.reviewText: Brand new hotel. Only opened 6 months ago. Got a large room on the top floors with a great view of the city (even a peek-a-boo view of part of the Golden Gate Bridge off in the distance). Easy 10 min walk to Union Square and the start of the cable cars. Expensive to park.

review.title: Most comfortable beds ever!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. All the employees were friendly and accomadating. The rooms were perfect, wonderful beds and all the necessities in the bathroom. Really enjoyed our time spent there.

review.title: Nice get away
review.reviewText: Very nice get away and stay, I was on the 18th floor away from all the city noise, I got a great deal on the room, but with any big city everything else is expensive, I would of liked complimentary access to the internet at no charge, but there were fees for that too. The room was very clean and I liked the iPod Dock on the Clock radio so I could listen to all my music with no need for head phones. Breakfast at the hotel was average, I ate out for lunch and dinner, in fact there was a Irish Pub on the corner of 5th street if my memory is correct that was good for lunch.

review.title: Modern, Stylish, Comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is so chic! It has all the modern bells and whistles with a very personal touch. Upon check-in, the clerk gave us a lot of information about the surrounding areas and was extremely friendly. The rooms are beautifully decorated and so comfortable. And that TV was amazing! We were just blocks from Union Square and had plenty of shopping options. The only downer was the cafes and non-chain restaurants in the area closed at 7:00 p.m. and we were really hungry with no real place to find a small bite. But the room service was great!

review.title: San Francisco best hotels.
review.reviewText: n/a

review.title: Off the beaten path
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine, the location was quite far from Market Street. Hotel staff was less than friendly and helpful. I would definitely not return to this hotel or recommend it.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean, the staff was very hospitable and was even kind enough to upgrade our room.

review.title: Great hotel and location!
review.reviewText: Great lap pool, adequate gym and great staff I would recommend this hotel. The lobby is very nice. Walking distance to shopping and eateries.

review.title: You Gotta be Posh!
review.reviewText: Had five nights at the Intercontinental - couldn't fault the hotel on room comfort, cleaning, etc. Felt that requests for items such as extra dressing gown in room and extra cups, coffee sachets, etc. as there were 3 guests shouln't have to be made and when we did ask they were all ignored! For a family with children it's not ideal but location made up for the fact it was all a bit too snobby and the restaurant was no use for kids. I'd stay again but when we're a couple not a family!

review.title: Very nice hotel in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: A beautiful room, with excellent views. The hotel is centrally located with walking distance to anything we wanted. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Modern and elegant
review.reviewText: Definitely a great place to stay, re-building the area so there are some homeless wandering but overall great location to great sites.

review.title: Intercontinental
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, good service, close enough to main attractions

review.title: Modern chic in old San Francisco
review.reviewText: This almost brand new hotel was beautiful, sleek and modern. The service was excellent from the doorman to the maid. Only drawback was the location. (the bellman drew a line on the map and advised us not to walk in that direction) It was also very hard to get a cab there. We ended up using the town car so we would not miss our flight - cost about $10 more than a cab.

review.title: Good but not great
review.reviewText: Relatively luxurious, and I liked the area which is pretty quiet. Close to City Center (my view on 29th floor was right on it), Moscone and walking distance to Union Square. Hotel is great, except for the extreme prices at the bar and restaurant. The room was quite clean, except for some details in the bathroom. Problems included a broken phone which was resolved, broken scale and broken mp3 player which were not. A major pain were the elevators-having to stop up to 5 times just to get to ground level with 6 elevators is completely unprofessional. The elevators would get crammed to the brim. Additionally the gym is just ok; only about 5 machines but a decent amount of cardio equipment. Sufficient for a few days I guess. The pool is very small. They started to put water bottles in the gym, but I guess people were just taking the bottles so they just put cups out, so as to make sure people paid for the $8 water in the rooms. Staff was generally pretty friendly and helpful. Overall good, but not quite great.

review.title: Great Stay,Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was awesome. Easy to get to all city transportations. Took the BART from the airport to hotel. Cable Car is close by and muni bus. Chlorine levels seemed high in the pool & spa, and had to ask housekeeping for shampoo (miner thing). Overall, had a great time,and would definantly go back.

review.title: Fantastic Stay at First Class Hotel
review.reviewText: From the room, to the lobby, to the spa, to the restaraunt--all was a fabulous luxurious experience. I would go back in a a heartbeat!

review.title: Excellent Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: I can only give a rating of "Extremely Satisfied" because the ratings do not go higher. I know, I know... I sound like a troll who works for the company. But I am not. I was very impressed with the level of service that I recieved from the entire staff of the Hotel. The location is prime. I was able to walk virtually everywhere we went. I loved the hotel and would return again....

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: I like so much the hotel!!!!!!!! Was excellent!!! I recommend more bilingual personnel, specifically in the night.

review.title: Great Luxury Value
review.reviewText: Perfect convention spot and jump off point for San Fran amenities.

review.title: Great hotel facilities, service could use improvement
review.reviewText: The hotel overall was great - very clean, nice views, extremely comfortable beds. Check-in will take some time so be prepared to wait! Location is OK - near lots of shopping and blocks away from the cable cars. Otherwise I would recommend this hotel to those staying in the Bay Area.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Good comfort, but not satisfied with the reception service, not friendly.

review.title: perfect hotel
review.reviewText: great restaurant... room has it all...great bathrooms....great Spa a+

review.title: excellent find
review.reviewText: we got a last minute, relatively inexpensive rate at this new hotel. was perfectly located near bart and did the trick.

review.title: SF's Newest and Best
review.reviewText: This hotel opened in early '08 and is truly amazing. The hotel & rooms are absolutely beautiful. A lot of value for the money.

review.title: Would DEFINITELY stay there again!
review.reviewText: Everyone was really nice, our room was spacious and the bed was really comfortable. There is a great pool and fitness center and the location cant be beat! For a weekend I thought the price was pretty reasonable- all in all I would definitely go back!

review.title: Just a good hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and handy rooms. Located close to Union square and market street.

review.title: if all intercontinentals are like this, i'll def be booking again!
review.reviewText: We stayed in a standard room which was a reasonable size given that we had 2 double beds. the bathroom was the main delight given that there was a double shower. The rooms were very clean, as was the whole hotel and teh jacuzzi was sheer bliss after a long day exploring san francisco. The hotel staff were all very polite and imformative and we really felt that they recognised us despite there being different people on the desk, which often isn't the case in large hotels. If i ever go back to san francisco, i'll def be staying here again.

review.title: Noisy but nice
review.reviewText: Brand new hotel, so lacking in character, as with most US city hotels. Breakfast expensive ($30), Concierge adequate only. Bar too small but buzzing on the weekend. Room very comfortable with exceptionally comfortable bed. Only major downer is the proximity to the fire station which is very busy. Room soundproofing to this level of street noise is not good!

review.title: San Francisco's newest hotel
review.reviewText: THe hotel was very welcoming. We used the gym and it was well equiped, but somewhat warm and lack of air circulation. THe room was very nice and clean. The rm service was prompt. The front desk was courteous. The location is great and very close to downtown/union square and shopping district. It was close to the metro/BART station for travel to airport

review.title: Very good except the service
review.reviewText: The room is very comfortable and the location is great but I found the staff unfriendly and unhelpful. The room was not serviced on one day. It took 25 minutes to deliver a shower cap. False alarm went off at 3 am and was told to evacuate but a lot of staff didn't appear to know what is going on.

review.title: Our hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and very helpful staff

review.title: great place to stay in San francisco
review.reviewText: great overall hotel in the city close to everything with excellent service

review.title: San Francisco Intercontinental
review.reviewText: The hotel is new and the room was very clean and modern. The only problem I had with this hotel was that when we checked in, none of the passenger elevators were working, so everyone was led to the freight elevator by the hotel staff. The elevator stopped almost on every floor until we got to our 18th Floor. Smooth sailing after that. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious accomodation at a reasonable price.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Modern, clean with great facilities. Staff were really helpful and friendly. Room was very big and spotless the only criticism was that there was not sugar or milk for coffee and tea - seems odd when there's coffee making facilities, we asked for some and go sweetener. Not a major problem and the only thing we had to criticise. The pool was great - and actually long enough to have a swim unlike most hotels. I'd recommend this over the other hotels I've stayed in SF especially if you like modern.

review.title: San Frans Best
review.reviewText: The Intercontinental was absolutely the most fabulous hotel I've stayed in. The staff were by far the most gracious and accomodating ever! If you are in the area and want to be pampered, stay at this hotel...you will never forget it.

review.title: No Closet?
review.reviewText: The amenities listed included bathrobes, so I did not pack one. I was surprised to find no bathrobe in my room, and for that matter, there was no closet. No place whatsoever to hang clothes. I saw a person come out of another room in a hotel bathrobe, so I assume some rooms had robes (and closets) and it was not that big a deal to me; more surprising than anything. However, I would imagine a room with no closet could be quite a problem for many travelers.

review.title: Great hotel, needs better location
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was fabulous, except as we checked in we were told to avoid two nearby neighborhoods - one in which crack was sold, and the other inhabited by unsavory people. Other than that, it was close to the highways we needed, and the staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was great, and despite the neighborhood, we felt very safe.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the restaurant served a wonderful brunch. The service at the restaurant was definitely "The Best"

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the centre of the city of San Francisco and is close to everything. Restaurants, shops, cinema. The room was of five star quality and the service from all staff was excellent. I don't normally write these reviews but I thought that this hotel was too good not to sing its praises. Due to circumstances beyond my control, I was forced to find a hotel for one night prior to a week's stay at another hotel for a conference. This hotel turned out to be supreme to the point that I wished that I could have stayed there my entire trip. But alas, as I had already booked a hotel as part of my conference package this was not to be.

review.title: Ideally situated - outstanding service
review.reviewText: This is a new hotel which opened in Feb/March 2008. The staff service is excellent from the Bellmen as soon as you approach and enter and then a warm welcome from the frontdesk. As it was July 4th weekend, they offered us a free upgrade on the room. Absolutely no complaints. It is ideally situated for Union Square shops, only a 5 min walk round the block which means that you don't have the noise of the trams going up and down all day and night.

review.title: Lovely modern hotel
review.reviewText: Great location just south of Market street (and lots of shopping). Very modern hotel with great facilities. Highly recommended.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful hotel. We enjoyed watching the fireworks from our 17th floor window!! It was located near everything we wanted to do and the hotel itself was terrific. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: hotel stay was great
review.reviewText: just excellent the service was wonderful. would stay there again

review.title: Nice hotel...watch out for fire trucks
review.reviewText: Nice hotel...but a lot of fire trucks drive by at all hours of the night.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Lacks a microwave and much fridge space, but very nice otherwise with a friendly staff that knows the city well.

review.title: Very good location; close to everything
review.reviewText: Fairly new hotel. Close to Union Square, but not right on it, so not so "tourist-y". Good pricing, probably because it hasn't been around long(?)

review.title: An excellent hotel, with just a few negatives.
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the new InterContinental Hotel in San Francisco: the ultra-chic design, the comfortable room, the top-notch breakfast buffet, the very well-equipped health club, and the hotel's central location. The staff was cordial and helpful, but we had two problems, owing perhaps to the newness of the hotel. It took a very long time for the operator to answer on numerous occasions, and despite several calls for the bell desk to fetch our luggage, we gave up after a long wait and carried them down ourselves. Nonetheless, the InterContinental has the potential to move to 5-stars someday.

review.title: Love to go back
review.reviewText: The overall environment was very chic and sophisticated. The pool and whirlpool was quite enjoyable. The location was excellent.

review.title: Nice addition to a list of good hotels in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is the first time we booked this hotel while in San Francisco. It was a good deal, and the advertised price and amenities seemed like a bargain. Well, please do not hesitate to book the InterContinantal! This is a new hotel. The rooms are very nicely appointed. Real nice linens and bedding, nice modern furnishings and appliances. Nice flat screen TV's. The staff is suoer friendly. Breakfast buffet is great. If you don't mind being about 3 city blocks from Union Square, do not let this excellent bargain go by!

review.title: not happy
review.reviewText: i thought this hotel would be great being new and all but the beds are really uncomfortable. it was almost like sleeping on rock with a thin sheet of mattress. the view is bad specially if ur on lower floors. u will only see wall. the nicest thing about the hotel is that its a pretty short walk to union square and the staff are really friendly and also they have lcd tv.

review.title: I'm so so happy....with the hotel....
review.reviewText: long services with the coffee in the mornings...thanks..

review.title: Beautiful, but service does not match
review.reviewText: There were times that I felt like we were in dress rehearsal for the hotel to open because the service was so inconsistent. I required room service several times. The first time, I had a guest, the table required some mechanics to drop the leaf to get it out of the room. I could not figure it out. This was important because I had to call 3 times in an hour and half before I could get someone to come get it. The 1st time the recorded msg. said "Your call is important to us; pls hold..." After 25 minutes on speaker, I dialed "Instant Service", and they promised to send someone up. After 30 minutes of waiting, I tried Room Service again. There are only 3 ways to dial for a person in this hotel - Concierge (which closes @ 11), Room Service, and Instant Service (which is basically housekeeping and maintenance). Nothing in the room tells you how to dial for help with services, or the front desk, or whatever. I had another instance in which I had to dial 3 times to have a table removed. And I had another instance in which I ordered breakfast, and they lost my order. These things were enormously frustrating. But w/o question, this hotel is beautiful, spacious, efficient, and well appointed. The concierge was consistently excellent! A couple of ees w/Room Service were sincerely helpful and service-oriented.

review.title: Fantastic Stay
review.reviewText: The staff, restaurant and hotel were all wonderful. Location is fantastic, especially for conferences!

review.title: Awesome!!
review.reviewText: I have stayed in many hotels in SFO. Very friendly satff, all special request and questions we had were answered immediatly. Concierge service its 5 stars!!!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the InterContinental Hotel. The location is very close to both the BART and trolley cars. The service was amazing. Everyone from the bartender to the bell hop was very informative about the city and seemed to realy want to make your trip the best it could be.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very centrally located. Only 2 blocks from Market street and mass transits stations. High quality bedding (feather-down mattress pad, pillows, and duvet) made for a very restful nights sleep. The terry-cloth robes will make any guest feel pampered.

review.title: Clean, Modern, Convenient, Friendly
review.reviewText: My friend and I just got back from San Francisco and had a great experience at the Intercontinental...it was clean and modern. The food at the restaurant was great...the SPA was really amazing...I would totally recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great service, Not so great location
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely friendly, especially the bellguys! Beautiful and clean. Since SF is a walking city, at the end of the day, it was a bit tiring walking back to the hotel. Wish it was closer to the cable car lines. Overall, loved it!

review.title: Nothing Special.
review.reviewText: Although the rooms were clean and modern, there was nothing special about the hotel. The service was below average with a young front desk staff that were not well trained (or interested in their customers). If you are attending a conference at Mosecone West the location is the best, otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it.

review.title: No bathtub, but very nice
review.reviewText: Bed = very comfy. Sheets = high thread count. Shower = overhead + handheld attachment. Bar = very expensive (well vodka tonic = $10). Front desk staff = very helpful. Valet = speedy and friendly.

review.title: Would go back any time
review.reviewText: Brand new sleek, modern hotel. Clean, excellent service. Located extremely close to the Moscone convention center. Beautiful view from floor to ceiling windows (present in all rooms). Concierge and front desk were wonderfully helpful. Went mainly for business and would easily return in the future for vacation.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed this new hotel that had only been open three months when we stayed here. The room was very spacious and the bed extremely comfortable with a great view of the city from the 15th floor-when it wasn't foggy! The staff was very friendly and helpful anytime we asked questions. There was a very nice restaurant and bar inside the hotel. Tolietries provided,ie shampoo-conditioner, could be improved but overall great hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great new hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with my stay at the new Intercontinental in SF, the rooms are well appointed, the bathroom was a good size and I had some nice views of the skyline from my room. Having a pool and gym is not common for SF so the amenities are definitely a plus. For the price, I would definitely rather stay in a brand new property over one that probably has tired finishes. This property is perfect for convention goers, though for leisure travelers, the location is not the best, nor does the property have a hip/trendy lounge or restaurant. It would have been better if they closed off the restaurant and bar area, give it more of an exclusive feel to it rather than make it seem like an afterthought that will certainly become a three meal restaurant that no one eats at. The bar is only going to appeal to guests who merely have to stumble upstairs after a few drinks because it's small and uninspired and won't attract locals looking for a great destination spot like the W, Clift or the St. Regis.

review.title: Unfriendly & Expensive
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel to look at, and reception was great if you caught the right ones, two were very unfriendly and unhelpful. Jibbering cleaner walked into our room without knocking, She also neglected to leave complimentary cups, coffee and milk every morning, $54.00 for 2 bagels and 2 coffees. Rich city with a lot of poor people.

review.title: Fabulous hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, handsome, very clean and well appointed rooms. Nothing was overlooked in the rooms. We had a wonderful view of the city from our windows. Location was very very convenient to the downtown Market Street area.Cable/trolley cars very short distance away. Concierge assistance was fantastic, their suggestions for dining and sightseeing helped us enjoy the sites of San Francisco!! Staff could not have been more helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!

review.title: Security Problem
review.reviewText: I'll start by saying this hotel is well located and beautiful. However, I'm afraid my compliments end there. I was originally given a room that was wheelchair accessible, which lacked a vanity in the bathroom or even any counter space. When I asked to have a room with a vanity, I was put in a smaller room...with no vanity! At 12:30am after moving, I was awakened by a wakeup call from the front desk, that I hadn't ordered. Less than 2 mins later, I heard a key in my door and it opened! They had forgotten to note in their system that the room had been reserved and gave it to someone else...with me in it! I called the front desk and was told a manager would call back. Ten minutes later, after no call I went downstairs and the only thing they would say is a very robotic, "We're sorry". Don't stay here unless you don't mind sharing a room with strangers that are given keys to your room!!

review.title: Excelent location
review.reviewText: Near by Market Street and SFMOMA, great restaurants all around. Parking very expensive ($47 a night) but is San Francisco and I guess that has to be the price. I'll stay there again.

review.title: New & Clean
review.reviewText: Deserves 4 star rating for comfort, cleanliness, amenities & staff. Workout room, pool, lounge & restaurant are all first class. If you are looking for a hotel with views of the city,however, you should probably look for something else. We liked it a lot.

review.title: Nice, upscale business hotel
review.reviewText: Clean and contemporary business hotel. Good location near Moscone Center.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: Beautiful building from the outside and even more luxurious inside.

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: Brand new and physically pleasant, with floor-to-ceiling windows and relatively spacious rooms. Staff were attentive and efficient, room service was quite good, and internet access was readily available. The business center, however, leaves something to be desired - and is very expensive. The neighborhood is a bit borderline - not one I would choose to spend much time in. Nonetheless, would stay there again.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: I found the hotel comfortable and in a great location. The concierge was terrific. I would hightly recommend it and look forward ot returning.

review.title: New, Nice, Clean
review.reviewText: I'd stay again. Wine list is limited in bar but hotel is fine overall.

review.title: I hope we can stay again in it, Best and modern hotel in SF
review.reviewText: We eat, rest and had good time in the hotel No noise, modern, clean and you can walk day or night with no problem. You dont need a car to be in SF 2 minutes walking to the mall and Union Saquare.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Although we only stayed one night, we totally enjoyed our stay. We had a problem with our reservation and the staff and Expedia were both very helpful in straighting the problem out. Especially the Hotel.

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText: excelent condition and comfort

review.title: Great hotel but expect to pay for everything
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Clean, comfortable, great staff. But, you have to pay for EVERYTHING. $12 a day for internet, $10 an hour for the business center. With the price of the room, internet certainly should have been included. I mean, if the Courtyard Marriott gives free internet, shouldn't a luxury hotel. Other than that, a fantastic place.

review.title: For business only
review.reviewText: The location places it next to bustling shopping and china town but this also means everything around closes at 6 and there are tons of homeless people around. If you are going to San Fran for pleasure stay somewhere near the water otherwise for business this hotel met all my needs except for the 35 for 3 day wifi. Not satisfactory for a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Clean but small and unfriendly
review.reviewText: The hotel is very new when I stayed there, which meant clean and nice - but the front desk staff wasnt overly friendly and the room was very small. Overall, its good for a quick business trip - particularly convenient if your attending a show at the Moscone Center

review.title: Great hotel - pricey though!
review.reviewText: Since it is a brand new hotel, everything is sparkling and beautiful. I wonder how they will maintain it at these levels though. Any extra services are quite pricey. The rooms were beautiful and the service was great. The people were well-mannered and courteous.

review.title: horrible service and food
review.reviewText: bad service, very expensive food for a very low quality meal. on a plus side, the doormen were very nice. we left in the morning and when we returned at 4:30 pm our room still hadn't been cleaned. Front desk was pretty rude and unhelpful overall.

review.title: best hotel~~~
review.reviewText: please let us know that we have to do only valet parking. except that everything was great.

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Beautiful contemporary architecture and decor! Beautiful rooms with wonderful views, beautiful furniture and comfortable beds. State of the art facility with great gym, pool, spa, and restaurant. Friendly staff.

review.title: The way to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Very comfortable modern hotel. Rooms were good size for the city. Nice large bed that is extremely comfortable. Bathrooms were large with a large shower. Gotta love the plasma TV in the room. A little pricey, but worth the money. Ideally situated near the Metreon, Shopping (westfield mall), and Chinatown. Great service. Parking is wither Valet or a non-hotel owned structure adjacent to the hotel. The parking situation was the worst part of the stay, but thats expected in the area of the hotel. A little bit pricey, but worth it.

review.title: Terrific!
review.reviewText: A new hotel that had just opened in Feb. Everyone was lovely to work with. I was there with my kids for a week and we loved it!The only issue that needs working on is room service. There is not much on the menu for vegetarians or vegans.

review.title: Couldn't have been better.
review.reviewText: I've stayed at fancier hotels and boutique hotels in SF but found the staff, the food at the restaurant and our room to be excellent. We were close enough to everything we planned to do and found plenty of new places within easy walking distance. Never had any agressive panhandlers either, in fact we didn't have any near the hotel. The cost of parking is high but was willing to pay for the convenience.

review.title: Great Find!!
review.reviewText: How we wished we had more time in San Franciso? Beautiful hotel with very spacious rooms including the bathroom. We wanted to take the duvet home with us, but will settle for the brand name! Would book it again with absolutely no hesitation whatsoever.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Absolutely first rate in every category. Only bumemr is the $42/day parking charge.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: From the minute you got there to the time that you left everyone was wonderful. The staff and the rooms! I highly recommend this place!

review.title: Nice Hotel in SOMA
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with excellent service. The hotel is in a very central location to everything in SF. The concierge recommended excellent restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location. Clean, upscale and new.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. GREAT king-sized room. Spacious. Nice view. Wonderful bathroom, although the shower only has a partial door, which i found a little disconcerting intially, although things were fine because water didn't get on the floor.

review.title: Good!
review.reviewText: Good for price/performance
